21 /*
22  * BITMAP UNPLUGGING:
23  *
24  * The sequencing for updating the bitmap reliably is a little
25  * subtle (and I got it wrong the first time) so it deserves some
26  * explanation.
27  *
28  * We group bitmap updates into batches. Each batch has a number.
29  * We may write out several batches at once, but that isn't very important.
30  * conf->bm_write is the number of the last batch successfully written.
31  * conf->bm_flush is the number of the last batch that was closed to
32  * new additions.
33  * When we discover that we will need to write to any block in a stripe
34  * (in add_stripe_bio) we update the in-memory bitmap and record in sh->bm_seq
35  * the number of the batch it will be in. This is bm_flush+1.
36  * When we are ready to do a write, if that batch hasn't been written yet,
37  * we plug the array and queue the stripe for later.
38  * When an unplug happens, we increment bm_flush, thus closing the current
39  * batch.
40  * When we notice that bm_flush > bm_write, we write out all pending updates
41  * to the bitmap, and advance bm_write to where bm_flush was.
42  * This may occasionally write a bit out twice, but is sure never to
43  * miss any bits.
44  */

63 #define NR_STRIPES 4096
64 //#define NR_STRIPES 256
65 #define STRIPE_SIZE PAGE_SIZE
66 #define STRIPE_SHIFT (PAGE_SHIFT - 9)
67 #define STRIPE_SECTORS (STRIPE_SIZE>>9)
68 #define IO_THRESHOLD 1
69 #define BYPASS_THRESHOLD 1
70 #define NR_HASH (PAGE_SIZE / sizeof(struct hlist_head))
71 #define HASH_MASK (NR_HASH - 1)
72 
73 #define stripe_hash(conf, sect) (&((conf)->stripe_hashtbl[((sect) >> STRIPE_SHIFT) & HASH_MASK]))
74 
75 /* bio's attached to a stripe+device for I/O are linked together in bi_sector
76  * order without overlap. There may be several bio's per stripe+device, and
77  * a bio could span several devices.
78  * When walking this list for a particular stripe+device, we must never proceed
79  * beyond a bio that extends past this device, as the next bio might no longer
80  * be valid.
81  * This macro is used to determine the 'next' bio in the list, given the sector
82  * of the current stripe+device
83  */
84 #define r5_next_bio(bio, sect) ( ( (bio)->bi_sector + ((bio)->bi_size>>9) < sect + STRIPE_SECTORS) ? (bio)->bi_next : NULL)
85 /*
86  * The following can be used to debug the driver
87  */
88 #define RAID5_PARANOIA 1
89 #if RAID5_PARANOIA && defined(CONFIG_SMP)
90 # define CHECK_DEVLOCK() assert_spin_locked(&conf->device_lock)
91 #else
92 # define CHECK_DEVLOCK()
93 #endif

102 /*
103  * We maintain a biased count of active stripes in the bottom 16 bits of
104  * bi_phys_segments, and a count of processed stripes in the upper 16 bits
105  */
106 static inline int raid5_bi_phys_segments(struct bio *bio)
107 {
108  return bio->bi_phys_segments & 0xffff;
109 }
110 
111 static inline int raid5_bi_hw_segments(struct bio *bio)
112 {
113  return (bio->bi_phys_segments >> 16) & 0xffff;
114 }
115 
116 static inline int raid5_dec_bi_phys_segments(struct bio *bio)
117 {
118  --bio->bi_phys_segments;
119  return raid5_bi_phys_segments(bio);
120 }
121 
122 static inline int raid5_dec_bi_hw_segments(struct bio *bio)
123 {
124  unsigned short val = raid5_bi_hw_segments(bio);
125 
126  --val;
127  bio->bi_phys_segments = (val << 16) | raid5_bi_phys_segments(bio);
128  return val;
129 }
130 
131 static inline void raid5_set_bi_hw_segments(struct bio *bio, unsigned int cnt)
132 {
133  bio->bi_phys_segments = raid5_bi_phys_segments(bio) | (cnt << 16);
134 }

136 /* Find first data disk in a raid6 stripe */
137 static inline int raid6_d0(struct stripe_head *sh)
138 {
139  if (sh->ddf_layout)
140  /* ddf always start from first device */
141  return 0;
142  /* md starts just after Q block */
143  if (sh->qd_idx == sh->disks - 1)
144  return 0;
145  else
146  return sh->qd_idx + 1;
147 }
148 static inline int raid6_next_disk(int disk, int raid_disks)
149 {
150  disk++;
151  return (disk < raid_disks) ? disk : 0;
152 }
153 
154 /* When walking through the disks in a raid5, starting at raid6_d0,
155  * We need to map each disk to a 'slot', where the data disks are slot
156  * 0 .. raid_disks-3, the parity disk is raid_disks-2 and the Q disk
157  * is raid_disks-1. This help does that mapping.
158  */
159 static int raid6_idx_to_slot(int idx, struct stripe_head *sh,
160  int *count, int syndrome_disks)
161 {
162  int slot = *count;
163 
164  if (sh->ddf_layout)
165  (*count)++;
166  if (idx == sh->pd_idx)
167  return syndrome_disks;
168  if (idx == sh->qd_idx)
169  return syndrome_disks + 1;
170  if (!sh->ddf_layout)
171  (*count)++;
172  return slot;
173 }

175 static void return_io(struct bio *return_bi)
176 {
177  struct bio *bi = return_bi;
178  while (bi) {
179 
180  return_bi = bi->bi_next;
181  bi->bi_next = NULL;
182  bi->bi_size = 0;
183  bio_endio(bi, 0);
184  bi = return_bi;
185  }
186 }

190 static int stripe_operations_active(struct stripe_head *sh)
191 {
192  return sh->check_state || sh->reconstruct_state ||
193  test_bit(STRIPE_BIOFILL_RUN, &sh->state) ||
194  test_bit(STRIPE_COMPUTE_RUN, &sh->state);
195 }

197 static void __release_stripe(raid5_conf_t *conf, struct stripe_head *sh)
198 {
199  if (atomic_dec_and_test(&sh->count)) {
200  BUG_ON(!list_empty(&sh->lru));
201  BUG_ON(atomic_read(&conf->active_stripes)==0);
202  if (test_bit(STRIPE_HANDLE, &sh->state)) {
203  if (test_bit(STRIPE_DELAYED, &sh->state)) {
204  list_add_tail(&sh->lru, &conf->delayed_list);
205  plugger_set_plug(&conf->plug);
206  } else if (test_bit(STRIPE_BIT_DELAY, &sh->state) &&
207  sh->bm_seq - conf->seq_write > 0) {
208  list_add_tail(&sh->lru, &conf->bitmap_list);
209  plugger_set_plug(&conf->plug);
210  } else {
211  clear_bit(STRIPE_BIT_DELAY, &sh->state);
212  list_add_tail(&sh->lru, &conf->handle_list);
213  }
214  md_wakeup_thread(conf->mddev->thread);
215  } else {
216  BUG_ON(stripe_operations_active(sh));
217  if (test_and_clear_bit(STRIPE_PREREAD_ACTIVE, &sh->state)) {
218  atomic_dec(&conf->preread_active_stripes);
219  if (atomic_read(&conf->preread_active_stripes) < IO_THRESHOLD)
220  md_wakeup_thread(conf->mddev->thread);
221  }
222  atomic_dec(&conf->active_stripes);
223  if (!test_bit(STRIPE_EXPANDING, &sh->state)) {
224  list_add_tail(&sh->lru, &conf->inactive_list);
225  wake_up(&conf->wait_for_stripe);
226  if (conf->retry_read_aligned)
227  md_wakeup_thread(conf->mddev->thread);
228  }
229  }
230  }
231 }
232 
233 static void release_stripe(struct stripe_head *sh)
234 {
235  raid5_conf_t *conf = sh->raid_conf;
236  unsigned long flags;
237 
238  spin_lock_irqsave(&conf->device_lock, flags);
239  __release_stripe(conf, sh);
240  spin_unlock_irqrestore(&conf->device_lock, flags);
241 }

243 static inline void remove_hash(struct stripe_head *sh)
244 {
245  pr_debug("remove_hash(), stripe %llu\n",
246  (unsigned long long)sh->sector);
247 
248  hlist_del_init(&sh->hash);
249 }

251 static inline void insert_hash(raid5_conf_t *conf, struct stripe_head *sh)
252 {
253  struct hlist_head *hp = stripe_hash(conf, sh->sector);
254 
255  pr_debug("insert_hash(), stripe %llu\n",
256  (unsigned long long)sh->sector);
257 
258  CHECK_DEVLOCK();
259  hlist_add_head(&sh->hash, hp);
260 }

263 /* find an idle stripe, make sure it is unhashed, and return it. */
264 static struct stripe_head *get_free_stripe(raid5_conf_t *conf)
265 {
266  struct stripe_head *sh = NULL;
267  struct list_head *first;
268 
269  CHECK_DEVLOCK();
270  if (list_empty(&conf->inactive_list))
271  goto out;
272  first = conf->inactive_list.next;
273  sh = list_entry(first, struct stripe_head, lru);
274  list_del_init(first);
275  remove_hash(sh);
276  atomic_inc(&conf->active_stripes);
277 out:
278  return sh;
279 }

281 static void shrink_buffers(struct stripe_head *sh)
282 {
283  struct page *p;
284  int i;
285  int num = sh->raid_conf->pool_size;
286 
287  for (i = 0; i < num ; i++) {
288  p = sh->dev[i].page;
289  if (!p)
290  continue;
291  sh->dev[i].page = NULL;
292  put_page(p);
293  }
294 }
295 
296 static int grow_buffers(struct stripe_head *sh)
297 {
298  int i;
299  int num = sh->raid_conf->pool_size;
300 
301  for (i = 0; i < num; i++) {
302  struct page *page;
303 
304  if (!(page = alloc_page(GFP_KERNEL))) {
305  return 1;
306  }
307  sh->dev[i].page = page;
308  }
309  return 0;
310 }

312 static void raid5_build_block(struct stripe_head *sh, int i, int previous);
313 static void stripe_set_idx(sector_t stripe, raid5_conf_t *conf, int previous,
314  struct stripe_head *sh);

316 static void init_stripe(struct stripe_head *sh, sector_t sector, int previous)
317 {
318  raid5_conf_t *conf = sh->raid_conf;
319  int i;
320 
321  BUG_ON(atomic_read(&sh->count) != 0);
322  BUG_ON(test_bit(STRIPE_HANDLE, &sh->state));
323  BUG_ON(stripe_operations_active(sh));
324 
325  CHECK_DEVLOCK();
326  pr_debug("init_stripe called, stripe %llu\n",
327  (unsigned long long)sh->sector);
328 
329  remove_hash(sh);
330 
331  sh->generation = conf->generation - previous;
332  sh->disks = previous ? conf->previous_raid_disks : conf->raid_disks;
333  sh->sector = sector;
334  stripe_set_idx(sector, conf, previous, sh);
335  sh->state = 0;
336 
337 
338  for (i = sh->disks; i--; ) {
339  struct r5dev *dev = &sh->dev[i];
340 
341  if (dev->toread || dev->read || dev->towrite || dev->written ||
342  test_bit(R5_LOCKED, &dev->flags)) {
343  printk(KERN_ERR "sector=%llx i=%d %p %p %p %p %d\n",
344  (unsigned long long)sh->sector, i, dev->toread,
345  dev->read, dev->towrite, dev->written,
346  test_bit(R5_LOCKED, &dev->flags));
347  BUG();
348  }
349  dev->flags = 0;
350  raid5_build_block(sh, i, previous);
351  }
352  insert_hash(conf, sh);
353 }
354 
355 static struct stripe_head *__find_stripe(raid5_conf_t *conf, sector_t sector,
356  short generation)
357 {
358  struct stripe_head *sh;
359  struct hlist_node *hn;
360 
361  CHECK_DEVLOCK();
362  pr_debug("__find_stripe, sector %llu\n", (unsigned long long)sector);
363  hlist_for_each_entry(sh, hn, stripe_hash(conf, sector), hash)
364  if (sh->sector == sector && sh->generation == generation)
365  return sh;
366  pr_debug("__stripe %llu not in cache\n", (unsigned long long)sector);
367  return NULL;
368 }
369 
370 /*
371  * Need to check if array has failed when deciding whether to:
372  * - start an array
373  * - remove non-faulty devices
374  * - add a spare
375  * - allow a reshape
376  * This determination is simple when no reshape is happening.
377  * However if there is a reshape, we need to carefully check
378  * both the before and after sections.
379  * This is because some failed devices may only affect one
380  * of the two sections, and some non-in_sync devices may
381  * be insync in the section most affected by failed devices.
382  */
383 static int has_failed(raid5_conf_t *conf)
384 {
385  int degraded;
386  int i;
387  if (conf->mddev->reshape_position == MaxSector)
388  return conf->mddev->degraded > conf->max_degraded;
389 
390  rcu_read_lock();
391  degraded = 0;
392  for (i = 0; i < conf->previous_raid_disks; i++) {
393  mdk_rdev_t *rdev = rcu_dereference(conf->disks[i].rdev);
394  if (!rdev || test_bit(Faulty, &rdev->flags))
395  degraded++;
396  else if (test_bit(In_sync, &rdev->flags))
397  ;
398  else
399  /* not in-sync or faulty.
400  * If the reshape increases the number of devices,
401  * this is being recovered by the reshape, so
402  * this 'previous' section is not in_sync.
403  * If the number of devices is being reduced however,
404  * the device can only be part of the array if
405  * we are reverting a reshape, so this section will
406  * be in-sync.
407  */
408  if (conf->raid_disks >= conf->previous_raid_disks)
409  degraded++;
410  }
411  rcu_read_unlock();
412  if (degraded > conf->max_degraded)
413  return 1;
414  rcu_read_lock();
415  degraded = 0;
416  for (i = 0; i < conf->raid_disks; i++) {
417  mdk_rdev_t *rdev = rcu_dereference(conf->disks[i].rdev);
418  if (!rdev || test_bit(Faulty, &rdev->flags))
419  degraded++;
420  else if (test_bit(In_sync, &rdev->flags))
421  ;
422  else
423  /* not in-sync or faulty.
424  * If reshape increases the number of devices, this
425  * section has already been recovered, else it
426  * almost certainly hasn't.
427  */
428  if (conf->raid_disks <= conf->previous_raid_disks)
429  degraded++;
430  }
431  rcu_read_unlock();
432  if (degraded > conf->max_degraded)
433  return 1;
434  return 0;
435 }

437 static void unplug_slaves(mddev_t *mddev);

439 static struct stripe_head *
440 get_active_stripe(raid5_conf_t *conf, sector_t sector,
441  int previous, int noblock, int noquiesce)
442 {
443  struct stripe_head *sh;
444 
445  pr_debug("get_stripe, sector %llu\n", (unsigned long long)sector);
446 
447  spin_lock_irq(&conf->device_lock);
448 
449  do {
450  wait_event_lock_irq(conf->wait_for_stripe,
451  conf->quiesce == 0 || noquiesce,
452  conf->device_lock, /* nothing */);
453  sh = __find_stripe(conf, sector, conf->generation - previous);
454  if (!sh) {
455  if (!conf->inactive_blocked)
456  sh = get_free_stripe(conf);
457  if (noblock && sh == NULL)
458  break;
459  if (!sh) {
460  conf->inactive_blocked = 1;
461  wait_event_lock_irq(conf->wait_for_stripe,
462  !list_empty(&conf->inactive_list) &&
463  (atomic_read(&conf->active_stripes)
464  < (conf->max_nr_stripes *3/4)
465  || !conf->inactive_blocked),
466  conf->device_lock,
467  md_raid5_unplug_device(conf)
468  );
469  conf->inactive_blocked = 0;
470  } else
471  init_stripe(sh, sector, previous);
472  } else {
473  if (atomic_read(&sh->count)) {
474  BUG_ON(!list_empty(&sh->lru)
475  && !test_bit(STRIPE_EXPANDING, &sh->state));
476  } else {
477  if (!test_bit(STRIPE_HANDLE, &sh->state))
478  atomic_inc(&conf->active_stripes);
479  if (list_empty(&sh->lru) &&
480  !test_bit(STRIPE_EXPANDING, &sh->state))
481  BUG();
482  list_del_init(&sh->lru);
483  }
484  }
485  } while (sh == NULL);
486 
487  if (sh)
488  atomic_inc(&sh->count);
489 
490  spin_unlock_irq(&conf->device_lock);
491  return sh;
492 }

494 static void
495 raid5_end_read_request(struct bio *bi, int error);
496 static void
497 raid5_end_write_request(struct bio *bi, int error);
498 
499 static void ops_run_io(struct stripe_head *sh, struct stripe_head_state *s)
500 {
501  raid5_conf_t *conf = sh->raid_conf;
502  int i, disks = sh->disks;
503 
504  might_sleep();
505 
506  for (i = disks; i--; ) {
507  int rw;
508  struct bio *bi;
509  mdk_rdev_t *rdev;
510  if (test_and_clear_bit(R5_Wantwrite, &sh->dev[i].flags)) {
511  if (test_and_clear_bit(R5_WantFUA, &sh->dev[i].flags))
512  rw = WRITE_FUA;
513  else
514  rw = WRITE;
515  } else if (test_and_clear_bit(R5_Wantread, &sh->dev[i].flags))
516  rw = READ;
517  else
518  continue;
519 
520  bi = &sh->dev[i].req;
521 
522  bi->bi_rw = rw;
523  if (rw == WRITE)
524  bi->bi_end_io = raid5_end_write_request;
525  else
526  bi->bi_end_io = raid5_end_read_request;
527 
528  rcu_read_lock();
529  rdev = rcu_dereference(conf->disks[i].rdev);
530  if (rdev && test_bit(Faulty, &rdev->flags))
531  rdev = NULL;
532  if (rdev)
533  atomic_inc(&rdev->nr_pending);
534  rcu_read_unlock();
535 
536  if (rdev) {
537  if (s->syncing || s->expanding || s->expanded)
538  md_sync_acct(rdev->bdev, STRIPE_SECTORS);
539 
540  set_bit(STRIPE_IO_STARTED, &sh->state);
541 
542  bi->bi_bdev = rdev->bdev;
543  pr_debug("%s: for %llu schedule op %ld on disc %d\n",
544  __func__, (unsigned long long)sh->sector,
545  bi->bi_rw, i);
546  atomic_inc(&sh->count);
547  bi->bi_sector = sh->sector + rdev->data_offset;
548  bi->bi_flags = 1 << BIO_UPTODATE;
549  bi->bi_vcnt = 1;
550  bi->bi_max_vecs = 1;
551  bi->bi_idx = 0;
552  bi->bi_io_vec = &sh->dev[i].vec;
553  bi->bi_io_vec[0].bv_len = STRIPE_SIZE;
554  bi->bi_io_vec[0].bv_offset = 0;
555  bi->bi_size = STRIPE_SIZE;
556  bi->bi_next = NULL;
557  if (rw == WRITE &&
558  test_bit(R5_ReWrite, &sh->dev[i].flags))
559  atomic_add(STRIPE_SECTORS,
560  &rdev->corrected_errors);
561  generic_make_request(bi);
562  } else {
563  if (rw == WRITE)
564  set_bit(STRIPE_DEGRADED, &sh->state);
565  pr_debug("skip op %ld on disc %d for sector %llu\n",
566  bi->bi_rw, i, (unsigned long long)sh->sector);
567  clear_bit(R5_LOCKED, &sh->dev[i].flags);
568  set_bit(STRIPE_HANDLE, &sh->state);
569  }
570  }
571 }

573 static struct dma_async_tx_descriptor *
574 async_copy_data(int frombio, struct bio *bio, struct page *page,
575  sector_t sector, struct dma_async_tx_descriptor *tx)
576 {
577  struct bio_vec *bvl;
578  struct page *bio_page;
579  int i;
580  int page_offset;
581  struct async_submit_ctl submit;
582  enum async_tx_flags flags = 0;
583 
584  if (bio->bi_sector >= sector)
585  page_offset = (signed)(bio->bi_sector - sector) * 512;
586  else
587  page_offset = (signed)(sector - bio->bi_sector) * -512;
588 
589  if (frombio)
590  flags |= ASYNC_TX_FENCE;
591  init_async_submit(&submit, flags, tx, NULL, NULL, NULL);
592 
593  bio_for_each_segment(bvl, bio, i) {
594  int len = bio_iovec_idx(bio, i)->bv_len;
595  int clen;
596  int b_offset = 0;
597 
598  if (page_offset < 0) {
599  b_offset = -page_offset;
600  page_offset += b_offset;
601  len -= b_offset;
602  }
603 
604  if (len > 0 && page_offset + len > STRIPE_SIZE)
605  clen = STRIPE_SIZE - page_offset;
606  else
607  clen = len;
608 
609  if (clen > 0) {
610  b_offset += bio_iovec_idx(bio, i)->bv_offset;
611  bio_page = bio_iovec_idx(bio, i)->bv_page;
612  if (frombio)
613  tx = async_memcpy(page, bio_page, page_offset,
614  b_offset, clen, &submit);
615  else
616  tx = async_memcpy(bio_page, page, b_offset,
617  page_offset, clen, &submit);
618  }
619  /* chain the operations */
620  submit.depend_tx = tx;
621 
622  if (clen < len) /* hit end of page */
623  break;
624  page_offset += len;
625  }
626 
627  return tx;
628 }

630 static void ops_complete_biofill(void *stripe_head_ref)
631 {
632  struct stripe_head *sh = stripe_head_ref;
633  struct bio *return_bi = NULL;
634  raid5_conf_t *conf = sh->raid_conf;
635  int i;
636 
637  pr_debug("%s: stripe %llu\n", __func__,
638  (unsigned long long)sh->sector);
639 
640  /* clear completed biofills */
641  spin_lock_irq(&conf->device_lock);
642  for (i = sh->disks; i--; ) {
643  struct r5dev *dev = &sh->dev[i];
644 
645  /* acknowledge completion of a biofill operation */
646  /* and check if we need to reply to a read request,
647  * new R5_Wantfill requests are held off until
648  * !STRIPE_BIOFILL_RUN
649  */
650  if (test_and_clear_bit(R5_Wantfill, &dev->flags)) {
651  struct bio *rbi, *rbi2;
652 
653  BUG_ON(!dev->read);
654  rbi = dev->read;
655  dev->read = NULL;
656  while (rbi && rbi->bi_sector <
657  dev->sector + STRIPE_SECTORS) {
658  rbi2 = r5_next_bio(rbi, dev->sector);
659  if (!raid5_dec_bi_phys_segments(rbi)) {
660  rbi->bi_next = return_bi;
661  return_bi = rbi;
662  }
663  rbi = rbi2;
664  }
665  }
666  }
667  spin_unlock_irq(&conf->device_lock);
668  clear_bit(STRIPE_BIOFILL_RUN, &sh->state);
669 
670  return_io(return_bi);
671 
672  set_bit(STRIPE_HANDLE, &sh->state);
673  release_stripe(sh);
674 }
675 
676 static void ops_run_biofill(struct stripe_head *sh)
677 {
678  struct dma_async_tx_descriptor *tx = NULL;
679  raid5_conf_t *conf = sh->raid_conf;
680  struct async_submit_ctl submit;
681  int i;
682 
683  pr_debug("%s: stripe %llu\n", __func__,
684  (unsigned long long)sh->sector);
685 
686  for (i = sh->disks; i--; ) {
687  struct r5dev *dev = &sh->dev[i];
688  if (test_bit(R5_Wantfill, &dev->flags)) {
689  struct bio *rbi;
690  spin_lock_irq(&conf->device_lock);
691  dev->read = rbi = dev->toread;
692  dev->toread = NULL;
693  spin_unlock_irq(&conf->device_lock);
694  while (rbi && rbi->bi_sector <
695  dev->sector + STRIPE_SECTORS) {
696  tx = async_copy_data(0, rbi, dev->page,
697  dev->sector, tx);
698  rbi = r5_next_bio(rbi, dev->sector);
699  }
700  }
701  }
702 
703  atomic_inc(&sh->count);
704  init_async_submit(&submit, ASYNC_TX_ACK, tx, ops_complete_biofill, sh, NULL);
705  async_trigger_callback(&submit);
706 }
707 
708 static void mark_target_uptodate(struct stripe_head *sh, int target)
709 {
710  struct r5dev *tgt;
711 
712  if (target < 0)
713  return;
714 
715  tgt = &sh->dev[target];
716  set_bit(R5_UPTODATE, &tgt->flags);
717  BUG_ON(!test_bit(R5_Wantcompute, &tgt->flags));
718  clear_bit(R5_Wantcompute, &tgt->flags);
719 }
720 
721 static void ops_complete_compute(void *stripe_head_ref)
722 {
723  struct stripe_head *sh = stripe_head_ref;
724 
725  pr_debug("%s: stripe %llu\n", __func__,
726  (unsigned long long)sh->sector);
727 
728  /* mark the computed target(s) as uptodate */
729  mark_target_uptodate(sh, sh->ops.target);
730  mark_target_uptodate(sh, sh->ops.target2);
731 
732  clear_bit(STRIPE_COMPUTE_RUN, &sh->state);
733  if (sh->check_state == check_state_compute_run)
734  sh->check_state = check_state_compute_result;
735  set_bit(STRIPE_HANDLE, &sh->state);
736  release_stripe(sh);
737 }
738 
739 /* return a pointer to the address conversion region of the scribble buffer */
740 static addr_conv_t *to_addr_conv(struct stripe_head *sh,
741  struct raid5_percpu *percpu)
742 {
743  return percpu->scribble + sizeof(struct page *) * (sh->disks + 2);
744 }
745 
746 static struct dma_async_tx_descriptor *
747 ops_run_compute5(struct stripe_head *sh, struct raid5_percpu *percpu)
748 {
749  int disks = sh->disks;
750  struct page **xor_srcs = percpu->scribble;
751  int target = sh->ops.target;
752  struct r5dev *tgt = &sh->dev[target];
753  struct page *xor_dest = tgt->page;
754  int count = 0;
755  struct dma_async_tx_descriptor *tx;
756  struct async_submit_ctl submit;
757  int i;
758 
759  pr_debug("%s: stripe %llu block: %d\n",
760  __func__, (unsigned long long)sh->sector, target);
761  BUG_ON(!test_bit(R5_Wantcompute, &tgt->flags));
762 
763  for (i = disks; i--; )
764  if (i != target)
765  xor_srcs[count++] = sh->dev[i].page;
766 
767  atomic_inc(&sh->count);
768 
769  init_async_submit(&submit, ASYNC_TX_FENCE|ASYNC_TX_XOR_ZERO_DST, NULL,
770  ops_complete_compute, sh, to_addr_conv(sh, percpu));
771  if (unlikely(count == 1))
772  tx = async_memcpy(xor_dest, xor_srcs[0], 0, 0, STRIPE_SIZE, &submit);
773  else
774  tx = async_xor(xor_dest, xor_srcs, 0, count, STRIPE_SIZE, &submit);
775 
776  return tx;
777 }
778 
779 /* set_syndrome_sources - populate source buffers for gen_syndrome
780  * @srcs - (struct page *) array of size sh->disks
781  * @sh - stripe_head to parse
782  *
783  * Populates srcs in proper layout order for the stripe and returns the
784  * 'count' of sources to be used in a call to async_gen_syndrome. The P
785  * destination buffer is recorded in srcs[count] and the Q destination
786  * is recorded in srcs[count+1]].
787  */
788 static int set_syndrome_sources(struct page **srcs, struct stripe_head *sh)
789 {
790  int disks = sh->disks;
791  int syndrome_disks = sh->ddf_layout ? disks : (disks - 2);
792  int d0_idx = raid6_d0(sh);
793  int count;
794  int i;
795 
796  for (i = 0; i < disks; i++)
797  srcs[i] = NULL;
798 
799  count = 0;
800  i = d0_idx;
801  do {
802  int slot = raid6_idx_to_slot(i, sh, &count, syndrome_disks);
803 
804  srcs[slot] = sh->dev[i].page;
805  i = raid6_next_disk(i, disks);
806  } while (i != d0_idx);
807 
808  return syndrome_disks;
809 }
810 
811 static struct dma_async_tx_descriptor *
812 ops_run_compute6_1(struct stripe_head *sh, struct raid5_percpu *percpu)
813 {
814  int disks = sh->disks;
815  struct page **blocks = percpu->scribble;
816  int target;
817  int qd_idx = sh->qd_idx;
818  struct dma_async_tx_descriptor *tx;
819  struct async_submit_ctl submit;
820  struct r5dev *tgt;
821  struct page *dest;
822  int i;
823  int count;
824 
825  if (sh->ops.target < 0)
826  target = sh->ops.target2;
827  else if (sh->ops.target2 < 0)
828  target = sh->ops.target;
829  else
830  /* we should only have one valid target */
831  BUG();
832  BUG_ON(target < 0);
833  pr_debug("%s: stripe %llu block: %d\n",
834  __func__, (unsigned long long)sh->sector, target);
835 
836  tgt = &sh->dev[target];
837  BUG_ON(!test_bit(R5_Wantcompute, &tgt->flags));
838  dest = tgt->page;
839 
840  atomic_inc(&sh->count);
841 
842  if (target == qd_idx) {
843  count = set_syndrome_sources(blocks, sh);
844  blocks[count] = NULL; /* regenerating p is not necessary */
845  BUG_ON(blocks[count+1] != dest); /* q should already be set */
846  init_async_submit(&submit, ASYNC_TX_FENCE, NULL,
847  ops_complete_compute, sh,
848  to_addr_conv(sh, percpu));
849  tx = async_gen_syndrome(blocks, 0, count+2, STRIPE_SIZE, &submit);
850  } else {
851  /* Compute any data- or p-drive using XOR */
852  count = 0;
853  for (i = disks; i-- ; ) {
854  if (i == target || i == qd_idx)
855  continue;
856  blocks[count++] = sh->dev[i].page;
857  }
858 
859  init_async_submit(&submit, ASYNC_TX_FENCE|ASYNC_TX_XOR_ZERO_DST,
860  NULL, ops_complete_compute, sh,
861  to_addr_conv(sh, percpu));
862  tx = async_xor(dest, blocks, 0, count, STRIPE_SIZE, &submit);
863  }
864 
865  return tx;
866 }
867 
868 static struct dma_async_tx_descriptor *
869 ops_run_compute6_2(struct stripe_head *sh, struct raid5_percpu *percpu)
870 {
871  int i, count, disks = sh->disks;
872  int syndrome_disks = sh->ddf_layout ? disks : disks-2;
873  int d0_idx = raid6_d0(sh);
874  int faila = -1, failb = -1;
875  int target = sh->ops.target;
876  int target2 = sh->ops.target2;
877  struct r5dev *tgt = &sh->dev[target];
878  struct r5dev *tgt2 = &sh->dev[target2];
879  struct dma_async_tx_descriptor *tx;
880  struct page **blocks = percpu->scribble;
881  struct async_submit_ctl submit;
882 
883  pr_debug("%s: stripe %llu block1: %d block2: %d\n",
884  __func__, (unsigned long long)sh->sector, target, target2);
885  BUG_ON(target < 0 || target2 < 0);
886  BUG_ON(!test_bit(R5_Wantcompute, &tgt->flags));
887  BUG_ON(!test_bit(R5_Wantcompute, &tgt2->flags));
888 
889  /* we need to open-code set_syndrome_sources to handle the
890  * slot number conversion for 'faila' and 'failb'
891  */
892  for (i = 0; i < disks ; i++)
893  blocks[i] = NULL;
894  count = 0;
895  i = d0_idx;
896  do {
897  int slot = raid6_idx_to_slot(i, sh, &count, syndrome_disks);
898 
899  blocks[slot] = sh->dev[i].page;
900 
901  if (i == target)
902  faila = slot;
903  if (i == target2)
904  failb = slot;
905  i = raid6_next_disk(i, disks);
906  } while (i != d0_idx);
907 
908  BUG_ON(faila == failb);
909  if (failb < faila)
910  swap(faila, failb);
911  pr_debug("%s: stripe: %llu faila: %d failb: %d\n",
912  __func__, (unsigned long long)sh->sector, faila, failb);
913 
914  atomic_inc(&sh->count);
915 
916  if (failb == syndrome_disks+1) {
917  /* Q disk is one of the missing disks */
918  if (faila == syndrome_disks) {
919  /* Missing P+Q, just recompute */
920  init_async_submit(&submit, ASYNC_TX_FENCE, NULL,
921  ops_complete_compute, sh,
922  to_addr_conv(sh, percpu));
923  return async_gen_syndrome(blocks, 0, syndrome_disks+2,
924  STRIPE_SIZE, &submit);
925  } else {
926  struct page *dest;
927  int data_target;
928  int qd_idx = sh->qd_idx;
929 
930  /* Missing D+Q: recompute D from P, then recompute Q */
931  if (target == qd_idx)
932  data_target = target2;
933  else
934  data_target = target;
935 
936  count = 0;
937  for (i = disks; i-- ; ) {
938  if (i == data_target || i == qd_idx)
939  continue;
940  blocks[count++] = sh->dev[i].page;
941  }
942  dest = sh->dev[data_target].page;
943  init_async_submit(&submit,
944  ASYNC_TX_FENCE|ASYNC_TX_XOR_ZERO_DST,
945  NULL, NULL, NULL,
946  to_addr_conv(sh, percpu));
947  tx = async_xor(dest, blocks, 0, count, STRIPE_SIZE,
948  &submit);
949 
950  count = set_syndrome_sources(blocks, sh);
951  init_async_submit(&submit, ASYNC_TX_FENCE, tx,
952  ops_complete_compute, sh,
953  to_addr_conv(sh, percpu));
954  return async_gen_syndrome(blocks, 0, count+2,
955  STRIPE_SIZE, &submit);
956  }
957  } else {
958  init_async_submit(&submit, ASYNC_TX_FENCE, NULL,
959  ops_complete_compute, sh,
960  to_addr_conv(sh, percpu));
961  if (failb == syndrome_disks) {
962  /* We're missing D+P. */
963  return async_raid6_datap_recov(syndrome_disks+2,
964  STRIPE_SIZE, faila,
965  blocks, &submit);
966  } else {
967  /* We're missing D+D. */
968  // something dangerous, we assume no ASYN_PQ available!
969  int usekmalloc = 1;
970  struct dma_async_tx_descriptor *desc;
971  struct page **pgs = kmalloc(
972  sizeof(struct page*)*(syndrome_disks+2),
973  GFP_KERNEL);
974  if (!pgs) {
975  pgs = vmalloc(
976  sizeof(struct page*)*(syndrome_disks+2));
977  if (!pgs) {
978  printk("[raid456] Alert: out of mem "
979  "for storing pointers @ "
980  "%s:%d %s\n", __FILE__, __LINE__,
981  __func__);
982  }
983  usekmalloc = 0;
984  }
985 
986  if (pgs)
987  for(i=0; i<syndrome_disks+2; i++)
988  pgs[i] = blocks[i];
989 
990  desc = async_raid6_2data_recov(syndrome_disks+2,
991  STRIPE_SIZE, faila, failb,
992  pgs?pgs:blocks,
993  &submit);
994  if (pgs) {
995  if (usekmalloc)
996  kfree(pgs);
997  else
998  vfree(pgs);
999  }
1000  return desc;
1001  }
1002  }
1003 }
1004

1006 static void ops_complete_prexor(void *stripe_head_ref)
1007 {
1008  struct stripe_head *sh = stripe_head_ref;
1009 
1010  pr_debug("%s: stripe %llu\n", __func__,
1011  (unsigned long long)sh->sector);
1012 }
1013 
1014 static struct dma_async_tx_descriptor *
1015 ops_run_prexor(struct stripe_head *sh, struct raid5_percpu *percpu,
1016  struct dma_async_tx_descriptor *tx)
1017 {
1018  int disks = sh->disks;
1019  struct page **xor_srcs = percpu->scribble;
1020  int count = 0, pd_idx = sh->pd_idx, i;
1021  struct async_submit_ctl submit;
1022 
1023  /* existing parity data subtracted */
1024  struct page *xor_dest = xor_srcs[count++] = sh->dev[pd_idx].page;
1025 
1026  pr_debug("%s: stripe %llu\n", __func__,
1027  (unsigned long long)sh->sector);
1028 
1029  for (i = disks; i--; ) {
1030  struct r5dev *dev = &sh->dev[i];
1031  /* Only process blocks that are known to be uptodate */
1032  if (test_bit(R5_Wantdrain, &dev->flags))
1033  xor_srcs[count++] = dev->page;
1034  }
1035 
1036  init_async_submit(&submit, ASYNC_TX_FENCE|ASYNC_TX_XOR_DROP_DST, tx,
1037  ops_complete_prexor, sh, to_addr_conv(sh, percpu));
1038  tx = async_xor(xor_dest, xor_srcs, 0, count, STRIPE_SIZE, &submit);
1039 
1040  return tx;
1041 }
1042 
1043 static struct dma_async_tx_descriptor *
1044 ops_run_biodrain(struct stripe_head *sh, struct dma_async_tx_descriptor *tx)
1045 {
1046  int disks = sh->disks;
1047  int i;
1048 
1049  pr_debug("%s: stripe %llu\n", __func__,
1050  (unsigned long long)sh->sector);
1051 
1052  for (i = disks; i--; ) {
1053  struct r5dev *dev = &sh->dev[i];
1054  struct bio *chosen;
1055 
1056  if (test_and_clear_bit(R5_Wantdrain, &dev->flags)) {
1057  struct bio *wbi;
1058 
1059  spin_lock(&sh->lock);
1060  chosen = dev->towrite;
1061  dev->towrite = NULL;
1062  BUG_ON(dev->written);
1063  wbi = dev->written = chosen;
1064  spin_unlock(&sh->lock);
1065 
1066  while (wbi && wbi->bi_sector <
1067  dev->sector + STRIPE_SECTORS) {
1068  if (wbi->bi_rw & REQ_FUA)
1069  set_bit(R5_WantFUA, &dev->flags);
1070  tx = async_copy_data(1, wbi, dev->page,
1071  dev->sector, tx);
1072  wbi = r5_next_bio(wbi, dev->sector);
1073  }
1074  }
1075  }
1076 
1077  return tx;
1078 }
1079 
1080 static void ops_complete_reconstruct(void *stripe_head_ref)
1081 {
1082  struct stripe_head *sh = stripe_head_ref;
1083  int disks = sh->disks;
1084  int pd_idx = sh->pd_idx;
1085  int qd_idx = sh->qd_idx;
1086  int i;
1087  bool fua = false;
1088 
1089  pr_debug("%s: stripe %llu\n", __func__,
1090  (unsigned long long)sh->sector);
1091 
1092  for (i = disks; i--; )
1093  fua |= test_bit(R5_WantFUA, &sh->dev[i].flags);
1094 
1095  for (i = disks; i--; ) {
1096  struct r5dev *dev = &sh->dev[i];
1097 
1098  if (dev->written || i == pd_idx || i == qd_idx) {
1099  set_bit(R5_UPTODATE, &dev->flags);
1100  if (fua)
1101  set_bit(R5_WantFUA, &dev->flags);
1102  }
1103  }
1104 
1105  if (sh->reconstruct_state == reconstruct_state_drain_run)
1106  sh->reconstruct_state = reconstruct_state_drain_result;
1107  else if (sh->reconstruct_state == reconstruct_state_prexor_drain_run)
1108  sh->reconstruct_state = reconstruct_state_prexor_drain_result;
1109  else {
1110  BUG_ON(sh->reconstruct_state != reconstruct_state_run);
1111  sh->reconstruct_state = reconstruct_state_result;
1112  }
1113 
1114  set_bit(STRIPE_HANDLE, &sh->state);
1115  release_stripe(sh);
1116 }
1117 
1118 static void
1119 ops_run_reconstruct5(struct stripe_head *sh, struct raid5_percpu *percpu,
1120  struct dma_async_tx_descriptor *tx)
1121 {
1122  int disks = sh->disks;
1123  struct page **xor_srcs = percpu->scribble;
1124  struct async_submit_ctl submit;
1125  int count = 0, pd_idx = sh->pd_idx, i;
1126  struct page *xor_dest;
1127  int prexor = 0;
1128  unsigned long flags;
1129 
1130  pr_debug("%s: stripe %llu\n", __func__,
1131  (unsigned long long)sh->sector);
1132 
1133  /* check if prexor is active which means only process blocks
1134  * that are part of a read-modify-write (written)
1135  */
1136  if (sh->reconstruct_state == reconstruct_state_prexor_drain_run) {
1137  prexor = 1;
1138  xor_dest = xor_srcs[count++] = sh->dev[pd_idx].page;
1139  for (i = disks; i--; ) {
1140  struct r5dev *dev = &sh->dev[i];
1141  if (dev->written)
1142  xor_srcs[count++] = dev->page;
1143  }
1144  } else {
1145  xor_dest = sh->dev[pd_idx].page;
1146  for (i = disks; i--; ) {
1147  struct r5dev *dev = &sh->dev[i];
1148  if (i != pd_idx)
1149  xor_srcs[count++] = dev->page;
1150  }
1151  }
1152 
1153  /* 1/ if we prexor'd then the dest is reused as a source
1154  * 2/ if we did not prexor then we are redoing the parity
1155  * set ASYNC_TX_XOR_DROP_DST and ASYNC_TX_XOR_ZERO_DST
1156  * for the synchronous xor case
1157  */
1158  flags = ASYNC_TX_ACK |
1159  (prexor ? ASYNC_TX_XOR_DROP_DST : ASYNC_TX_XOR_ZERO_DST);
1160 
1161  atomic_inc(&sh->count);
1162 
1163  init_async_submit(&submit, flags, tx, ops_complete_reconstruct, sh,
1164  to_addr_conv(sh, percpu));
1165  if (unlikely(count == 1))
1166  tx = async_memcpy(xor_dest, xor_srcs[0], 0, 0, STRIPE_SIZE, &submit);
1167  else
1168  tx = async_xor(xor_dest, xor_srcs, 0, count, STRIPE_SIZE, &submit);
1169 }
1170 
1171 static void
1172 ops_run_reconstruct6(struct stripe_head *sh, struct raid5_percpu *percpu,
1173  struct dma_async_tx_descriptor *tx)
1174 {
1175  struct async_submit_ctl submit;
1176  struct page **blocks = percpu->scribble;
1177  int count;
1178 
1179  pr_debug("%s: stripe %llu\n", __func__, (unsigned long long)sh->sector);
1180 
1181  count = set_syndrome_sources(blocks, sh);
1182 
1183  atomic_inc(&sh->count);
1184 
1185  init_async_submit(&submit, ASYNC_TX_ACK, tx, ops_complete_reconstruct,
1186  sh, to_addr_conv(sh, percpu));
1187  async_gen_syndrome(blocks, 0, count+2, STRIPE_SIZE, &submit);
1188 }

1190 static void ops_complete_check(void *stripe_head_ref)
1191 {
1192  struct stripe_head *sh = stripe_head_ref;
1193 
1194  pr_debug("%s: stripe %llu\n", __func__,
1195  (unsigned long long)sh->sector);
1196 
1197  sh->check_state = check_state_check_result;
1198  set_bit(STRIPE_HANDLE, &sh->state);
1199  release_stripe(sh);
1200 }

1202 static void ops_run_check_p(struct stripe_head *sh, struct raid5_percpu *percpu)
1203 {
1204  int disks = sh->disks;
1205  int pd_idx = sh->pd_idx;
1206  int qd_idx = sh->qd_idx;
1207  struct page *xor_dest;
1208  struct page **xor_srcs = percpu->scribble;
1209  struct dma_async_tx_descriptor *tx;
1210  struct async_submit_ctl submit;
1211  int count;
1212  int i;
1213 
1214  pr_debug("%s: stripe %llu\n", __func__,
1215  (unsigned long long)sh->sector);
1216 
1217  count = 0;
1218  xor_dest = sh->dev[pd_idx].page;
1219  xor_srcs[count++] = xor_dest;
1220  for (i = disks; i--; ) {
1221  if (i == pd_idx || i == qd_idx)
1222  continue;
1223  xor_srcs[count++] = sh->dev[i].page;
1224  }
1225 
1226  init_async_submit(&submit, 0, NULL, NULL, NULL,
1227  to_addr_conv(sh, percpu));
1228  tx = async_xor_val(xor_dest, xor_srcs, 0, count, STRIPE_SIZE,
1229  &sh->ops.zero_sum_result, &submit);
1230 
1231  atomic_inc(&sh->count);
1232  init_async_submit(&submit, ASYNC_TX_ACK, tx, ops_complete_check, sh, NULL);
1233  tx = async_trigger_callback(&submit);
1234 }
1235 
1236 static void ops_run_check_pq(struct stripe_head *sh, struct raid5_percpu *percpu, int checkp)
1237 {
1238  struct page **srcs = percpu->scribble;
1239  struct async_submit_ctl submit;
1240  int count;
1241 
1242  pr_debug("%s: stripe %llu checkp: %d\n", __func__,
1243  (unsigned long long)sh->sector, checkp);
1244 
1245  count = set_syndrome_sources(srcs, sh);
1246  if (!checkp)
1247  srcs[count] = NULL;
1248 
1249  atomic_inc(&sh->count);
1250  init_async_submit(&submit, ASYNC_TX_ACK, NULL, ops_complete_check,
1251  sh, to_addr_conv(sh, percpu));
1252  async_syndrome_val(srcs, 0, count+2, STRIPE_SIZE,
1253  &sh->ops.zero_sum_result, percpu->spare_page, &submit);
1254 }
1255 
1256 static void __raid_run_ops(struct stripe_head *sh, unsigned long ops_request)
1257 {
1258  int overlap_clear = 0, i, disks = sh->disks;
1259  struct dma_async_tx_descriptor *tx = NULL;
1260  raid5_conf_t *conf = sh->raid_conf;
1261  int level = conf->level;
1262  struct raid5_percpu *percpu;
1263  unsigned long cpu;
1264 
1265  cpu = get_cpu();
1266  percpu = per_cpu_ptr(conf->percpu, cpu);
1267  if (test_bit(STRIPE_OP_BIOFILL, &ops_request)) {
1268  ops_run_biofill(sh);
1269  overlap_clear++;
1270  }
1271 
1272  if (test_bit(STRIPE_OP_COMPUTE_BLK, &ops_request)) {
1273  if (level < 6)
1274  tx = ops_run_compute5(sh, percpu);
1275  else {
1276  if (sh->ops.target2 < 0 || sh->ops.target < 0)
1277  tx = ops_run_compute6_1(sh, percpu);
1278  else
1279  tx = ops_run_compute6_2(sh, percpu);
1280  }
1281  /* terminate the chain if reconstruct is not set to be run */
1282  if (tx && !test_bit(STRIPE_OP_RECONSTRUCT, &ops_request))
1283  async_tx_ack(tx);
1284  }
1285 
1286  if (test_bit(STRIPE_OP_PREXOR, &ops_request))
1287  tx = ops_run_prexor(sh, percpu, tx);
1288 
1289  if (test_bit(STRIPE_OP_BIODRAIN, &ops_request)) {
1290  tx = ops_run_biodrain(sh, tx);
1291  overlap_clear++;
1292  }
1293 
1294  if (test_bit(STRIPE_OP_RECONSTRUCT, &ops_request)) {
1295  if (level < 6)
1296  ops_run_reconstruct5(sh, percpu, tx);
1297  else
1298  ops_run_reconstruct6(sh, percpu, tx);
1299  }
1300 
1301  if (test_bit(STRIPE_OP_CHECK, &ops_request)) {
1302  if (sh->check_state == check_state_run)
1303  ops_run_check_p(sh, percpu);
1304  else if (sh->check_state == check_state_run_q)
1305  ops_run_check_pq(sh, percpu, 0);
1306  else if (sh->check_state == check_state_run_pq)
1307  ops_run_check_pq(sh, percpu, 1);
1308  else
1309  BUG();
1310  }
1311 
1312  if (overlap_clear)
1313  for (i = disks; i--; ) {
1314  struct r5dev *dev = &sh->dev[i];
1315  if (test_and_clear_bit(R5_Overlap, &dev->flags))
1316  wake_up(&sh->raid_conf->wait_for_overlap);
1317  }
1318  put_cpu();
1319 }
1320 
1321 //#ifdef CONFIG_MULTICORE_RAID456
1322 static void async_run_ops(void *param, async_cookie_t cookie)
1323 {
1324  struct stripe_head *sh = param;
1325  unsigned long ops_request = sh->ops.request;
1326 
1327  clear_bit_unlock(STRIPE_OPS_REQ_PENDING, &sh->state);
1328  wake_up(&sh->ops.wait_for_ops);
1329 
1330  __raid_run_ops(sh, ops_request);
1331  release_stripe(sh);
1332 }
1333 
1334 static void raid_run_ops(struct stripe_head *sh, unsigned long ops_request)
1335 {
1336  /* since handle_stripe can be called outside of raid5d context
1337  * we need to ensure sh->ops.request is de-staged before another
1338  * request arrives
1339  */
1340  wait_event(sh->ops.wait_for_ops,
1341  !test_and_set_bit_lock(STRIPE_OPS_REQ_PENDING, &sh->state));
1342  sh->ops.request = ops_request;
1343 
1344  atomic_inc(&sh->count);
1345  async_schedule(async_run_ops, sh);
1346 }
1347 //#else
1348 //#define raid_run_ops __raid_run_ops
1349 //#endif
1350 
1351 static int grow_one_stripe(raid5_conf_t *conf)
1352 {
1353  struct stripe_head *sh;
1354  sh = kmem_cache_alloc(conf->slab_cache, GFP_KERNEL);
1355  if (!sh)
1356  return 0;
1357  memset(sh, 0, sizeof(*sh) + (conf->pool_size-1)*sizeof(struct r5dev));
1358  sh->raid_conf = conf;
1359  spin_lock_init(&sh->lock);
1360  //#ifdef CONFIG_MULTICORE_RAID456
1361  init_waitqueue_head(&sh->ops.wait_for_ops);
1362  //#endif
1363 
1364  if (grow_buffers(sh)) {
1365  shrink_buffers(sh);
1366  kmem_cache_free(conf->slab_cache, sh);
1367  return 0;
1368  }
1369  /* we just created an active stripe so... */
1370  atomic_set(&sh->count, 1);
1371  atomic_inc(&conf->active_stripes);
1372  INIT_LIST_HEAD(&sh->lru);
1373  release_stripe(sh);
1374  return 1;
1375 }
1376 
1377 static int grow_stripes(raid5_conf_t *conf, int num)
1378 {
1379  struct kmem_cache *sc;
1380  int devs = max(conf->raid_disks, conf->previous_raid_disks);
1381 
1382  if (conf->mddev->gendisk)
1383  sprintf(conf->cache_name[0],
1384  "raid%d-%s", conf->level, mdname(conf->mddev));
1385  else
1386  sprintf(conf->cache_name[0],
1387  "raid%d-%p", conf->level, conf->mddev);
1388  sprintf(conf->cache_name[1], "%s-alt", conf->cache_name[0]);
1389 
1390  conf->active_name = 0;
1391  sc = kmem_cache_create(conf->cache_name[conf->active_name],
1392  sizeof(struct stripe_head)+(devs-1)*sizeof(struct r5dev),
1393  0, 0, NULL);
1394  if (!sc)
1395  return 1;
1396  conf->slab_cache = sc;
1397  conf->pool_size = devs;
1398  while (num--)
1399  if (!grow_one_stripe(conf))
1400  return 1;
1401  return 0;
1402 }
1403 
1417 static size_t scribble_len(int num)
1418 {
1419  size_t len;
1420 
1421  len = sizeof(struct page *) * (num+2) + sizeof(addr_conv_t) * (num+2);
1422 
1423  return len;
1424 }
1425 
1426 static int resize_stripes(raid5_conf_t *conf, int newsize)
1427 {
1428  /* Make all the stripes able to hold 'newsize' devices.
1429  * New slots in each stripe get 'page' set to a new page.
1430  *
1431  * This happens in stages:
1432  * 1/ create a new kmem_cache and allocate the required number of
1433  * stripe_heads.
1434  * 2/ gather all the old stripe_heads and tranfer the pages across
1435  * to the new stripe_heads. This will have the side effect of
1436  * freezing the array as once all stripe_heads have been collected,
1437  * no IO will be possible. Old stripe heads are freed once their
1438  * pages have been transferred over, and the old kmem_cache is
1439  * freed when all stripes are done.
1440  * 3/ reallocate conf->disks to be suitable bigger. If this fails,
1441  * we simple return a failre status - no need to clean anything up.
1442  * 4/ allocate new pages for the new slots in the new stripe_heads.
1443  * If this fails, we don't bother trying the shrink the
1444  * stripe_heads down again, we just leave them as they are.
1445  * As each stripe_head is processed the new one is released into
1446  * active service.
1447  *
1448  * Once step2 is started, we cannot afford to wait for a write,
1449  * so we use GFP_NOIO allocations.
1450  */
1451  struct stripe_head *osh, *nsh;
1452  LIST_HEAD(newstripes);
1453  struct disk_info *ndisks;
1454  unsigned long cpu;
1455  int err;
1456  struct kmem_cache *sc;
1457  int i;
1458 
1459  if (newsize <= conf->pool_size)
1460  return 0; /* never bother to shrink */
1461 
1462  err = md_allow_write(conf->mddev);
1463  if (err)
1464  return err;
1465 
1466  /* Step 1 */
1467  sc = kmem_cache_create(conf->cache_name[1-conf->active_name],
1468  sizeof(struct stripe_head)+(newsize-1)*sizeof(struct r5dev),
1469  0, 0, NULL);
1470  if (!sc)
1471  return -ENOMEM;
1472 
1473  for (i = conf->max_nr_stripes; i; i--) {
1474  nsh = kmem_cache_alloc(sc, GFP_KERNEL);
1475  if (!nsh)
1476  break;
1477 
1478  memset(nsh, 0, sizeof(*nsh) + (newsize-1)*sizeof(struct r5dev));
1479 
1480  nsh->raid_conf = conf;
1481  spin_lock_init(&nsh->lock);
1482  //#ifdef CONFIG_MULTICORE_RAID456
1483  init_waitqueue_head(&nsh->ops.wait_for_ops);
1484  //#endif
1485 
1486  list_add(&nsh->lru, &newstripes);
1487  }
1488  if (i) {
1489  /* didn't get enough, give up */
1490  while (!list_empty(&newstripes)) {
1491  nsh = list_entry(newstripes.next, struct stripe_head, lru);
1492  list_del(&nsh->lru);
1493  kmem_cache_free(sc, nsh);
1494  }
1495  kmem_cache_destroy(sc);
1496  return -ENOMEM;
1497  }
1498  /* Step 2 - Must use GFP_NOIO now.
1499  * OK, we have enough stripes, start collecting inactive
1500  * stripes and copying them over
1501  */
1502  list_for_each_entry(nsh, &newstripes, lru) {
1503  spin_lock_irq(&conf->device_lock);
1504  wait_event_lock_irq(conf->wait_for_stripe,
1505  !list_empty(&conf->inactive_list),
1506  conf->device_lock,
1507  unplug_slaves(conf->mddev)
1508  );
1509  osh = get_free_stripe(conf);
1510  spin_unlock_irq(&conf->device_lock);
1511  atomic_set(&nsh->count, 1);
1512  for(i=0; i<conf->pool_size; i++)
1513  nsh->dev[i].page = osh->dev[i].page;
1514  for( ; i<newsize; i++)
1515  nsh->dev[i].page = NULL;
1516  kmem_cache_free(conf->slab_cache, osh);
1517  }
1518  kmem_cache_destroy(conf->slab_cache);
1519 
1520  /* Step 3.
1521  * At this point, we are holding all the stripes so the array
1522  * is completely stalled, so now is a good time to resize
1523  * conf->disks and the scribble region
1524  */
1525  ndisks = kzalloc(newsize * sizeof(struct disk_info), GFP_NOIO);
1526  if (ndisks) {
1527  for (i=0; i<conf->raid_disks; i++)
1528  ndisks[i] = conf->disks[i];
1529  kfree(conf->disks);
1530  conf->disks = ndisks;
1531  } else
1532  err = -ENOMEM;
1533 
1534  get_online_cpus();
1535  conf->scribble_len = scribble_len(newsize);
1536  for_each_present_cpu(cpu) {
1537  struct raid5_percpu *percpu;
1538  void *scribble;
1539 
1540  percpu = per_cpu_ptr(conf->percpu, cpu);
1541  scribble = kmalloc(conf->scribble_len, GFP_NOIO);
1542 
1543  if (scribble) {
1544  kfree(percpu->scribble);
1545  percpu->scribble = scribble;
1546  } else {
1547  err = -ENOMEM;
1548  break;
1549  }
1550  }
1551  put_online_cpus();
1552 
1553  /* Step 4, return new stripes to service */
1554  while(!list_empty(&newstripes)) {
1555  nsh = list_entry(newstripes.next, struct stripe_head, lru);
1556  list_del_init(&nsh->lru);
1557 
1558  for (i=conf->raid_disks; i < newsize; i++)
1559  if (nsh->dev[i].page == NULL) {
1560  struct page *p = alloc_page(GFP_NOIO);
1561  nsh->dev[i].page = p;
1562  if (!p)
1563  err = -ENOMEM;
1564  }
1565  release_stripe(nsh);
1566  }
1567  /* critical section pass, GFP_NOIO no longer needed */
1568 
1569  conf->slab_cache = sc;
1570  conf->active_name = 1-conf->active_name;
1571  conf->pool_size = newsize;
1572  return err;
1573 }
1574 
1575 static int drop_one_stripe(raid5_conf_t *conf)
1576 {
1577  struct stripe_head *sh;
1578 
1579  spin_lock_irq(&conf->device_lock);
1580  sh = get_free_stripe(conf);
1581  spin_unlock_irq(&conf->device_lock);
1582  if (!sh)
1583  return 0;
1584  BUG_ON(atomic_read(&sh->count));
1585  shrink_buffers(sh);
1586  kmem_cache_free(conf->slab_cache, sh);
1587  atomic_dec(&conf->active_stripes);
1588  return 1;
1589 }
1590 
1591 static void shrink_stripes(raid5_conf_t *conf)
1592 {
1593  while (drop_one_stripe(conf))
1594  ;
1595 
1596  if (conf->slab_cache)
1597  kmem_cache_destroy(conf->slab_cache);
1598  conf->slab_cache = NULL;
1599 }
1600 
1601 static void raid5_end_read_request(struct bio * bi, int error)
1602 {
1603  struct stripe_head *sh = bi->bi_private;
1604  raid5_conf_t *conf = sh->raid_conf;
1605  int disks = sh->disks, i;
1606  int uptodate = test_bit(BIO_UPTODATE, &bi->bi_flags);
1607  char b[BDEVNAME_SIZE];
1608  mdk_rdev_t *rdev;
1609 
1610 
1611  for (i=0 ; i<disks; i++)
1612  if (bi == &sh->dev[i].req)
1613  break;
1614 
1615  pr_debug("end_read_request %llu/%d, count: %d, uptodate %d.\n",
1616  (unsigned long long)sh->sector, i, atomic_read(&sh->count),
1617  uptodate);
1618  if (i == disks) {
1619  BUG();
1620  return;
1621  }
1622 
1623  if (uptodate) {
1624  set_bit(R5_UPTODATE, &sh->dev[i].flags);
1625  if (test_bit(R5_ReadError, &sh->dev[i].flags)) {
1626  rdev = conf->disks[i].rdev;
1627  printk_rl(KERN_INFO "md/raid:%s: read error corrected"
1628  " (%lu sectors at %llu on %s)\n",
1629  mdname(conf->mddev), STRIPE_SECTORS,
1630  (unsigned long long)(sh->sector
1631  + rdev->data_offset),
1632  bdevname(rdev->bdev, b));
1633  clear_bit(R5_ReadError, &sh->dev[i].flags);
1634  clear_bit(R5_ReWrite, &sh->dev[i].flags);
1635  }
1636  if (atomic_read(&conf->disks[i].rdev->read_errors))
1637  atomic_set(&conf->disks[i].rdev->read_errors, 0);
1638  } else {
1639  const char *bdn = bdevname(conf->disks[i].rdev->bdev, b);
1640  int retry = 0;
1641  rdev = conf->disks[i].rdev;
1642 
1643  clear_bit(R5_UPTODATE, &sh->dev[i].flags);
1644  atomic_inc(&rdev->read_errors);
1645  if (conf->mddev->degraded >= conf->max_degraded)
1646  printk_rl(KERN_WARNING
1647  "md/raid:%s: read error not correctable "
1648  "(sector %llu on %s).\n",
1649  mdname(conf->mddev),
1650  (unsigned long long)(sh->sector
1651  + rdev->data_offset),
1652  bdn);
1653  else if (test_bit(R5_ReWrite, &sh->dev[i].flags))
1654  /* Oh, no!!! */
1655  printk_rl(KERN_WARNING
1656  "md/raid:%s: read error NOT corrected!! "
1657  "(sector %llu on %s).\n",
1658  mdname(conf->mddev),
1659  (unsigned long long)(sh->sector
1660  + rdev->data_offset),
1661  bdn);
1662  else if (atomic_read(&rdev->read_errors)
1663  > conf->max_nr_stripes)
1664  printk(KERN_WARNING
1665  "md/raid:%s: Too many read errors, failing device %s.\n",
1666  mdname(conf->mddev), bdn);
1667  else
1668  retry = 1;
1669  if (retry)
1670  set_bit(R5_ReadError, &sh->dev[i].flags);
1671  else {
1672  clear_bit(R5_ReadError, &sh->dev[i].flags);
1673  clear_bit(R5_ReWrite, &sh->dev[i].flags);
1674  md_error(conf->mddev, rdev);
1675  }
1676  }
1677  rdev_dec_pending(conf->disks[i].rdev, conf->mddev);
1678  clear_bit(R5_LOCKED, &sh->dev[i].flags);
1679  set_bit(STRIPE_HANDLE, &sh->state);
1680  release_stripe(sh);
1681 }
1682 
1683 static void raid5_end_write_request(struct bio *bi, int error)
1684 {
1685  struct stripe_head *sh = bi->bi_private;
1686  raid5_conf_t *conf = sh->raid_conf;
1687  int disks = sh->disks, i;
1688  int uptodate = test_bit(BIO_UPTODATE, &bi->bi_flags);
1689 
1690  for (i=0 ; i<disks; i++)
1691  if (bi == &sh->dev[i].req)
1692  break;
1693 
1694  pr_debug("end_write_request %llu/%d, count %d, uptodate: %d.\n",
1695  (unsigned long long)sh->sector, i, atomic_read(&sh->count),
1696  uptodate);
1697  if (i == disks) {
1698  BUG();
1699  return;
1700  }
1701 
1702  if (!uptodate)
1703  md_error(conf->mddev, conf->disks[i].rdev);
1704 
1705  rdev_dec_pending(conf->disks[i].rdev, conf->mddev);
1706 
1707  clear_bit(R5_LOCKED, &sh->dev[i].flags);
1708  set_bit(STRIPE_HANDLE, &sh->state);
1709  release_stripe(sh);
1710 }
