1712 
1713 static sector_t compute_blocknr(struct stripe_head *sh, int i, int previous);
1714 
1715 static void raid5_build_block(struct stripe_head *sh, int i, int previous)
1716 {
1717  struct r5dev *dev = &sh->dev[i];
1718 
1719  bio_init(&dev->req);
1720  dev->req.bi_io_vec = &dev->vec;
1721  dev->req.bi_vcnt++;
1722  dev->req.bi_max_vecs++;
1723  dev->vec.bv_page = dev->page;
1724  dev->vec.bv_len = STRIPE_SIZE;
1725  dev->vec.bv_offset = 0;
1726 
1727  dev->req.bi_sector = sh->sector;
1728  dev->req.bi_private = sh;
1729 
1730  dev->flags = 0;
1731  dev->sector = compute_blocknr(sh, i, previous);
1732 }
1733 
1734 static void error(mddev_t *mddev, mdk_rdev_t *rdev)
1735 {
1736  char b[BDEVNAME_SIZE];
1737  raid5_conf_t *conf = mddev->private;
1738  pr_debug("raid456: error called\n");
1739 
1740  if (!test_bit(Faulty, &rdev->flags)) {
1741  set_bit(MD_CHANGE_DEVS, &mddev->flags);
1742  if (test_and_clear_bit(In_sync, &rdev->flags)) {
1743  unsigned long flags;
1744  spin_lock_irqsave(&conf->device_lock, flags);
1745  mddev->degraded++;
1746  spin_unlock_irqrestore(&conf->device_lock, flags);
1747  /*
1748  * if recovery was running, make sure it aborts.
1749  */
1750  set_bit(MD_RECOVERY_INTR, &mddev->recovery);
1751  }
1752  set_bit(Faulty, &rdev->flags);
1753  printk(KERN_ALERT
1754  "md/raid:%s: Disk failure on %s, disabling device.\n"
1755  "md/raid:%s: Operation continuing on %d devices.\n",
1756  mdname(mddev),
1757  bdevname(rdev->bdev, b),
1758  mdname(mddev),
1759  conf->raid_disks - mddev->degraded);
1760  }
1761 }
1762 
1763 /*
1764  * Input: a 'big' sector number,
1765  * Output: index of the data and parity disk, and the sector # in them.
1766  */
1767 static sector_t raid5_compute_sector(raid5_conf_t *conf, sector_t r_sector,
1768  int previous, int *dd_idx,
1769  struct stripe_head *sh)
1770 {
1771  sector_t stripe, stripe2;
1772  sector_t chunk_number;
1773  unsigned int chunk_offset;
1774  int pd_idx, qd_idx;
1775  int ddf_layout = 0;
1776  sector_t new_sector;
1777  int algorithm = previous ? conf->prev_algo
1778  : conf->algorithm;
1779  int sectors_per_chunk = previous ? conf->prev_chunk_sectors
1780  : conf->chunk_sectors;
1781  int raid_disks = previous ? conf->previous_raid_disks
1782  : conf->raid_disks;
1783  int data_disks = raid_disks - conf->max_degraded;
1784 
1785  /* First compute the information on this sector */
1786 
1787  /*
1788  * Compute the chunk number and the sector offset inside the chunk
1789  */
1790  chunk_offset = sector_div(r_sector, sectors_per_chunk);
1791  chunk_number = r_sector;
1792 
1793  /*
1794  * Compute the stripe number
1795  */
1796  stripe = chunk_number;
1797  *dd_idx = sector_div(stripe, data_disks);
1798  stripe2 = stripe;
1799  /*
1800  * Select the parity disk based on the user selected algorithm.
1801  */
1802  pd_idx = qd_idx = ~0;
1803  switch(conf->level) {
1804  case 4:
1805  pd_idx = data_disks;
1806  break;
1807  case 5:
1808  switch (algorithm) {
1809  case ALGORITHM_LEFT_ASYMMETRIC:
1810  pd_idx = data_disks - sector_div(stripe2, raid_disks);
1811  if (*dd_idx >= pd_idx)
1812  (*dd_idx)++;
1813  break;
1814  case ALGORITHM_RIGHT_ASYMMETRIC:
1815  pd_idx = sector_div(stripe2, raid_disks);
1816  if (*dd_idx >= pd_idx)
1817  (*dd_idx)++;
1818  break;
1819  case ALGORITHM_LEFT_SYMMETRIC:
1820  pd_idx = data_disks - sector_div(stripe2, raid_disks);
1821  *dd_idx = (pd_idx + 1 + *dd_idx) % raid_disks;
1822  break;
1823  case ALGORITHM_RIGHT_SYMMETRIC:
1824  pd_idx = sector_div(stripe2, raid_disks);
1825  *dd_idx = (pd_idx + 1 + *dd_idx) % raid_disks;
1826  break;
1827  case ALGORITHM_PARITY_0:
1828  pd_idx = 0;
1829  (*dd_idx)++;
1830  break;
1831  case ALGORITHM_PARITY_N:
1832  pd_idx = data_disks;
1833  break;
1834  default:
1835  BUG();
1836  }
1837  break;
1838  case 6:
1839 
1840  switch (algorithm) {
1841  case ALGORITHM_LEFT_ASYMMETRIC:
1842  pd_idx = raid_disks - 1 - sector_div(stripe2, raid_disks);
1843  qd_idx = pd_idx + 1;
1844  if (pd_idx == raid_disks-1) {
1845  (*dd_idx)++; /* Q D D D P */
1846  qd_idx = 0;
1847  } else if (*dd_idx >= pd_idx)
1848  (*dd_idx) += 2; /* D D P Q D */
1849  break;
1850  case ALGORITHM_RIGHT_ASYMMETRIC:
1851  pd_idx = sector_div(stripe2, raid_disks);
1852  qd_idx = pd_idx + 1;
1853  if (pd_idx == raid_disks-1) {
1854  (*dd_idx)++; /* Q D D D P */
1855  qd_idx = 0;
1856  } else if (*dd_idx >= pd_idx)
1857  (*dd_idx) += 2; /* D D P Q D */
1858  break;
1859  case ALGORITHM_LEFT_SYMMETRIC:
1860  pd_idx = raid_disks - 1 - sector_div(stripe2, raid_disks);
1861  qd_idx = (pd_idx + 1) % raid_disks;
1862  *dd_idx = (pd_idx + 2 + *dd_idx) % raid_disks;
1863  break;
1864  case ALGORITHM_RIGHT_SYMMETRIC:
1865  pd_idx = sector_div(stripe2, raid_disks);
1866  qd_idx = (pd_idx + 1) % raid_disks;
1867  *dd_idx = (pd_idx + 2 + *dd_idx) % raid_disks;
1868  break;
1869 
1870  case ALGORITHM_PARITY_0:
1871  pd_idx = 0;
1872  qd_idx = 1;
1873  (*dd_idx) += 2;
1874  break;
1875  case ALGORITHM_PARITY_N:
1876  pd_idx = data_disks;
1877  qd_idx = data_disks + 1;
1878  break;
1879 
1880  case ALGORITHM_ROTATING_ZERO_RESTART:
1881  /* Exactly the same as RIGHT_ASYMMETRIC, but or
1882  * of blocks for computing Q is different.
1883  */
1884  pd_idx = sector_div(stripe2, raid_disks);
1885  qd_idx = pd_idx + 1;
1886  if (pd_idx == raid_disks-1) {
1887  (*dd_idx)++; /* Q D D D P */
1888  qd_idx = 0;
1889  } else if (*dd_idx >= pd_idx)
1890  (*dd_idx) += 2; /* D D P Q D */
1891  ddf_layout = 1;
1892  break;
1893 
1894  case ALGORITHM_ROTATING_N_RESTART:
1895  /* Same a left_asymmetric, by first stripe is
1896  * D D D P Q rather than
1897  * Q D D D P
1898  */
1899  stripe2 += 1;
1900  pd_idx = raid_disks - 1 - sector_div(stripe2, raid_disks);
1901  qd_idx = pd_idx + 1;
1902  if (pd_idx == raid_disks-1) {
1903  (*dd_idx)++; /* Q D D D P */
1904  qd_idx = 0;
1905  } else if (*dd_idx >= pd_idx)
1906  (*dd_idx) += 2; /* D D P Q D */
1907  ddf_layout = 1;
1908  break;
1909 
1910  case ALGORITHM_ROTATING_N_CONTINUE:
1911  /* Same as left_symmetric but Q is before P */
1912  pd_idx = raid_disks - 1 - sector_div(stripe2, raid_disks);
1913  qd_idx = (pd_idx + raid_disks - 1) % raid_disks;
1914  *dd_idx = (pd_idx + 1 + *dd_idx) % raid_disks;
1915  ddf_layout = 1;
1916  break;
1917 
1918  case ALGORITHM_LEFT_ASYMMETRIC_6:
1919  /* RAID5 left_asymmetric, with Q on last device */
1920  pd_idx = data_disks - sector_div(stripe2, raid_disks-1);
1921  if (*dd_idx >= pd_idx)
1922  (*dd_idx)++;
1923  qd_idx = raid_disks - 1;
1924  break;
1925 
1926  case ALGORITHM_RIGHT_ASYMMETRIC_6:
1927  pd_idx = sector_div(stripe2, raid_disks-1);
1928  if (*dd_idx >= pd_idx)
1929  (*dd_idx)++;
1930  qd_idx = raid_disks - 1;
1931  break;
1932 
1933  case ALGORITHM_LEFT_SYMMETRIC_6:
1934  pd_idx = data_disks - sector_div(stripe2, raid_disks-1);
1935  *dd_idx = (pd_idx + 1 + *dd_idx) % (raid_disks-1);
1936  qd_idx = raid_disks - 1;
1937  break;
1938 
1939  case ALGORITHM_RIGHT_SYMMETRIC_6:
1940  pd_idx = sector_div(stripe2, raid_disks-1);
1941  *dd_idx = (pd_idx + 1 + *dd_idx) % (raid_disks-1);
1942  qd_idx = raid_disks - 1;
1943  break;
1944 
1945  case ALGORITHM_PARITY_0_6:
1946  pd_idx = 0;
1947  (*dd_idx)++;
1948  qd_idx = raid_disks - 1;
1949  break;
1950 
1951  default:
1952  BUG();
1953  }
1954  break;
1955  }
1956 
1957  if (sh) {
1958  sh->pd_idx = pd_idx;
1959  sh->qd_idx = qd_idx;
1960  sh->ddf_layout = ddf_layout;
1961  }
1962  /*
1963  * Finally, compute the new sector number
1964  */
1965  new_sector = (sector_t)stripe * sectors_per_chunk + chunk_offset;
1966  return new_sector;
1967 }
1968 
1969 
1970 static sector_t compute_blocknr(struct stripe_head *sh, int i, int previous)
1971 {
1972  raid5_conf_t *conf = sh->raid_conf;
1973  int raid_disks = sh->disks;
1974  int data_disks = raid_disks - conf->max_degraded;
1975  sector_t new_sector = sh->sector, check;
1976  int sectors_per_chunk = previous ? conf->prev_chunk_sectors
1977  : conf->chunk_sectors;
1978  int algorithm = previous ? conf->prev_algo
1979  : conf->algorithm;
1980  sector_t stripe;
1981  int chunk_offset;
1982  sector_t chunk_number;
1983  int dummy1, dd_idx = i;
1984  sector_t r_sector;
1985  struct stripe_head sh2;
1986 
1987 
1988  chunk_offset = sector_div(new_sector, sectors_per_chunk);
1989  stripe = new_sector;
1990 
1991  if (i == sh->pd_idx)
1992  return 0;
1993  switch(conf->level) {
1994  case 4: break;
1995  case 5:
1996  switch (algorithm) {
1997  case ALGORITHM_LEFT_ASYMMETRIC:
1998  case ALGORITHM_RIGHT_ASYMMETRIC:
1999  if (i > sh->pd_idx)
2000  i--;
2001  break;
2002  case ALGORITHM_LEFT_SYMMETRIC:
2003  case ALGORITHM_RIGHT_SYMMETRIC:
2004  if (i < sh->pd_idx)
2005  i += raid_disks;
2006  i -= (sh->pd_idx + 1);
2007  break;
2008  case ALGORITHM_PARITY_0:
2009  i -= 1;
2010  break;
2011  case ALGORITHM_PARITY_N:
2012  break;
2013  default:
2014  BUG();
2015  }
2016  break;
2017  case 6:
2018  if (i == sh->qd_idx)
2019  return 0; /* It is the Q disk */
2020  switch (algorithm) {
2021  case ALGORITHM_LEFT_ASYMMETRIC:
2022  case ALGORITHM_RIGHT_ASYMMETRIC:
2023  case ALGORITHM_ROTATING_ZERO_RESTART:
2024  case ALGORITHM_ROTATING_N_RESTART:
2025  if (sh->pd_idx == raid_disks-1)
2026  i--; /* Q D D D P */
2027  else if (i > sh->pd_idx)
2028  i -= 2; /* D D P Q D */
2029  break;
2030  case ALGORITHM_LEFT_SYMMETRIC:
2031  case ALGORITHM_RIGHT_SYMMETRIC:
2032  if (sh->pd_idx == raid_disks-1)
2033  i--; /* Q D D D P */
2034  else {
2035  /* D D P Q D */
2036  if (i < sh->pd_idx)
2037  i += raid_disks;
2038  i -= (sh->pd_idx + 2);
2039  }
2040  break;
2041  case ALGORITHM_PARITY_0:
2042  i -= 2;
2043  break;
2044  case ALGORITHM_PARITY_N:
2045  break;
2046  case ALGORITHM_ROTATING_N_CONTINUE:
2047  /* Like left_symmetric, but P is before Q */
2048  if (sh->pd_idx == 0)
2049  i--; /* P D D D Q */
2050  else {
2051  /* D D Q P D */
2052  if (i < sh->pd_idx)
2053  i += raid_disks;
2054  i -= (sh->pd_idx + 1);
2055  }
2056  break;
2057  case ALGORITHM_LEFT_ASYMMETRIC_6:
2058  case ALGORITHM_RIGHT_ASYMMETRIC_6:
2059  if (i > sh->pd_idx)
2060  i--;
2061  break;
2062  case ALGORITHM_LEFT_SYMMETRIC_6:
2063  case ALGORITHM_RIGHT_SYMMETRIC_6:
2064  if (i < sh->pd_idx)
2065  i += data_disks + 1;
2066  i -= (sh->pd_idx + 1);
2067  break;
2068  case ALGORITHM_PARITY_0_6:
2069  i -= 1;
2070  break;
2071  default:
2072  BUG();
2073  }
2074  break;
2075  }
2076 
2077  chunk_number = stripe * data_disks + i;
2078  r_sector = chunk_number * sectors_per_chunk + chunk_offset;
2079 
2080  check = raid5_compute_sector(conf, r_sector,
2081  previous, &dummy1, &sh2);
2082  if (check != sh->sector || dummy1 != dd_idx || sh2.pd_idx != sh->pd_idx
2083  || sh2.qd_idx != sh->qd_idx) {
2084  printk(KERN_ERR "md/raid:%s: compute_blocknr: map not correct\n",
2085  mdname(conf->mddev));
2086  return 0;
2087  }
2088  return r_sector;
2089 }
2090 
2091 
2092 static void
2093 schedule_reconstruction(struct stripe_head *sh, struct stripe_head_state *s,
2094  int rcw, int expand)
2095 {
2096  int i, pd_idx = sh->pd_idx, disks = sh->disks;
2097  raid5_conf_t *conf = sh->raid_conf;
2098  int level = conf->level;
2099 
2100  if (rcw) {
2101  /* if we are not expanding this is a proper write request, and
2102  * there will be bios with new data to be drained into the
2103  * stripe cache
2104  */
2105  if (!expand) {
2106  sh->reconstruct_state = reconstruct_state_drain_run;
2107  set_bit(STRIPE_OP_BIODRAIN, &s->ops_request);
2108  } else
2109  sh->reconstruct_state = reconstruct_state_run;
2110 
2111  set_bit(STRIPE_OP_RECONSTRUCT, &s->ops_request);
2112 
2113  for (i = disks; i--; ) {
2114  struct r5dev *dev = &sh->dev[i];
2115 
2116  if (dev->towrite) {
2117  set_bit(R5_LOCKED, &dev->flags);
2118  set_bit(R5_Wantdrain, &dev->flags);
2119  if (!expand)
2120  clear_bit(R5_UPTODATE, &dev->flags);
2121  s->locked++;
2122  }
2123  }
2124  if (s->locked + conf->max_degraded == disks)
2125  if (!test_and_set_bit(STRIPE_FULL_WRITE, &sh->state))
2126  atomic_inc(&conf->pending_full_writes);
2127  } else {
2128  BUG_ON(level == 6);
2129  BUG_ON(!(test_bit(R5_UPTODATE, &sh->dev[pd_idx].flags) ||
2130  test_bit(R5_Wantcompute, &sh->dev[pd_idx].flags)));
2131 
2132  sh->reconstruct_state = reconstruct_state_prexor_drain_run;
2133  set_bit(STRIPE_OP_PREXOR, &s->ops_request);
2134  set_bit(STRIPE_OP_BIODRAIN, &s->ops_request);
2135  set_bit(STRIPE_OP_RECONSTRUCT, &s->ops_request);
2136 
2137  for (i = disks; i--; ) {
2138  struct r5dev *dev = &sh->dev[i];
2139  if (i == pd_idx)
2140  continue;
2141 
2142  if (dev->towrite &&
2143  (test_bit(R5_UPTODATE, &dev->flags) ||
2144  test_bit(R5_Wantcompute, &dev->flags))) {
2145  set_bit(R5_Wantdrain, &dev->flags);
2146  set_bit(R5_LOCKED, &dev->flags);
2147  clear_bit(R5_UPTODATE, &dev->flags);
2148  s->locked++;
2149  }
2150  }
2151  }
2152 
2153  /* keep the parity disk(s) locked while asynchronous operations
2154  * are in flight
2155  */
2156  set_bit(R5_LOCKED, &sh->dev[pd_idx].flags);
2157  clear_bit(R5_UPTODATE, &sh->dev[pd_idx].flags);
2158  s->locked++;
2159 
2160  if (level == 6) {
2161  int qd_idx = sh->qd_idx;
2162  struct r5dev *dev = &sh->dev[qd_idx];
2163 
2164  set_bit(R5_LOCKED, &dev->flags);
2165  clear_bit(R5_UPTODATE, &dev->flags);
2166  s->locked++;
2167  }
2168 
2169  pr_debug("%s: stripe %llu locked: %d ops_request: %lx\n",
2170  __func__, (unsigned long long)sh->sector,
2171  s->locked, s->ops_request);
2172 }
2173 
2174 /*
2175  * Each stripe/dev can have one or more bion attached.
2176  * toread/towrite point to the first in a chain.
2177  * The bi_next chain must be in order.
2178  */
2179 static int add_stripe_bio(struct stripe_head *sh, struct bio *bi, int dd_idx, int forwrite)
2180 {
2181  struct bio **bip;
2182  raid5_conf_t *conf = sh->raid_conf;
2183  int firstwrite=0;
2184 
2185  pr_debug("adding bh b#%llu to stripe s#%llu\n",
2186  (unsigned long long)bi->bi_sector,
2187  (unsigned long long)sh->sector);
2188 
2189 
2190  spin_lock(&sh->lock);
2191  spin_lock_irq(&conf->device_lock);
2192  if (forwrite) {
2193  bip = &sh->dev[dd_idx].towrite;
2194  if (*bip == NULL && sh->dev[dd_idx].written == NULL)
2195  firstwrite = 1;
2196  } else
2197  bip = &sh->dev[dd_idx].toread;
2198  while (*bip && (*bip)->bi_sector < bi->bi_sector) {
2199  if ((*bip)->bi_sector + ((*bip)->bi_size >> 9) > bi->bi_sector)
2200  goto overlap;
2201  bip = & (*bip)->bi_next;
2202  }
2203  if (*bip && (*bip)->bi_sector < bi->bi_sector + ((bi->bi_size)>>9))
2204  goto overlap;
2205 
2206  BUG_ON(*bip && bi->bi_next && (*bip) != bi->bi_next);
2207  if (*bip)
2208  bi->bi_next = *bip;
2209  *bip = bi;
2210  bi->bi_phys_segments++;
2211  spin_unlock_irq(&conf->device_lock);
2212  spin_unlock(&sh->lock);
2213 
2214  pr_debug("added bi b#%llu to stripe s#%llu, disk %d.\n",
2215  (unsigned long long)bi->bi_sector,
2216  (unsigned long long)sh->sector, dd_idx);
2217 
2218  if (conf->mddev->bitmap && firstwrite) {
2219  bitmap_startwrite(conf->mddev->bitmap, sh->sector,
2220  STRIPE_SECTORS, 0);
2221  sh->bm_seq = conf->seq_flush+1;
2222  set_bit(STRIPE_BIT_DELAY, &sh->state);
2223  }
2224 
2225  if (forwrite) {
2226  /* check if page is covered */
2227  sector_t sector = sh->dev[dd_idx].sector;
2228  for (bi=sh->dev[dd_idx].towrite;
2229  sector < sh->dev[dd_idx].sector + STRIPE_SECTORS &&
2230  bi && bi->bi_sector <= sector;
2231  bi = r5_next_bio(bi, sh->dev[dd_idx].sector)) {
2232  if (bi->bi_sector + (bi->bi_size>>9) >= sector)
2233  sector = bi->bi_sector + (bi->bi_size>>9);
2234  }
2235  if (sector >= sh->dev[dd_idx].sector + STRIPE_SECTORS)
2236  set_bit(R5_OVERWRITE, &sh->dev[dd_idx].flags);
2237  }
2238  return 1;
2239 
2240  overlap:
2241  set_bit(R5_Overlap, &sh->dev[dd_idx].flags);
2242  spin_unlock_irq(&conf->device_lock);
2243  spin_unlock(&sh->lock);
2244  return 0;
2245 }
2246 
2247 static void end_reshape(raid5_conf_t *conf);
2248 
2249 static void stripe_set_idx(sector_t stripe, raid5_conf_t *conf, int previous,
2250  struct stripe_head *sh)
2251 {
2252  int sectors_per_chunk =
2253  previous ? conf->prev_chunk_sectors : conf->chunk_sectors;
2254  int dd_idx;
2255  int chunk_offset = sector_div(stripe, sectors_per_chunk);
2256  int disks = previous ? conf->previous_raid_disks : conf->raid_disks;
2257 
2258  raid5_compute_sector(conf,
2259  stripe * (disks - conf->max_degraded)
2260  *sectors_per_chunk + chunk_offset,
2261  previous,
2262  &dd_idx, sh);
2263 }
2264 
2265 static void
2266 handle_failed_stripe(raid5_conf_t *conf, struct stripe_head *sh,
2267  struct stripe_head_state *s, int disks,
2268  struct bio **return_bi)
2269 {
2270  int i;
2271  for (i = disks; i--; ) {
2272  struct bio *bi;
2273  int bitmap_end = 0;
2274 
2275  if (test_bit(R5_ReadError, &sh->dev[i].flags)) {
2276  mdk_rdev_t *rdev;
2277  rcu_read_lock();
2278  rdev = rcu_dereference(conf->disks[i].rdev);
2279  if (rdev && test_bit(In_sync, &rdev->flags))
2280  /* multiple read failures in one stripe */
2281  md_error(conf->mddev, rdev);
2282  rcu_read_unlock();
2283  }
2284  spin_lock_irq(&conf->device_lock);
2285  /* fail all writes first */
2286  bi = sh->dev[i].towrite;
2287  sh->dev[i].towrite = NULL;
2288  if (bi) {
2289  s->to_write--;
2290  bitmap_end = 1;
2291  }
2292 
2293  if (test_and_clear_bit(R5_Overlap, &sh->dev[i].flags))
2294  wake_up(&conf->wait_for_overlap);
2295 
2296  while (bi && bi->bi_sector <
2297  sh->dev[i].sector + STRIPE_SECTORS) {
2298  struct bio *nextbi = r5_next_bio(bi, sh->dev[i].sector);
2299  clear_bit(BIO_UPTODATE, &bi->bi_flags);
2300  if (!raid5_dec_bi_phys_segments(bi)) {
2301  md_write_end(conf->mddev);
2302  bi->bi_next = *return_bi;
2303  *return_bi = bi;
2304  }
2305  bi = nextbi;
2306  }
2307  /* and fail all 'written' */
2308  bi = sh->dev[i].written;
2309  sh->dev[i].written = NULL;
2310  if (bi) bitmap_end = 1;
2311  while (bi && bi->bi_sector <
2312  sh->dev[i].sector + STRIPE_SECTORS) {
2313  struct bio *bi2 = r5_next_bio(bi, sh->dev[i].sector);
2314  clear_bit(BIO_UPTODATE, &bi->bi_flags);
2315  if (!raid5_dec_bi_phys_segments(bi)) {
2316  md_write_end(conf->mddev);
2317  bi->bi_next = *return_bi;
2318  *return_bi = bi;
2319  }
2320  bi = bi2;
2321  }
2322 
2323  /* fail any reads if this device is non-operational and
2324  * the data has not reached the cache yet.
2325  */
2326  if (!test_bit(R5_Wantfill, &sh->dev[i].flags) &&
2327  (!test_bit(R5_Insync, &sh->dev[i].flags) ||
2328  test_bit(R5_ReadError, &sh->dev[i].flags))) {
2329  bi = sh->dev[i].toread;
2330  sh->dev[i].toread = NULL;
2331  if (test_and_clear_bit(R5_Overlap, &sh->dev[i].flags))
2332  wake_up(&conf->wait_for_overlap);
2333  if (bi) s->to_read--;
2334  while (bi && bi->bi_sector <
2335  sh->dev[i].sector + STRIPE_SECTORS) {
2336  struct bio *nextbi =
2337  r5_next_bio(bi, sh->dev[i].sector);
2338  clear_bit(BIO_UPTODATE, &bi->bi_flags);
2339  if (!raid5_dec_bi_phys_segments(bi)) {
2340  bi->bi_next = *return_bi;
2341  *return_bi = bi;
2342  }
2343  bi = nextbi;
2344  }
2345  }
2346  spin_unlock_irq(&conf->device_lock);
2347  if (bitmap_end)
2348  bitmap_endwrite(conf->mddev->bitmap, sh->sector,
2349  STRIPE_SECTORS, 0, 0);
2350  }
2351 
2352  if (test_and_clear_bit(STRIPE_FULL_WRITE, &sh->state))
2353  if (atomic_dec_and_test(&conf->pending_full_writes))
2354  md_wakeup_thread(conf->mddev->thread);
2355 }
2356 
2357 /* fetch_block5 - checks the given member device to see if its data needs
2358  * to be read or computed to satisfy a request.
2359  *
2360  * Returns 1 when no more member devices need to be checked, otherwise returns
2361  * 0 to tell the loop in handle_stripe_fill5 to continue
2362  */
2363 static int fetch_block5(struct stripe_head *sh, struct stripe_head_state *s,
2364  int disk_idx, int disks)
2365 {
2366  struct r5dev *dev = &sh->dev[disk_idx];
2367  struct r5dev *failed_dev = &sh->dev[s->failed_num];
2368 
2369  /* is the data in this block needed, and can we get it? */
2370  if (!test_bit(R5_LOCKED, &dev->flags) &&
2371  !test_bit(R5_UPTODATE, &dev->flags) &&
2372  (dev->toread ||
2373  (dev->towrite && !test_bit(R5_OVERWRITE, &dev->flags)) ||
2374  s->syncing || s->expanding ||
2375  (s->failed &&
2376  (failed_dev->toread ||
2377  (failed_dev->towrite &&
2378  !test_bit(R5_OVERWRITE, &failed_dev->flags)))))) {
2379  /* We would like to get this block, possibly by computing it,
2380  * otherwise read it if the backing disk is insync
2381  */
2382  if ((s->uptodate == disks - 1) &&
2383  (s->failed && disk_idx == s->failed_num)) {
2384  set_bit(STRIPE_COMPUTE_RUN, &sh->state);
2385  set_bit(STRIPE_OP_COMPUTE_BLK, &s->ops_request);
2386  set_bit(R5_Wantcompute, &dev->flags);
2387  sh->ops.target = disk_idx;
2388  sh->ops.target2 = -1;
2389  s->req_compute = 1;
2390  /* Careful: from this point on 'uptodate' is in the eye
2391  * of raid_run_ops which services 'compute' operations
2392  * before writes. R5_Wantcompute flags a block that will
2393  * be R5_UPTODATE by the time it is needed for a
2394  * subsequent operation.
2395  */
2396  s->uptodate++;
2397  return 1; /* uptodate + compute == disks */
2398  } else if (test_bit(R5_Insync, &dev->flags)) {
2399  set_bit(R5_LOCKED, &dev->flags);
2400  set_bit(R5_Wantread, &dev->flags);
2401  s->locked++;
2402  pr_debug("Reading block %d (sync=%d)\n", disk_idx,
2403  s->syncing);
2404  }
2405  }
2406 
2407  return 0;
2408 }
2409 
2413 static void handle_stripe_fill5(struct stripe_head *sh,
2414  struct stripe_head_state *s, int disks)
2415 {
2416  int i;
2417 
2418  /* look for blocks to read/compute, skip this if a compute
2419  * is already in flight, or if the stripe contents are in the
2420  * midst of changing due to a write
2421  */
2422  if (!test_bit(STRIPE_COMPUTE_RUN, &sh->state) && !sh->check_state &&
2423  !sh->reconstruct_state)
2424  for (i = disks; i--; )
2425  if (fetch_block5(sh, s, i, disks))
2426  break;
2427  set_bit(STRIPE_HANDLE, &sh->state);
2428 }
2429 
2430 /* fetch_block6 - checks the given member device to see if its data needs
2431  * to be read or computed to satisfy a request.
2432  *
2433  * Returns 1 when no more member devices need to be checked, otherwise returns
2434  * 0 to tell the loop in handle_stripe_fill6 to continue
2435  */
2436 static int fetch_block6(struct stripe_head *sh, struct stripe_head_state *s,
2437  struct r6_state *r6s, int disk_idx, int disks)
2438 {
2439  struct r5dev *dev = &sh->dev[disk_idx];
2440  struct r5dev *fdev[2] = { &sh->dev[r6s->failed_num[0]],
2441  &sh->dev[r6s->failed_num[1]] };
2442 
2443  if (!test_bit(R5_LOCKED, &dev->flags) &&
2444  !test_bit(R5_UPTODATE, &dev->flags) &&
2445  (dev->toread ||
2446  (dev->towrite && !test_bit(R5_OVERWRITE, &dev->flags)) ||
2447  s->syncing || s->expanding ||
2448  (s->failed >= 1 &&
2449  (fdev[0]->toread || s->to_write)) ||
2450  (s->failed >= 2 &&
2451  (fdev[1]->toread || s->to_write)))) {
2452  /* we would like to get this block, possibly by computing it,
2453  * otherwise read it if the backing disk is insync
2454  */
2455  BUG_ON(test_bit(R5_Wantcompute, &dev->flags));
2456  BUG_ON(test_bit(R5_Wantread, &dev->flags));
2457  if ((s->uptodate == disks - 1) &&
2458  (s->failed && (disk_idx == r6s->failed_num[0] ||
2459  disk_idx == r6s->failed_num[1]))) {
2460  /* have disk failed, and we're requested to fetch it;
2461  * do compute it
2462  */
2463  pr_debug("Computing stripe %llu block %d\n",
2464  (unsigned long long)sh->sector, disk_idx);
2465  set_bit(STRIPE_COMPUTE_RUN, &sh->state);
2466  set_bit(STRIPE_OP_COMPUTE_BLK, &s->ops_request);
2467  set_bit(R5_Wantcompute, &dev->flags);
2468  sh->ops.target = disk_idx;
2469  sh->ops.target2 = -1; /* no 2nd target */
2470  s->req_compute = 1;
2471  s->uptodate++;
2472  return 1;
2473  } else if (s->uptodate == disks-2 && s->failed >= 2) {
2474  /* Computing 2-failure is *very* expensive; only
2475  * do it if failed >= 2
2476  */
2477  int other;
2478  for (other = disks; other--; ) {
2479  if (other == disk_idx)
2480  continue;
2481  if (!test_bit(R5_UPTODATE,
2482  &sh->dev[other].flags))
2483  break;
2484  }
2485  BUG_ON(other < 0);
2486  pr_debug("Computing stripe %llu blocks %d,%d\n",
2487  (unsigned long long)sh->sector,
2488  disk_idx, other);
2489  set_bit(STRIPE_COMPUTE_RUN, &sh->state);
2490  set_bit(STRIPE_OP_COMPUTE_BLK, &s->ops_request);
2491  set_bit(R5_Wantcompute, &sh->dev[disk_idx].flags);
2492  set_bit(R5_Wantcompute, &sh->dev[other].flags);
2493  sh->ops.target = disk_idx;
2494  sh->ops.target2 = other;
2495  s->uptodate += 2;
2496  s->req_compute = 1;
2497  return 1;
2498  } else if (test_bit(R5_Insync, &dev->flags)) {
2499  set_bit(R5_LOCKED, &dev->flags);
2500  set_bit(R5_Wantread, &dev->flags);
2501  s->locked++;
2502  pr_debug("Reading block %d (sync=%d)\n",
2503  disk_idx, s->syncing);
2504  }
2505  }
2506 
2507  return 0;
2508 }
2509 
2513 static void handle_stripe_fill6(struct stripe_head *sh,
2514  struct stripe_head_state *s, struct r6_state *r6s,
2515  int disks)
2516 {
2517  int i;
2518 
2519  /* look for blocks to read/compute, skip this if a compute
2520  * is already in flight, or if the stripe contents are in the
2521  * midst of changing due to a write
2522  */
2523  if (!test_bit(STRIPE_COMPUTE_RUN, &sh->state) && !sh->check_state &&
2524  !sh->reconstruct_state)
2525  for (i = disks; i--; )
2526  if (fetch_block6(sh, s, r6s, i, disks))
2527  break;
2528  set_bit(STRIPE_HANDLE, &sh->state);
2529 }
2530 
2531 
2532 /* handle_stripe_clean_event
2533  * any written block on an uptodate or failed drive can be returned.
2534  * Note that if we 'wrote' to a failed drive, it will be UPTODATE, but
2535  * never LOCKED, so we don't need to test 'failed' directly.
2536  */
2537 static void handle_stripe_clean_event(raid5_conf_t *conf,
2538  struct stripe_head *sh, int disks, struct bio **return_bi)
2539 {
2540  int i;
2541  struct r5dev *dev;
2542 
2543  for (i = disks; i--; )
2544  if (sh->dev[i].written) {
2545  dev = &sh->dev[i];
2546  if (!test_bit(R5_LOCKED, &dev->flags) &&
2547  test_bit(R5_UPTODATE, &dev->flags)) {
2548  /* We can return any write requests */
2549  struct bio *wbi, *wbi2;
2550  int bitmap_end = 0;
2551  pr_debug("Return write for disc %d\n", i);
2552  spin_lock_irq(&conf->device_lock);
2553  wbi = dev->written;
2554  dev->written = NULL;
2555  while (wbi && wbi->bi_sector <
2556  dev->sector + STRIPE_SECTORS) {
2557  wbi2 = r5_next_bio(wbi, dev->sector);
2558  if (!raid5_dec_bi_phys_segments(wbi)) {
2559  md_write_end(conf->mddev);
2560  wbi->bi_next = *return_bi;
2561  *return_bi = wbi;
2562  }
2563  wbi = wbi2;
2564  }
2565  if (dev->towrite == NULL)
2566  bitmap_end = 1;
2567  spin_unlock_irq(&conf->device_lock);
2568  if (bitmap_end)
2569  bitmap_endwrite(conf->mddev->bitmap,
2570  sh->sector,
2571  STRIPE_SECTORS,
2572  !test_bit(STRIPE_DEGRADED, &sh->state),
2573  0);
2574  }
2575  }
2576 
2577  if (test_and_clear_bit(STRIPE_FULL_WRITE, &sh->state))
2578  if (atomic_dec_and_test(&conf->pending_full_writes))
2579  md_wakeup_thread(conf->mddev->thread);
2580 }
2581 
2582 static void handle_stripe_dirtying5(raid5_conf_t *conf,
2583  struct stripe_head *sh, struct stripe_head_state *s, int disks)
2584 {
2585  int rmw = 0, rcw = 0, i;
2586  for (i = disks; i--; ) {
2587  /* would I have to read this buffer for read_modify_write */
2588  struct r5dev *dev = &sh->dev[i];
2589  if ((dev->towrite || i == sh->pd_idx) &&
2590  !test_bit(R5_LOCKED, &dev->flags) &&
2591  !(test_bit(R5_UPTODATE, &dev->flags) ||
2592  test_bit(R5_Wantcompute, &dev->flags))) {
2593  if (test_bit(R5_Insync, &dev->flags))
2594  rmw++;
2595  else
2596  rmw += 2*disks; /* cannot read it */
2597  }
2598  /* Would I have to read this buffer for reconstruct_write */
2599  if (!test_bit(R5_OVERWRITE, &dev->flags) && i != sh->pd_idx &&
2600  !test_bit(R5_LOCKED, &dev->flags) &&
2601  !(test_bit(R5_UPTODATE, &dev->flags) ||
2602  test_bit(R5_Wantcompute, &dev->flags))) {
2603  if (test_bit(R5_Insync, &dev->flags)) rcw++;
2604  else
2605  rcw += 2*disks;
2606  }
2607  }
2608  pr_debug("for sector %llu, rmw=%d rcw=%d\n",
2609  (unsigned long long)sh->sector, rmw, rcw);
2610  set_bit(STRIPE_HANDLE, &sh->state);
2611  if (rmw < rcw && rmw > 0)
2612  /* prefer read-modify-write, but need to get some data */
2613  for (i = disks; i--; ) {
2614  struct r5dev *dev = &sh->dev[i];
2615  if ((dev->towrite || i == sh->pd_idx) &&
2616  !test_bit(R5_LOCKED, &dev->flags) &&
2617  !(test_bit(R5_UPTODATE, &dev->flags) ||
2618  test_bit(R5_Wantcompute, &dev->flags)) &&
2619  test_bit(R5_Insync, &dev->flags)) {
2620  if (
2621  test_bit(STRIPE_PREREAD_ACTIVE, &sh->state)) {
2622  pr_debug("Read_old block "
2623  "%d for r-m-w\n", i);
2624  set_bit(R5_LOCKED, &dev->flags);
2625  set_bit(R5_Wantread, &dev->flags);
2626  s->locked++;
2627  } else {
2628  set_bit(STRIPE_DELAYED, &sh->state);
2629  set_bit(STRIPE_HANDLE, &sh->state);
2630  }
2631  }
2632  }
2633  if (rcw <= rmw && rcw > 0)
2634  /* want reconstruct write, but need to get some data */
2635  for (i = disks; i--; ) {
2636  struct r5dev *dev = &sh->dev[i];
2637  if (!test_bit(R5_OVERWRITE, &dev->flags) &&
2638  i != sh->pd_idx &&
2639  !test_bit(R5_LOCKED, &dev->flags) &&
2640  !(test_bit(R5_UPTODATE, &dev->flags) ||
2641  test_bit(R5_Wantcompute, &dev->flags)) &&
2642  test_bit(R5_Insync, &dev->flags)) {
2643  if (
2644  test_bit(STRIPE_PREREAD_ACTIVE, &sh->state)) {
2645  pr_debug("Read_old block "
2646  "%d for Reconstruct\n", i);
2647  set_bit(R5_LOCKED, &dev->flags);
2648  set_bit(R5_Wantread, &dev->flags);
2649  s->locked++;
2650  } else {
2651  set_bit(STRIPE_DELAYED, &sh->state);
2652  set_bit(STRIPE_HANDLE, &sh->state);
2653  }
2654  }
2655  }
2656  /* now if nothing is locked, and if we have enough data,
2657  * we can start a write request
2658  */
2659  /* since handle_stripe can be called at any time we need to handle the
2660  * case where a compute block operation has been submitted and then a
2661  * subsequent call wants to start a write request. raid_run_ops only
2662  * handles the case where compute block and reconstruct are requested
2663  * simultaneously. If this is not the case then new writes need to be
2664  * held off until the compute completes.
2665  */
2666  if ((s->req_compute || !test_bit(STRIPE_COMPUTE_RUN, &sh->state)) &&
2667  (s->locked == 0 && (rcw == 0 || rmw == 0) &&
2668  !test_bit(STRIPE_BIT_DELAY, &sh->state)))
2669  schedule_reconstruction(sh, s, rcw == 0, 0);
2670 }
2671 
2672 static void handle_stripe_dirtying6(raid5_conf_t *conf,
2673  struct stripe_head *sh, struct stripe_head_state *s,
2674  struct r6_state *r6s, int disks)
2675 {
2676  int rcw = 0, pd_idx = sh->pd_idx, i;
2677  int qd_idx = sh->qd_idx;
2678 
2679  set_bit(STRIPE_HANDLE, &sh->state);
2680  for (i = disks; i--; ) {
2681  struct r5dev *dev = &sh->dev[i];
2682  /* check if we haven't enough data */
2683  if (!test_bit(R5_OVERWRITE, &dev->flags) &&
2684  i != pd_idx && i != qd_idx &&
2685  !test_bit(R5_LOCKED, &dev->flags) &&
2686  !(test_bit(R5_UPTODATE, &dev->flags) ||
2687  test_bit(R5_Wantcompute, &dev->flags))) {
2688  rcw++;
2689  if (!test_bit(R5_Insync, &dev->flags))
2690  continue; /* it's a failed drive */
2691 
2692  if (
2693  test_bit(STRIPE_PREREAD_ACTIVE, &sh->state)) {
2694  pr_debug("Read_old stripe %llu "
2695  "block %d for Reconstruct\n",
2696  (unsigned long long)sh->sector, i);
2697  set_bit(R5_LOCKED, &dev->flags);
2698  set_bit(R5_Wantread, &dev->flags);
2699  s->locked++;
2700  } else {
2701  pr_debug("Request delayed stripe %llu "
2702  "block %d for Reconstruct\n",
2703  (unsigned long long)sh->sector, i);
2704  set_bit(STRIPE_DELAYED, &sh->state);
2705  set_bit(STRIPE_HANDLE, &sh->state);
2706  }
2707  }
2708  }
2709  /* now if nothing is locked, and if we have enough data, we can start a
2710  * write request
2711  */
2712  if ((s->req_compute || !test_bit(STRIPE_COMPUTE_RUN, &sh->state)) &&
2713  s->locked == 0 && rcw == 0 &&
2714  !test_bit(STRIPE_BIT_DELAY, &sh->state)) {
2715  schedule_reconstruction(sh, s, 1, 0);
2716  }
2717 }
2718 
2719 static void handle_parity_checks5(raid5_conf_t *conf, struct stripe_head *sh,
2720  struct stripe_head_state *s, int disks)
2721 {
2722  struct r5dev *dev = NULL;
2723 
2724  set_bit(STRIPE_HANDLE, &sh->state);
2725 
2726  switch (sh->check_state) {
2727  case check_state_idle:
2728  /* start a new check operation if there are no failures */
2729  if (s->failed == 0) {
2730  BUG_ON(s->uptodate != disks);
2731  sh->check_state = check_state_run;
2732  set_bit(STRIPE_OP_CHECK, &s->ops_request);
2733  clear_bit(R5_UPTODATE, &sh->dev[sh->pd_idx].flags);
2734  s->uptodate--;
2735  break;
2736  }
2737  dev = &sh->dev[s->failed_num];
2738  /* fall through */
2739  case check_state_compute_result:
2740  sh->check_state = check_state_idle;
2741  if (!dev)
2742  dev = &sh->dev[sh->pd_idx];
2743 
2744  /* check that a write has not made the stripe insync */
2745  if (test_bit(STRIPE_INSYNC, &sh->state))
2746  break;
2747 
2748  /* either failed parity check, or recovery is happening */
2749  BUG_ON(!test_bit(R5_UPTODATE, &dev->flags));
2750  BUG_ON(s->uptodate != disks);
2751 
2752  set_bit(R5_LOCKED, &dev->flags);
2753  s->locked++;
2754  set_bit(R5_Wantwrite, &dev->flags);
2755 
2756  clear_bit(STRIPE_DEGRADED, &sh->state);
2757  set_bit(STRIPE_INSYNC, &sh->state);
2758  break;
2759  case check_state_run:
2760  break; /* we will be called again upon completion */
2761  case check_state_check_result:
2762  sh->check_state = check_state_idle;
2763 
2764  /* if a failure occurred during the check operation, leave
2765  * STRIPE_INSYNC not set and let the stripe be handled again
2766  */
2767  if (s->failed)
2768  break;
2769 
2770  /* handle a successful check operation, if parity is correct
2771  * we are done. Otherwise update the mismatch count and repair
2772  * parity if !MD_RECOVERY_CHECK
2773  */
2774  if ((sh->ops.zero_sum_result & SUM_CHECK_P_RESULT) == 0)
2775  /* parity is correct (on disc,
2776  * not in buffer any more)
2777  */
2778  set_bit(STRIPE_INSYNC, &sh->state);
2779  else {
2780  conf->mddev->resync_mismatches += STRIPE_SECTORS;
2781  if (test_bit(MD_RECOVERY_CHECK, &conf->mddev->recovery))
2782  /* don't try to repair!! */
2783  set_bit(STRIPE_INSYNC, &sh->state);
2784  else {
2785  sh->check_state = check_state_compute_run;
2786  set_bit(STRIPE_COMPUTE_RUN, &sh->state);
2787  set_bit(STRIPE_OP_COMPUTE_BLK, &s->ops_request);
2788  set_bit(R5_Wantcompute,
2789  &sh->dev[sh->pd_idx].flags);
2790  sh->ops.target = sh->pd_idx;
2791  sh->ops.target2 = -1;
2792  s->uptodate++;
2793  }
2794  }
2795  break;
2796  case check_state_compute_run:
2797  break;
2798  default:
2799  printk(KERN_ERR "%s: unknown check_state: %d sector: %llu\n",
2800  __func__, sh->check_state,
2801  (unsigned long long) sh->sector);
2802  BUG();
2803  }
2804 }
2805 
2806 
2807 static void handle_parity_checks6(raid5_conf_t *conf, struct stripe_head *sh,
2808  struct stripe_head_state *s,
2809  struct r6_state *r6s, int disks)
2810 {
2811  int pd_idx = sh->pd_idx;
2812  int qd_idx = sh->qd_idx;
2813  struct r5dev *dev;
2814 
2815  set_bit(STRIPE_HANDLE, &sh->state);
2816 
2817  BUG_ON(s->failed > 2);
2818 
2819  /* Want to check and possibly repair P and Q.
2820  * However there could be one 'failed' device, in which
2821  * case we can only check one of them, possibly using the
2822  * other to generate missing data
2823  */
2824 
2825  switch (sh->check_state) {
2826  case check_state_idle:
2827  /* start a new check operation if there are < 2 failures */
2828  if (s->failed == r6s->q_failed) {
2829  /* The only possible failed device holds Q, so it
2830  * makes sense to check P (If anything else were failed,
2831  * we would have used P to recreate it).
2832  */
2833  sh->check_state = check_state_run;
2834  }
2835  if (!r6s->q_failed && s->failed < 2) {
2836  /* Q is not failed, and we didn't use it to generate
2837  * anything, so it makes sense to check it
2838  */
2839  if (sh->check_state == check_state_run)
2840  sh->check_state = check_state_run_pq;
2841  else
2842  sh->check_state = check_state_run_q;
2843  }
2844 
2845  /* discard potentially stale zero_sum_result */
2846  sh->ops.zero_sum_result = 0;
2847 
2848  if (sh->check_state == check_state_run) {
2849  /* async_xor_zero_sum destroys the contents of P */
2850  clear_bit(R5_UPTODATE, &sh->dev[pd_idx].flags);
2851  s->uptodate--;
2852  }
2853  if (sh->check_state >= check_state_run &&
2854  sh->check_state <= check_state_run_pq) {
2855  /* async_syndrome_zero_sum preserves P and Q, so
2856  * no need to mark them !uptodate here
2857  */
2858  set_bit(STRIPE_OP_CHECK, &s->ops_request);
2859  break;
2860  }
2861 
2862  /* we have 2-disk failure */
2863  BUG_ON(s->failed != 2);
2864  /* fall through */
2865  case check_state_compute_result:
2866  sh->check_state = check_state_idle;
2867 
2868  /* check that a write has not made the stripe insync */
2869  if (test_bit(STRIPE_INSYNC, &sh->state))
2870  break;
2871 
2872  /* now write out any block on a failed drive,
2873  * or P or Q if they were recomputed
2874  */
2875  BUG_ON(s->uptodate < disks - 1); /* We don't need Q to recover */
2876  if (s->failed == 2) {
2877  dev = &sh->dev[r6s->failed_num[1]];
2878  s->locked++;
2879  set_bit(R5_LOCKED, &dev->flags);
2880  set_bit(R5_Wantwrite, &dev->flags);
2881  }
2882  if (s->failed >= 1) {
2883  dev = &sh->dev[r6s->failed_num[0]];
2884  s->locked++;
2885  set_bit(R5_LOCKED, &dev->flags);
2886  set_bit(R5_Wantwrite, &dev->flags);
2887  }
2888  if (sh->ops.zero_sum_result & SUM_CHECK_P_RESULT) {
2889  dev = &sh->dev[pd_idx];
2890  s->locked++;
2891  set_bit(R5_LOCKED, &dev->flags);
2892  set_bit(R5_Wantwrite, &dev->flags);
2893  }
2894  if (sh->ops.zero_sum_result & SUM_CHECK_Q_RESULT) {
2895  dev = &sh->dev[qd_idx];
2896  s->locked++;
2897  set_bit(R5_LOCKED, &dev->flags);
2898  set_bit(R5_Wantwrite, &dev->flags);
2899  }
2900  clear_bit(STRIPE_DEGRADED, &sh->state);
2901 
2902  set_bit(STRIPE_INSYNC, &sh->state);
2903  break;
2904  case check_state_run:
2905  case check_state_run_q:
2906  case check_state_run_pq:
2907  break; /* we will be called again upon completion */
2908  case check_state_check_result:
2909  sh->check_state = check_state_idle;
2910 
2911  /* handle a successful check operation, if parity is correct
2912  * we are done. Otherwise update the mismatch count and repair
2913  * parity if !MD_RECOVERY_CHECK
2914  */
2915  if (sh->ops.zero_sum_result == 0) {
2916  /* both parities are correct */
2917  if (!s->failed)
2918  set_bit(STRIPE_INSYNC, &sh->state);
2919  else {
2920  /* in contrast to the raid5 case we can validate
2921  * parity, but still have a failure to write
2922  * back
2923  */
2924  sh->check_state = check_state_compute_result;
2925  /* Returning at this point means that we may go
2926  * off and bring p and/or q uptodate again so
2927  * we make sure to check zero_sum_result again
2928  * to verify if p or q need writeback
2929  */
2930  }
2931  } else {
2932  conf->mddev->resync_mismatches += STRIPE_SECTORS;
2933  if (test_bit(MD_RECOVERY_CHECK, &conf->mddev->recovery))
2934  /* don't try to repair!! */
2935  set_bit(STRIPE_INSYNC, &sh->state);
2936  else {
2937  int *target = &sh->ops.target;
2938 
2939  sh->ops.target = -1;
2940  sh->ops.target2 = -1;
2941  sh->check_state = check_state_compute_run;
2942  set_bit(STRIPE_COMPUTE_RUN, &sh->state);
2943  set_bit(STRIPE_OP_COMPUTE_BLK, &s->ops_request);
2944  if (sh->ops.zero_sum_result & SUM_CHECK_P_RESULT) {
2945  set_bit(R5_Wantcompute,
2946  &sh->dev[pd_idx].flags);
2947  *target = pd_idx;
2948  target = &sh->ops.target2;
2949  s->uptodate++;
2950  }
2951  if (sh->ops.zero_sum_result & SUM_CHECK_Q_RESULT) {
2952  set_bit(R5_Wantcompute,
2953  &sh->dev[qd_idx].flags);
2954  *target = qd_idx;
2955  s->uptodate++;
2956  }
2957  }
2958  }
2959  break;
2960  case check_state_compute_run:
2961  break;
2962  default:
2963  printk(KERN_ERR "%s: unknown check_state: %d sector: %llu\n",
2964  __func__, sh->check_state,
2965  (unsigned long long) sh->sector);
2966  BUG();
2967  }
2968 }
2969 
2970 static void handle_stripe_expansion(raid5_conf_t *conf, struct stripe_head *sh,
2971  struct r6_state *r6s)
2972 {
2973  int i;
2974 
2975  /* We have read all the blocks in this stripe and now we need to
2976  * copy some of them into a target stripe for expand.
2977  */
2978  struct dma_async_tx_descriptor *tx = NULL;
2979  clear_bit(STRIPE_EXPAND_SOURCE, &sh->state);
2980  for (i = 0; i < sh->disks; i++)
2981  if (i != sh->pd_idx && i != sh->qd_idx) {
2982  int dd_idx, j;
2983  struct stripe_head *sh2;
2984  struct async_submit_ctl submit;
2985 
2986  sector_t bn = compute_blocknr(sh, i, 1);
2987  sector_t s = raid5_compute_sector(conf, bn, 0,
2988  &dd_idx, NULL);
2989  sh2 = get_active_stripe(conf, s, 0, 1, 1);
2990  if (sh2 == NULL)
2991  /* so far only the early blocks of this stripe
2992  * have been requested. When later blocks
2993  * get requested, we will try again
2994  */
2995  continue;
2996  if (!test_bit(STRIPE_EXPANDING, &sh2->state) ||
2997  test_bit(R5_Expanded, &sh2->dev[dd_idx].flags)) {
2998  /* must have already done this block */
2999  release_stripe(sh2);
3000  continue;
3001  }
3002 
3003  /* place all the copies on one channel */
3004  init_async_submit(&submit, 0, tx, NULL, NULL, NULL);
3005  tx = async_memcpy(sh2->dev[dd_idx].page,
3006  sh->dev[i].page, 0, 0, STRIPE_SIZE,
3007  &submit);
3008 
3009  set_bit(R5_Expanded, &sh2->dev[dd_idx].flags);
3010  set_bit(R5_UPTODATE, &sh2->dev[dd_idx].flags);
3011  for (j = 0; j < conf->raid_disks; j++)
3012  if (j != sh2->pd_idx &&
3013  (!r6s || j != sh2->qd_idx) &&
3014  !test_bit(R5_Expanded, &sh2->dev[j].flags))
3015  break;
3016  if (j == conf->raid_disks) {
3017  set_bit(STRIPE_EXPAND_READY, &sh2->state);
3018  set_bit(STRIPE_HANDLE, &sh2->state);
3019  }
3020  release_stripe(sh2);
3021 
3022  }
3023  /* done submitting copies, wait for them to complete */
3024  if (tx) {
3025  async_tx_ack(tx);
3026  dma_wait_for_async_tx(tx);
3027  }
3028 }
3029 
3030 
3031 /*
3032  * handle_stripe - do things to a stripe.
3033  *
3034  * We lock the stripe and then examine the state of various bits
3035  * to see what needs to be done.
3036  * Possible results:
3037  * return some read request which now have data
3038  * return some write requests which are safely on disc
3039  * schedule a read on some buffers
3040  * schedule a write of some buffers
3041  * return confirmation of parity correctness
3042  *
3043  * buffers are taken off read_list or write_list, and bh_cache buffers
3044  * get BH_Lock set before the stripe lock is released.
3045  *
3046  */
3047 
3048 static void handle_stripe5(struct stripe_head *sh)
3049 {
3050  raid5_conf_t *conf = sh->raid_conf;
3051  int disks = sh->disks, i;
3052  struct bio *return_bi = NULL;
3053  struct stripe_head_state s;
3054  struct r5dev *dev;
3055  mdk_rdev_t *blocked_rdev = NULL;
3056  int prexor;
3057  int dec_preread_active = 0;
3058 
3059  memset(&s, 0, sizeof(s));
3060  pr_debug("handling stripe %llu, state=%#lx cnt=%d, pd_idx=%d check:%d "
3061  "reconstruct:%d\n", (unsigned long long)sh->sector, sh->state,
3062  atomic_read(&sh->count), sh->pd_idx, sh->check_state,
3063  sh->reconstruct_state);
3064 
3065  spin_lock(&sh->lock);
3066  clear_bit(STRIPE_HANDLE, &sh->state);
3067  clear_bit(STRIPE_DELAYED, &sh->state);
3068 
3069  s.syncing = test_bit(STRIPE_SYNCING, &sh->state);
3070  s.expanding = test_bit(STRIPE_EXPAND_SOURCE, &sh->state);
3071  s.expanded = test_bit(STRIPE_EXPAND_READY, &sh->state);
3072 
3073  /* Now to look around and see what can be done */
3074  rcu_read_lock();
3075  for (i=disks; i--; ) {
3076  mdk_rdev_t *rdev;
3077 
3078  dev = &sh->dev[i];
3079 
3080  pr_debug("check %d: state 0x%lx toread %p read %p write %p "
3081  "written %p\n", i, dev->flags, dev->toread, dev->read,
3082  dev->towrite, dev->written);
3083 
3084  /* maybe we can request a biofill operation
3085  *
3086  * new wantfill requests are only permitted while
3087  * ops_complete_biofill is guaranteed to be inactive
3088  */
3089  if (test_bit(R5_UPTODATE, &dev->flags) && dev->toread &&
3090  !test_bit(STRIPE_BIOFILL_RUN, &sh->state))
3091  set_bit(R5_Wantfill, &dev->flags);
3092 
3093  /* now count some things */
3094  if (test_bit(R5_LOCKED, &dev->flags)) s.locked++;
3095  if (test_bit(R5_UPTODATE, &dev->flags)) s.uptodate++;
3096  if (test_bit(R5_Wantcompute, &dev->flags)) s.compute++;
3097 
3098  if (test_bit(R5_Wantfill, &dev->flags))
3099  s.to_fill++;
3100  else if (dev->toread)
3101  s.to_read++;
3102  if (dev->towrite) {
3103  s.to_write++;
3104  if (!test_bit(R5_OVERWRITE, &dev->flags))
3105  s.non_overwrite++;
3106  }
3107  if (dev->written)
3108  s.written++;
3109  rdev = rcu_dereference(conf->disks[i].rdev);
3110  if (blocked_rdev == NULL &&
3111  rdev && unlikely(test_bit(Blocked, &rdev->flags))) {
3112  blocked_rdev = rdev;
3113  atomic_inc(&rdev->nr_pending);
3114  }
3115  clear_bit(R5_Insync, &dev->flags);
3116  if (!rdev)
3117  /* Not in-sync */;
3118  else if (test_bit(In_sync, &rdev->flags))
3119  set_bit(R5_Insync, &dev->flags);
3120  else {
3121  /* could be in-sync depending on recovery/reshape status */
3122  if (sh->sector + STRIPE_SECTORS <= rdev->recovery_offset)
3123  set_bit(R5_Insync, &dev->flags);
3124  }
3125  if (!test_bit(R5_Insync, &dev->flags)) {
3126  /* The ReadError flag will just be confusing now */
3127  clear_bit(R5_ReadError, &dev->flags);
3128  clear_bit(R5_ReWrite, &dev->flags);
3129  }
3130  if (test_bit(R5_ReadError, &dev->flags))
3131  clear_bit(R5_Insync, &dev->flags);
3132  if (!test_bit(R5_Insync, &dev->flags)) {
3133  s.failed++;
3134  s.failed_num = i;
3135  }
3136  }
3137  rcu_read_unlock();
3138 
3139  if (unlikely(blocked_rdev)) {
3140  if (s.syncing || s.expanding || s.expanded ||
3141  s.to_write || s.written) {
3142  set_bit(STRIPE_HANDLE, &sh->state);
3143  goto unlock;
3144  }
3145  /* There is nothing for the blocked_rdev to block */
3146  rdev_dec_pending(blocked_rdev, conf->mddev);
3147  blocked_rdev = NULL;
3148  }
3149 
3150  if (s.to_fill && !test_bit(STRIPE_BIOFILL_RUN, &sh->state)) {
3151  set_bit(STRIPE_OP_BIOFILL, &s.ops_request);
3152  set_bit(STRIPE_BIOFILL_RUN, &sh->state);
3153  }
3154 
3155  pr_debug("locked=%d uptodate=%d to_read=%d"
3156  " to_write=%d failed=%d failed_num=%d\n",
3157  s.locked, s.uptodate, s.to_read, s.to_write,
3158  s.failed, s.failed_num);
3159  /* check if the array has lost two devices and, if so, some requests might
3160  * need to be failed
3161  */
3162  if (s.failed > 1 && s.to_read+s.to_write+s.written)
3163  handle_failed_stripe(conf, sh, &s, disks, &return_bi);
3164  if (s.failed > 1 && s.syncing) {
3165  md_done_sync(conf->mddev, STRIPE_SECTORS,0);
3166  clear_bit(STRIPE_SYNCING, &sh->state);
3167  s.syncing = 0;
3168  }
3169 
3170  /* might be able to return some write requests if the parity block
3171  * is safe, or on a failed drive
3172  */
3173  dev = &sh->dev[sh->pd_idx];
3174  if ( s.written &&
3175  ((test_bit(R5_Insync, &dev->flags) &&
3176  !test_bit(R5_LOCKED, &dev->flags) &&
3177  test_bit(R5_UPTODATE, &dev->flags)) ||
3178  (s.failed == 1 && s.failed_num == sh->pd_idx)))
3179  handle_stripe_clean_event(conf, sh, disks, &return_bi);
3180 
3181  /* Now we might consider reading some blocks, either to check/generate
3182  * parity, or to satisfy requests
3183  * or to load a block that is being partially written.
3184  */
3185  if (s.to_read || s.non_overwrite ||
3186  (s.syncing && (s.uptodate + s.compute < disks)) || s.expanding)
3187  handle_stripe_fill5(sh, &s, disks);
3188 
3189  /* Now we check to see if any write operations have recently
3190  * completed
3191  */
3192  prexor = 0;
3193  if (sh->reconstruct_state == reconstruct_state_prexor_drain_result)
3194  prexor = 1;
3195  if (sh->reconstruct_state == reconstruct_state_drain_result ||
3196  sh->reconstruct_state == reconstruct_state_prexor_drain_result) {
3197  sh->reconstruct_state = reconstruct_state_idle;
3198 
3199  /* All the 'written' buffers and the parity block are ready to
3200  * be written back to disk
3201  */
3202  BUG_ON(!test_bit(R5_UPTODATE, &sh->dev[sh->pd_idx].flags));
3203  for (i = disks; i--; ) {
3204  dev = &sh->dev[i];
3205  if (test_bit(R5_LOCKED, &dev->flags) &&
3206  (i == sh->pd_idx || dev->written)) {
3207  pr_debug("Writing block %d\n", i);
3208  set_bit(R5_Wantwrite, &dev->flags);
3209  if (prexor)
3210  continue;
3211  if (!test_bit(R5_Insync, &dev->flags) ||
3212  (i == sh->pd_idx && s.failed == 0))
3213  set_bit(STRIPE_INSYNC, &sh->state);
3214  }
3215  }
3216  if (test_and_clear_bit(STRIPE_PREREAD_ACTIVE, &sh->state))
3217  dec_preread_active = 1;
3218  }
3219 
3220  /* Now to consider new write requests and what else, if anything
3221  * should be read. We do not handle new writes when:
3222  * 1/ A 'write' operation (copy+xor) is already in flight.
3223  * 2/ A 'check' operation is in flight, as it may clobber the parity
3224  * block.
3225  */
3226  if (s.to_write && !sh->reconstruct_state && !sh->check_state)
3227  handle_stripe_dirtying5(conf, sh, &s, disks);
3228 
3229  /* maybe we need to check and possibly fix the parity for this stripe
3230  * Any reads will already have been scheduled, so we just see if enough
3231  * data is available. The parity check is held off while parity
3232  * dependent operations are in flight.
3233  */
3234  if (sh->check_state ||
3235  (s.syncing && s.locked == 0 &&
3236  !test_bit(STRIPE_COMPUTE_RUN, &sh->state) &&
3237  !test_bit(STRIPE_INSYNC, &sh->state)))
3238  handle_parity_checks5(conf, sh, &s, disks);
3239 
3240  if (s.syncing && s.locked == 0 && test_bit(STRIPE_INSYNC, &sh->state)) {
3241  md_done_sync(conf->mddev, STRIPE_SECTORS,1);
3242  clear_bit(STRIPE_SYNCING, &sh->state);
3243  }
3244 
3245  /* If the failed drive is just a ReadError, then we might need to progress
3246  * the repair/check process
3247  */
3248  if (s.failed == 1 && !conf->mddev->ro &&
3249  test_bit(R5_ReadError, &sh->dev[s.failed_num].flags)
3250  && !test_bit(R5_LOCKED, &sh->dev[s.failed_num].flags)
3251  && test_bit(R5_UPTODATE, &sh->dev[s.failed_num].flags)
3252  ) {
3253  dev = &sh->dev[s.failed_num];
3254  if (!test_bit(R5_ReWrite, &dev->flags)) {
3255  set_bit(R5_Wantwrite, &dev->flags);
3256  set_bit(R5_ReWrite, &dev->flags);
3257  set_bit(R5_LOCKED, &dev->flags);
3258  s.locked++;
3259  } else {
3260  /* let's read it back */
3261  set_bit(R5_Wantread, &dev->flags);
3262  set_bit(R5_LOCKED, &dev->flags);
3263  s.locked++;
3264  }
3265  }
3266 
3267  /* Finish reconstruct operations initiated by the expansion process */
3268  if (sh->reconstruct_state == reconstruct_state_result) {
3269  struct stripe_head *sh2
3270  = get_active_stripe(conf, sh->sector, 1, 1, 1);
3271  if (sh2 && test_bit(STRIPE_EXPAND_SOURCE, &sh2->state)) {
3272  /* sh cannot be written until sh2 has been read.
3273  * so arrange for sh to be delayed a little
3274  */
3275  set_bit(STRIPE_DELAYED, &sh->state);
3276  set_bit(STRIPE_HANDLE, &sh->state);
3277  if (!test_and_set_bit(STRIPE_PREREAD_ACTIVE,
3278  &sh2->state))
3279  atomic_inc(&conf->preread_active_stripes);
3280  release_stripe(sh2);
3281  goto unlock;
3282  }
3283  if (sh2)
3284  release_stripe(sh2);
3285 
3286  sh->reconstruct_state = reconstruct_state_idle;
3287  clear_bit(STRIPE_EXPANDING, &sh->state);
3288  for (i = conf->raid_disks; i--; ) {
3289  set_bit(R5_Wantwrite, &sh->dev[i].flags);
3290  set_bit(R5_LOCKED, &sh->dev[i].flags);
3291  s.locked++;
3292  }
3293  }
3294 
3295  if (s.expanded && test_bit(STRIPE_EXPANDING, &sh->state) &&
3296  !sh->reconstruct_state) {
3297  /* Need to write out all blocks after computing parity */
3298  sh->disks = conf->raid_disks;
3299  stripe_set_idx(sh->sector, conf, 0, sh);
3300  schedule_reconstruction(sh, &s, 1, 1);
3301  } else if (s.expanded && !sh->reconstruct_state && s.locked == 0) {
3302  clear_bit(STRIPE_EXPAND_READY, &sh->state);
3303  atomic_dec(&conf->reshape_stripes);
3304  wake_up(&conf->wait_for_overlap);
3305  md_done_sync(conf->mddev, STRIPE_SECTORS, 1);
3306  }
3307 
3308  if (s.expanding && s.locked == 0 &&
3309  !test_bit(STRIPE_COMPUTE_RUN, &sh->state))
3310  handle_stripe_expansion(conf, sh, NULL);
3311 
3312  unlock:
3313  spin_unlock(&sh->lock);
3314 
3315  /* wait for this device to become unblocked */
3316  if (unlikely(blocked_rdev))
3317  md_wait_for_blocked_rdev(blocked_rdev, conf->mddev);
3318 
3319  if (s.ops_request)
3320  raid_run_ops(sh, s.ops_request);
3321 
3322  ops_run_io(sh, &s);
3323 
3324  if (dec_preread_active) {
3325  /* We delay this until after ops_run_io so that if make_request
3326  * is waiting on a flush, it won't continue until the writes
3327  * have actually been submitted.
3328  */
3329  atomic_dec(&conf->preread_active_stripes);
3330  if (atomic_read(&conf->preread_active_stripes) <
3331  IO_THRESHOLD)
3332  md_wakeup_thread(conf->mddev->thread);
3333  }
3334  return_io(return_bi);
3335 }
3336 
3337 static void handle_stripe6(struct stripe_head *sh)
3338 {
3339  raid5_conf_t *conf = sh->raid_conf;
3340  int disks = sh->disks;
3341  struct bio *return_bi = NULL;
3342  int i, pd_idx = sh->pd_idx, qd_idx = sh->qd_idx;
3343  struct stripe_head_state s;
3344  struct r6_state r6s;
3345  struct r5dev *dev, *pdev, *qdev;
3346  mdk_rdev_t *blocked_rdev = NULL;
3347  int dec_preread_active = 0;
3348 
3349  pr_debug("handling stripe %llu, state=%#lx cnt=%d, "
3350  "pd_idx=%d, qd_idx=%d\n, check:%d, reconstruct:%d\n",
3351  (unsigned long long)sh->sector, sh->state,
3352  atomic_read(&sh->count), pd_idx, qd_idx,
3353  sh->check_state, sh->reconstruct_state);
3354  memset(&s, 0, sizeof(s));
3355 
3356  spin_lock(&sh->lock);
3357  clear_bit(STRIPE_HANDLE, &sh->state);
3358  clear_bit(STRIPE_DELAYED, &sh->state);
3359 
3360  s.syncing = test_bit(STRIPE_SYNCING, &sh->state);
3361  s.expanding = test_bit(STRIPE_EXPAND_SOURCE, &sh->state);
3362  s.expanded = test_bit(STRIPE_EXPAND_READY, &sh->state);
3363  /* Now to look around and see what can be done */
3364 
3365  rcu_read_lock();
3366  for (i=disks; i--; ) {
3367  mdk_rdev_t *rdev;
3368  dev = &sh->dev[i];
3369 
3370  pr_debug("check %d: state 0x%lx read %p write %p written %p\n",
3371  i, dev->flags, dev->toread, dev->towrite, dev->written);
3372  /* maybe we can reply to a read
3373  *
3374  * new wantfill requests are only permitted while
3375  * ops_complete_biofill is guaranteed to be inactive
3376  */
3377  if (test_bit(R5_UPTODATE, &dev->flags) && dev->toread &&
3378  !test_bit(STRIPE_BIOFILL_RUN, &sh->state))
3379  set_bit(R5_Wantfill, &dev->flags);
3380 
3381  /* now count some things */
3382  if (test_bit(R5_LOCKED, &dev->flags)) s.locked++;
3383  if (test_bit(R5_UPTODATE, &dev->flags)) s.uptodate++;
3384  if (test_bit(R5_Wantcompute, &dev->flags)) {
3385  s.compute++;
3386  BUG_ON(s.compute > 2);
3387  }
3388 
3389  if (test_bit(R5_Wantfill, &dev->flags)) {
3390  s.to_fill++;
3391  } else if (dev->toread)
3392  s.to_read++;
3393  if (dev->towrite) {
3394  s.to_write++;
3395  if (!test_bit(R5_OVERWRITE, &dev->flags))
3396  s.non_overwrite++;
3397  }
3398  if (dev->written)
3399  s.written++;
3400  rdev = rcu_dereference(conf->disks[i].rdev);
3401  if (blocked_rdev == NULL &&
3402  rdev && unlikely(test_bit(Blocked, &rdev->flags))) {
3403  blocked_rdev = rdev;
3404  atomic_inc(&rdev->nr_pending);
3405  }
3406  clear_bit(R5_Insync, &dev->flags);
3407  if (!rdev)
3408  /* Not in-sync */;
3409  else if (test_bit(In_sync, &rdev->flags))
3410  set_bit(R5_Insync, &dev->flags);
3411  else {
3412  /* in sync if before recovery_offset */
3413  if (sh->sector + STRIPE_SECTORS <= rdev->recovery_offset)
3414  set_bit(R5_Insync, &dev->flags);
3415  }
3416  if (!test_bit(R5_Insync, &dev->flags)) {
3417  /* The ReadError flag will just be confusing now */
3418  clear_bit(R5_ReadError, &dev->flags);
3419  clear_bit(R5_ReWrite, &dev->flags);
3420  }
3421  if (test_bit(R5_ReadError, &dev->flags))
3422  clear_bit(R5_Insync, &dev->flags);
3423  if (!test_bit(R5_Insync, &dev->flags)) {
3424  if (s.failed < 2)
3425  r6s.failed_num[s.failed] = i;
3426  s.failed++;
3427  }
3428  }
3429  rcu_read_unlock();
3430 
3431  if (unlikely(blocked_rdev)) {
3432  if (s.syncing || s.expanding || s.expanded ||
3433  s.to_write || s.written) {
3434  set_bit(STRIPE_HANDLE, &sh->state);
3435  goto unlock;
3436  }
3437  /* There is nothing for the blocked_rdev to block */
3438  rdev_dec_pending(blocked_rdev, conf->mddev);
3439  blocked_rdev = NULL;
3440  }
3441 
3442  if (s.to_fill && !test_bit(STRIPE_BIOFILL_RUN, &sh->state)) {
3443  set_bit(STRIPE_OP_BIOFILL, &s.ops_request);
3444  set_bit(STRIPE_BIOFILL_RUN, &sh->state);
3445  }
3446 
3447  pr_debug("locked=%d uptodate=%d to_read=%d"
3448  " to_write=%d failed=%d failed_num=%d,%d\n",
3449  s.locked, s.uptodate, s.to_read, s.to_write, s.failed,
3450  r6s.failed_num[0], r6s.failed_num[1]);
3451  /* check if the array has lost >2 devices and, if so, some requests
3452  * might need to be failed
3453  */
3454  if (s.failed > 2 && s.to_read+s.to_write+s.written)
3455  handle_failed_stripe(conf, sh, &s, disks, &return_bi);
3456  if (s.failed > 2 && s.syncing) {
3457  md_done_sync(conf->mddev, STRIPE_SECTORS,0);
3458  clear_bit(STRIPE_SYNCING, &sh->state);
3459  s.syncing = 0;
3460  }
3461 
3462  /*
3463  * might be able to return some write requests if the parity blocks
3464  * are safe, or on a failed drive
3465  */
3466  pdev = &sh->dev[pd_idx];
3467  r6s.p_failed = (s.failed >= 1 && r6s.failed_num[0] == pd_idx)
3468  || (s.failed >= 2 && r6s.failed_num[1] == pd_idx);
3469  qdev = &sh->dev[qd_idx];
3470  r6s.q_failed = (s.failed >= 1 && r6s.failed_num[0] == qd_idx)
3471  || (s.failed >= 2 && r6s.failed_num[1] == qd_idx);
3472 
3473  if ( s.written &&
3474  ( r6s.p_failed || ((test_bit(R5_Insync, &pdev->flags)
3475  && !test_bit(R5_LOCKED, &pdev->flags)
3476  && test_bit(R5_UPTODATE, &pdev->flags)))) &&
3477  ( r6s.q_failed || ((test_bit(R5_Insync, &qdev->flags)
3478  && !test_bit(R5_LOCKED, &qdev->flags)
3479  && test_bit(R5_UPTODATE, &qdev->flags)))))
3480  handle_stripe_clean_event(conf, sh, disks, &return_bi);
3481 
3482  /* Now we might consider reading some blocks, either to check/generate
3483  * parity, or to satisfy requests
3484  * or to load a block that is being partially written.
3485  */
3486  if (s.to_read || s.non_overwrite || (s.to_write && s.failed) ||
3487  (s.syncing && (s.uptodate + s.compute < disks)) || s.expanding)
3488  handle_stripe_fill6(sh, &s, &r6s, disks);
3489 
3490  /* Now we check to see if any write operations have recently
3491  * completed
3492  */
3493  if (sh->reconstruct_state == reconstruct_state_drain_result) {
3494 
3495  sh->reconstruct_state = reconstruct_state_idle;
3496  /* All the 'written' buffers and the parity blocks are ready to
3497  * be written back to disk
3498  */
3499  BUG_ON(!test_bit(R5_UPTODATE, &sh->dev[sh->pd_idx].flags));
3500  BUG_ON(!test_bit(R5_UPTODATE, &sh->dev[qd_idx].flags));
3501  for (i = disks; i--; ) {
3502  dev = &sh->dev[i];
3503  if (test_bit(R5_LOCKED, &dev->flags) &&
3504  (i == sh->pd_idx || i == qd_idx ||
3505  dev->written)) {
3506  pr_debug("Writing block %d\n", i);
3507  BUG_ON(!test_bit(R5_UPTODATE, &dev->flags));
3508  set_bit(R5_Wantwrite, &dev->flags);
3509  if (!test_bit(R5_Insync, &dev->flags) ||
3510  ((i == sh->pd_idx || i == qd_idx) &&
3511  s.failed == 0))
3512  set_bit(STRIPE_INSYNC, &sh->state);
3513  }
3514  }
3515  if (test_and_clear_bit(STRIPE_PREREAD_ACTIVE, &sh->state))
3516  dec_preread_active = 1;
3517  }
3518 
3519  /* Now to consider new write requests and what else, if anything
3520  * should be read. We do not handle new writes when:
3521  * 1/ A 'write' operation (copy+gen_syndrome) is already in flight.
3522  * 2/ A 'check' operation is in flight, as it may clobber the parity
3523  * block.
3524  */
3525  if (s.to_write && !sh->reconstruct_state && !sh->check_state)
3526  handle_stripe_dirtying6(conf, sh, &s, &r6s, disks);
3527 
3528  /* maybe we need to check and possibly fix the parity for this stripe
3529  * Any reads will already have been scheduled, so we just see if enough
3530  * data is available. The parity check is held off while parity
3531  * dependent operations are in flight.
3532  */
3533  if (sh->check_state ||
3534  (s.syncing && s.locked == 0 &&
3535  !test_bit(STRIPE_COMPUTE_RUN, &sh->state) &&
3536  !test_bit(STRIPE_INSYNC, &sh->state)))
3537  handle_parity_checks6(conf, sh, &s, &r6s, disks);
3538 
3539  if (s.syncing && s.locked == 0 && test_bit(STRIPE_INSYNC, &sh->state)) {
3540  md_done_sync(conf->mddev, STRIPE_SECTORS,1);
3541  clear_bit(STRIPE_SYNCING, &sh->state);
3542  }
3543 
3544  /* If the failed drives are just a ReadError, then we might need
3545  * to progress the repair/check process
3546  */
3547  if (s.failed <= 2 && !conf->mddev->ro)
3548  for (i = 0; i < s.failed; i++) {
3549  dev = &sh->dev[r6s.failed_num[i]];
3550  if (test_bit(R5_ReadError, &dev->flags)
3551  && !test_bit(R5_LOCKED, &dev->flags)
3552  && test_bit(R5_UPTODATE, &dev->flags)
3553  ) {
3554  if (!test_bit(R5_ReWrite, &dev->flags)) {
3555  set_bit(R5_Wantwrite, &dev->flags);
3556  set_bit(R5_ReWrite, &dev->flags);
3557  set_bit(R5_LOCKED, &dev->flags);
3558  s.locked++;
3559  } else {
3560  /* let's read it back */
3561  set_bit(R5_Wantread, &dev->flags);
3562  set_bit(R5_LOCKED, &dev->flags);
3563  s.locked++;
3564  }
3565  }
3566  }
3567 
3568  /* Finish reconstruct operations initiated by the expansion process */
3569  if (sh->reconstruct_state == reconstruct_state_result) {
3570  sh->reconstruct_state = reconstruct_state_idle;
3571  clear_bit(STRIPE_EXPANDING, &sh->state);
3572  for (i = conf->raid_disks; i--; ) {
3573  set_bit(R5_Wantwrite, &sh->dev[i].flags);
3574  set_bit(R5_LOCKED, &sh->dev[i].flags);
3575  s.locked++;
3576  }
3577  }
3578 
3579  if (s.expanded && test_bit(STRIPE_EXPANDING, &sh->state) &&
3580  !sh->reconstruct_state) {
3581  struct stripe_head *sh2
3582  = get_active_stripe(conf, sh->sector, 1, 1, 1);
3583  if (sh2 && test_bit(STRIPE_EXPAND_SOURCE, &sh2->state)) {
3584  /* sh cannot be written until sh2 has been read.
3585  * so arrange for sh to be delayed a little
3586  */
3587  set_bit(STRIPE_DELAYED, &sh->state);
3588  set_bit(STRIPE_HANDLE, &sh->state);
3589  if (!test_and_set_bit(STRIPE_PREREAD_ACTIVE,
3590  &sh2->state))
3591  atomic_inc(&conf->preread_active_stripes);
3592  release_stripe(sh2);
3593  goto unlock;
3594  }
3595  if (sh2)
3596  release_stripe(sh2);
3597 
3598  /* Need to write out all blocks after computing P&Q */
3599  sh->disks = conf->raid_disks;
3600  stripe_set_idx(sh->sector, conf, 0, sh);
3601  schedule_reconstruction(sh, &s, 1, 1);
3602  } else if (s.expanded && !sh->reconstruct_state && s.locked == 0) {
3603  clear_bit(STRIPE_EXPAND_READY, &sh->state);
3604  atomic_dec(&conf->reshape_stripes);
3605  wake_up(&conf->wait_for_overlap);
3606  md_done_sync(conf->mddev, STRIPE_SECTORS, 1);
3607  }
3608 
3609  if (s.expanding && s.locked == 0 &&
3610  !test_bit(STRIPE_COMPUTE_RUN, &sh->state))
3611  handle_stripe_expansion(conf, sh, &r6s);
3612 
3613  unlock:
3614  spin_unlock(&sh->lock);
3615 
3616  /* wait for this device to become unblocked */
3617  if (unlikely(blocked_rdev))
3618  md_wait_for_blocked_rdev(blocked_rdev, conf->mddev);
3619 
3620  if (s.ops_request)
3621  raid_run_ops(sh, s.ops_request);
3622 
3623  ops_run_io(sh, &s);
3624 
3625 
3626  if (dec_preread_active) {
3627  /* We delay this until after ops_run_io so that if make_request
3628  * is waiting on a flush, it won't continue until the writes
3629  * have actually been submitted.
3630  */
3631  atomic_dec(&conf->preread_active_stripes);
3632  if (atomic_read(&conf->preread_active_stripes) <
3633  IO_THRESHOLD)
3634  md_wakeup_thread(conf->mddev->thread);
3635  }
3636 
3637  return_io(return_bi);
3638 }
3639 
3640 static void handle_stripe(struct stripe_head *sh)
3641 {
3642  if (sh->raid_conf->level == 6)
3643  handle_stripe6(sh);
3644  else
3645  handle_stripe5(sh);
3646 }
3647 
3648 static void raid5_activate_delayed(raid5_conf_t *conf)
3649 {
3650  if (atomic_read(&conf->preread_active_stripes) < IO_THRESHOLD) {
3651  while (!list_empty(&conf->delayed_list)) {
3652  struct list_head *l = conf->delayed_list.next;
3653  struct stripe_head *sh;
3654  sh = list_entry(l, struct stripe_head, lru);
3655  list_del_init(l);
3656  clear_bit(STRIPE_DELAYED, &sh->state);
3657  if (!test_and_set_bit(STRIPE_PREREAD_ACTIVE, &sh->state))
3658  atomic_inc(&conf->preread_active_stripes);
3659  list_add_tail(&sh->lru, &conf->hold_list);
3660  }
3661  } else
3662  plugger_set_plug(&conf->plug);
3663 }
3664 
3665 static void activate_bit_delay(raid5_conf_t *conf)
3666 {
3667  /* device_lock is held */
3668  struct list_head head;
3669  list_add(&head, &conf->bitmap_list);
3670  list_del_init(&conf->bitmap_list);
3671  while (!list_empty(&head)) {
3672  struct stripe_head *sh = list_entry(head.next, struct stripe_head, lru);
3673  list_del_init(&sh->lru);
3674  atomic_inc(&sh->count);
3675  __release_stripe(conf, sh);
3676  }
3677 }

3679 static void unplug_slaves(mddev_t *mddev)
3680 {
3681  raid5_conf_t *conf = mddev->private;
3682  int i;
3683  int devs = max(conf->raid_disks, conf->previous_raid_disks);
3684 
3685  rcu_read_lock();
3686  for (i = 0; i < devs; i++) {
3687  mdk_rdev_t *rdev = rcu_dereference(conf->disks[i].rdev);
3688  if (rdev && !test_bit(Faulty, &rdev->flags) && atomic_read(&rdev->nr_pending)) {
3689  struct request_queue *r_queue = bdev_get_queue(rdev->bdev);
3690 
3691  atomic_inc(&rdev->nr_pending);
3692  rcu_read_unlock();
3693 
3694  blk_unplug(r_queue);
3695 
3696  rdev_dec_pending(rdev, mddev);
3697  rcu_read_lock();
3698  }
3699  }
3700  rcu_read_unlock();
3701 }
3702 
3703 void md_raid5_unplug_device(raid5_conf_t *conf)
3704 {
3705  unsigned long flags;
3706 
3707  spin_lock_irqsave(&conf->device_lock, flags);
3708 
3709  if (plugger_remove_plug(&conf->plug)) {
3710  conf->seq_flush++;
3711  raid5_activate_delayed(conf);
3712  }
3713  md_wakeup_thread(conf->mddev->thread);
3714 
3715  spin_unlock_irqrestore(&conf->device_lock, flags);
3716 
3717  unplug_slaves(conf->mddev);
3718 }
3719 EXPORT_SYMBOL_GPL(md_raid5_unplug_device);
