3733 int md_raid5_congested(mddev_t *mddev, int bits)
3734 {
3735  raid5_conf_t *conf = mddev->private;
3736 
3737  /* No difference between reads and writes. Just check
3738  * how busy the stripe_cache is
3739  */
3740 
3741  if (conf->inactive_blocked)
3742  return 1;
3743  if (conf->quiesce)
3744  return 1;
3745  if (list_empty_careful(&conf->inactive_list))
3746  return 1;
3747 
3748  return 0;
3749 }
3750 EXPORT_SYMBOL_GPL(md_raid5_congested);
3751 
3752 static int raid5_congested(void *data, int bits)
3753 {
3754  mddev_t *mddev = data;
3755 
3756  return mddev_congested(mddev, bits) ||
3757  md_raid5_congested(mddev, bits);
3758 }
3759 
3760 /* We want read requests to align with chunks where possible,
3761  * but write requests don't need to.
3762  */
3763 static int raid5_mergeable_bvec(struct request_queue *q,
3764  struct bvec_merge_data *bvm,
3765  struct bio_vec *biovec)
3766 {
3767  mddev_t *mddev = q->queuedata;
3768  sector_t sector = bvm->bi_sector + get_start_sect(bvm->bi_bdev);
3769  int max;
3770  unsigned int chunk_sectors = mddev->chunk_sectors;
3771  unsigned int bio_sectors = bvm->bi_size >> 9;
3772 
3773  if ((bvm->bi_rw & 1) == WRITE)
3774  return biovec->bv_len; /* always allow writes to be mergeable */
3775 
3776  if (mddev->new_chunk_sectors < mddev->chunk_sectors)
3777  chunk_sectors = mddev->new_chunk_sectors;
3778  max = (chunk_sectors - ((sector & (chunk_sectors - 1)) + bio_sectors)) << 9;
3779  if (max < 0) max = 0;
3780  if (max <= biovec->bv_len && bio_sectors == 0)
3781  return biovec->bv_len;
3782  else
3783  return max;
3784 }
3785 
3786 
3787 static int in_chunk_boundary(mddev_t *mddev, struct bio *bio)
3788 {
3789  sector_t sector = bio->bi_sector + get_start_sect(bio->bi_bdev);
3790  unsigned int chunk_sectors = mddev->chunk_sectors;
3791  unsigned int bio_sectors = bio->bi_size >> 9;
3792 
3793  if (mddev->new_chunk_sectors < mddev->chunk_sectors)
3794  chunk_sectors = mddev->new_chunk_sectors;
3795  return chunk_sectors >=
3796  ((sector & (chunk_sectors - 1)) + bio_sectors);
3797 }
3798 
3799 /*
3800  * add bio to the retry LIFO ( in O(1) ... we are in interrupt )
3801  * later sampled by raid5d.
3802  */
3803 static void add_bio_to_retry(struct bio *bi,raid5_conf_t *conf)
3804 {
3805  unsigned long flags;
3806 
3807  spin_lock_irqsave(&conf->device_lock, flags);
3808 
3809  bi->bi_next = conf->retry_read_aligned_list;
3810  conf->retry_read_aligned_list = bi;
3811 
3812  spin_unlock_irqrestore(&conf->device_lock, flags);
3813  md_wakeup_thread(conf->mddev->thread);
3814 }
3815 
3816 
3817 static struct bio *remove_bio_from_retry(raid5_conf_t *conf)
3818 {
3819  struct bio *bi;
3820 
3821  bi = conf->retry_read_aligned;
3822  if (bi) {
3823  conf->retry_read_aligned = NULL;
3824  return bi;
3825  }
3826  bi = conf->retry_read_aligned_list;
3827  if(bi) {
3828  conf->retry_read_aligned_list = bi->bi_next;
3829  bi->bi_next = NULL;
3830  /*
3831  * this sets the active strip count to 1 and the processed
3832  * strip count to zero (upper 8 bits)
3833  */
3834  bi->bi_phys_segments = 1; /* biased count of active stripes */
3835  }
3836 
3837  return bi;
3838 }
3839 
3840 
3841 /*
3842  * The "raid5_align_endio" should check if the read succeeded and if it
3843  * did, call bio_endio on the original bio (having bio_put the new bio
3844  * first).
3845  * If the read failed..
3846  */
3847 static void raid5_align_endio(struct bio *bi, int error)
3848 {
3849  struct bio* raid_bi = bi->bi_private;
3850  mddev_t *mddev;
3851  raid5_conf_t *conf;
3852  int uptodate = test_bit(BIO_UPTODATE, &bi->bi_flags);
3853  mdk_rdev_t *rdev;
3854 
3855  bio_put(bi);
3856 
3857  rdev = (void*)raid_bi->bi_next;
3858  raid_bi->bi_next = NULL;
3859  mddev = rdev->mddev;
3860  conf = mddev->private;
3861 
3862  rdev_dec_pending(rdev, conf->mddev);
3863 
3864  if (!error && uptodate) {
3865  bio_endio(raid_bi, 0);
3866  if (atomic_dec_and_test(&conf->active_aligned_reads))
3867  wake_up(&conf->wait_for_stripe);
3868  return;
3869  }
3870 
3871 
3872  pr_debug("raid5_align_endio : io error...handing IO for a retry\n");
3873 
3874  add_bio_to_retry(raid_bi, conf);
3875 }
3876 
3877 static int bio_fits_rdev(struct bio *bi)
3878 {
3879  struct request_queue *q = bdev_get_queue(bi->bi_bdev);
3880 
3881  if ((bi->bi_size>>9) > queue_max_sectors(q))
3882  return 0;
3883  blk_recount_segments(q, bi);
3884  if (bi->bi_phys_segments > queue_max_segments(q))
3885  return 0;
3886 
3887  if (q->merge_bvec_fn)
3888  /* it's too hard to apply the merge_bvec_fn at this stage,
3889  * just just give up
3890  */
3891  return 0;
3892 
3893  return 1;
3894 }
3895 
3896 
3897 static int chunk_aligned_read(mddev_t *mddev, struct bio * raid_bio)
3898 {
3899  raid5_conf_t *conf = mddev->private;
3900  int dd_idx;
3901  struct bio* align_bi;
3902  mdk_rdev_t *rdev;
3903 
3904  if (!in_chunk_boundary(mddev, raid_bio)) {
3905  pr_debug("chunk_aligned_read : non aligned\n");
3906  return 0;
3907  }
3908  /*
3909  * use bio_clone_mddev to make a copy of the bio
3910  */
3911  align_bi = bio_clone_mddev(raid_bio, GFP_NOIO, mddev);
3912  if (!align_bi)
3913  return 0;
3914  /*
3915  * set bi_end_io to a new function, and set bi_private to the
3916  * original bio.
3917  */
3918  align_bi->bi_end_io = raid5_align_endio;
3919  align_bi->bi_private = raid_bio;
3920  /*
3921  * compute position
3922  */
3923  align_bi->bi_sector = raid5_compute_sector(conf, raid_bio->bi_sector,
3924  0,
3925  &dd_idx, NULL);
3926 
3927  rcu_read_lock();
3928  rdev = rcu_dereference(conf->disks[dd_idx].rdev);
3929  if (rdev && test_bit(In_sync, &rdev->flags)) {
3930  atomic_inc(&rdev->nr_pending);
3931  rcu_read_unlock();
3932  raid_bio->bi_next = (void*)rdev;
3933  align_bi->bi_bdev = rdev->bdev;
3934  align_bi->bi_flags &= ~(1 << BIO_SEG_VALID);
3935  align_bi->bi_sector += rdev->data_offset;
3936 
3937  if (!bio_fits_rdev(align_bi)) {
3938  /* too big in some way */
3939  bio_put(align_bi);
3940  rdev_dec_pending(rdev, mddev);
3941  return 0;
3942  }
3943 
3944  spin_lock_irq(&conf->device_lock);
3945  wait_event_lock_irq(conf->wait_for_stripe,
3946  conf->quiesce == 0,
3947  conf->device_lock, /* nothing */);
3948  atomic_inc(&conf->active_aligned_reads);
3949  spin_unlock_irq(&conf->device_lock);
3950 
3951  generic_make_request(align_bi);
3952  return 1;
3953  } else {
3954  rcu_read_unlock();
3955  bio_put(align_bi);
3956  return 0;
3957  }
3958 }
3959 
3960 /* __get_priority_stripe - get the next stripe to process
3961  *
3962  * Full stripe writes are allowed to pass preread active stripes up until
3963  * the bypass_threshold is exceeded. In general the bypass_count
3964  * increments when the handle_list is handled before the hold_list; however, it
3965  * will not be incremented when STRIPE_IO_STARTED is sampled set signifying a
3966  * stripe with in flight i/o. The bypass_count will be reset when the
3967  * head of the hold_list has changed, i.e. the head was promoted to the
3968  * handle_list.
3969  */
3970 static struct stripe_head *__get_priority_stripe(raid5_conf_t *conf)
3971 {
3972  struct stripe_head *sh;
3973 
3974  pr_debug("%s: handle: %s hold: %s full_writes: %d bypass_count: %d\n",
3975  __func__,
3976  list_empty(&conf->handle_list) ? "empty" : "busy",
3977  list_empty(&conf->hold_list) ? "empty" : "busy",
3978  atomic_read(&conf->pending_full_writes), conf->bypass_count);
3979 
3980  if (!list_empty(&conf->handle_list)) {
3981  sh = list_entry(conf->handle_list.next, typeof(*sh), lru);
3982 
3983  if (list_empty(&conf->hold_list))
3984  conf->bypass_count = 0;
3985  else if (!test_bit(STRIPE_IO_STARTED, &sh->state)) {
3986  if (conf->hold_list.next == conf->last_hold)
3987  conf->bypass_count++;
3988  else {
3989  conf->last_hold = conf->hold_list.next;
3990  conf->bypass_count -= conf->bypass_threshold;
3991  if (conf->bypass_count < 0)
3992  conf->bypass_count = 0;
3993  }
3994  }
3995  } else if (!list_empty(&conf->hold_list) &&
3996  ((conf->bypass_threshold &&
3997  conf->bypass_count > conf->bypass_threshold) ||
3998  atomic_read(&conf->pending_full_writes) == 0)) {
3999  sh = list_entry(conf->hold_list.next,
4000  typeof(*sh), lru);
4001  conf->bypass_count -= conf->bypass_threshold;
4002  if (conf->bypass_count < 0)
4003  conf->bypass_count = 0;
4004  } else
4005  return NULL;
4006 
4007  list_del_init(&sh->lru);
4008  atomic_inc(&sh->count);
4009  BUG_ON(atomic_read(&sh->count) != 1);
4010  return sh;
4011 }
4012 
4013 static int make_request(mddev_t *mddev, struct bio * bi)
4014 {
4015  raid5_conf_t *conf = mddev->private;
4016  int dd_idx;
4017  sector_t new_sector;
4018  sector_t logical_sector, last_sector;
4019  struct stripe_head *sh;
4020  const int rw = bio_data_dir(bi);
4021  int remaining;
4022 
4023  if (unlikely(bi->bi_rw & REQ_FLUSH)) {
4024  md_flush_request(mddev, bi);
4025  return 0;
4026  }
4027 
4028  md_write_start(mddev, bi);
4029 
4030  if (rw == READ &&
4031  mddev->reshape_position == MaxSector &&
4032  chunk_aligned_read(mddev,bi))
4033  return 0;
4034 
4035  logical_sector = bi->bi_sector & ~((sector_t)STRIPE_SECTORS-1);
4036  last_sector = bi->bi_sector + (bi->bi_size>>9);
4037  bi->bi_next = NULL;
4038  bi->bi_phys_segments = 1; /* over-loaded to count active stripes */
4039 
4040  for (;logical_sector < last_sector; logical_sector += STRIPE_SECTORS) {
4041  DEFINE_WAIT(w);
4042  int disks, data_disks;
4043  int previous;
4044 
4045  retry:
4046  previous = 0;
4047  disks = conf->raid_disks;
4048  prepare_to_wait(&conf->wait_for_overlap, &w, TASK_UNINTERRUPTIBLE);
4049  if (unlikely(conf->reshape_progress != MaxSector)) {
4050  /* spinlock is needed as reshape_progress may be
4051  * 64bit on a 32bit platform, and so it might be
4052  * possible to see a half-updated value
4053  * Ofcourse reshape_progress could change after
4054  * the lock is dropped, so once we get a reference
4055  * to the stripe that we think it is, we will have
4056  * to check again.
4057  */
4058  spin_lock_irq(&conf->device_lock);
4059  if (mddev->delta_disks < 0
4060  ? logical_sector < conf->reshape_progress
4061  : logical_sector >= conf->reshape_progress) {
4062  disks = conf->previous_raid_disks;
4063  previous = 1;
4064  } else {
4065  if (mddev->delta_disks < 0
4066  ? logical_sector < conf->reshape_safe
4067  : logical_sector >= conf->reshape_safe) {
4068  spin_unlock_irq(&conf->device_lock);
4069  schedule();
4070  goto retry;
4071  }
4072  }
4073  spin_unlock_irq(&conf->device_lock);
4074  }
4075  data_disks = disks - conf->max_degraded;
4076 
4077  new_sector = raid5_compute_sector(conf, logical_sector,
4078  previous,
4079  &dd_idx, NULL);
4080  pr_debug("raid456: make_request, sector %llu logical %llu\n",
4081  (unsigned long long)new_sector,
4082  (unsigned long long)logical_sector);
4083 
4084  sh = get_active_stripe(conf, new_sector, previous,
4085  (bi->bi_rw&RWA_MASK), 0);
4086  if (sh) {
4087  if (unlikely(previous)) {
4088  /* expansion might have moved on while waiting for a
4089  * stripe, so we must do the range check again.
4090  * Expansion could still move past after this
4091  * test, but as we are holding a reference to
4092  * 'sh', we know that if that happens,
4093  * STRIPE_EXPANDING will get set and the expansion
4094  * won't proceed until we finish with the stripe.
4095  */
4096  int must_retry = 0;
4097  spin_lock_irq(&conf->device_lock);
4098  if (mddev->delta_disks < 0
4099  ? logical_sector >= conf->reshape_progress
4100  : logical_sector < conf->reshape_progress)
4101  /* mismatch, need to try again */
4102  must_retry = 1;
4103  spin_unlock_irq(&conf->device_lock);
4104  if (must_retry) {
4105  release_stripe(sh);
4106  schedule();
4107  goto retry;
4108  }
4109  }
4110 
4111  if (bio_data_dir(bi) == WRITE &&
4112  logical_sector >= mddev->suspend_lo &&
4113  logical_sector < mddev->suspend_hi) {
4114  release_stripe(sh);
4115  /* As the suspend_* range is controlled by
4116  * userspace, we want an interruptible
4117  * wait.
4118  */
4119  flush_signals(current);
4120  prepare_to_wait(&conf->wait_for_overlap,
4121  &w, TASK_INTERRUPTIBLE);
4122  if (logical_sector >= mddev->suspend_lo &&
4123  logical_sector < mddev->suspend_hi)
4124  schedule();
4125  goto retry;
4126  }
4127 
4128  if (test_bit(STRIPE_EXPANDING, &sh->state) ||
4129  !add_stripe_bio(sh, bi, dd_idx, (bi->bi_rw&RW_MASK))) {
4130  /* Stripe is busy expanding or
4131  * add failed due to overlap. Flush everything
4132  * and wait a while
4133  */
4134  md_raid5_unplug_device(conf);
4135  release_stripe(sh);
4136  schedule();
4137  goto retry;
4138  }
4139  finish_wait(&conf->wait_for_overlap, &w);
4140  set_bit(STRIPE_HANDLE, &sh->state);
4141  clear_bit(STRIPE_DELAYED, &sh->state);
4142  if ((bi->bi_rw & REQ_SYNC) &&
4143  !test_and_set_bit(STRIPE_PREREAD_ACTIVE, &sh->state))
4144  atomic_inc(&conf->preread_active_stripes);
4145  release_stripe(sh);
4146  } else {
4147  /* cannot get stripe for read-ahead, just give-up */
4148  clear_bit(BIO_UPTODATE, &bi->bi_flags);
4149  finish_wait(&conf->wait_for_overlap, &w);
4150  break;
4151  }
4152 
4153  }
4154  spin_lock_irq(&conf->device_lock);
4155  remaining = raid5_dec_bi_phys_segments(bi);
4156  spin_unlock_irq(&conf->device_lock);
4157  if (remaining == 0) {
4158 
4159  if ( rw == WRITE )
4160  md_write_end(mddev);
4161 
4162  bio_endio(bi, 0);
4163  }
4164 
4165  return 0;
4166 }
4167 
4168 static sector_t raid5_size(mddev_t *mddev, sector_t sectors, int raid_disks);
4169 
4170 static sector_t reshape_request(mddev_t *mddev, sector_t sector_nr, int *skipped)
4171 {
4172  /* reshaping is quite different to recovery/resync so it is
4173  * handled quite separately ... here.
4174  *
4175  * On each call to sync_request, we gather one chunk worth of
4176  * destination stripes and flag them as expanding.
4177  * Then we find all the source stripes and request reads.
4178  * As the reads complete, handle_stripe will copy the data
4179  * into the destination stripe and release that stripe.
4180  */
4181  raid5_conf_t *conf = mddev->private;
4182  struct stripe_head *sh;
4183  sector_t first_sector, last_sector;
4184  int raid_disks = conf->previous_raid_disks;
4185  int data_disks = raid_disks - conf->max_degraded;
4186  int new_data_disks = conf->raid_disks - conf->max_degraded;
4187  int i;
4188  int dd_idx;
4189  sector_t writepos, readpos, safepos;
4190  sector_t stripe_addr;
4191  int reshape_sectors;
4192  struct list_head stripes;
4193 
4194  if (sector_nr == 0) {
4195  /* If restarting in the middle, skip the initial sectors */
4196  if (mddev->delta_disks < 0 &&
4197  conf->reshape_progress < raid5_size(mddev, 0, 0)) {
4198  sector_nr = raid5_size(mddev, 0, 0)
4199  - conf->reshape_progress;
4200  } else if (mddev->delta_disks >= 0 &&
4201  conf->reshape_progress > 0)
4202  sector_nr = conf->reshape_progress;
4203  sector_div(sector_nr, new_data_disks);
4204  if (sector_nr) {
4205  mddev->curr_resync_completed = sector_nr;
4206  sysfs_notify(&mddev->kobj, NULL, "sync_completed");
4207  *skipped = 1;
4208  return sector_nr;
4209  }
4210  }
4211 
4212  /* We need to process a full chunk at a time.
4213  * If old and new chunk sizes differ, we need to process the
4214  * largest of these
4215  */
4216  if (mddev->new_chunk_sectors > mddev->chunk_sectors)
4217  reshape_sectors = mddev->new_chunk_sectors;
4218  else
4219  reshape_sectors = mddev->chunk_sectors;
4220 
4221  /* we update the metadata when there is more than 3Meg
4222  * in the block range (that is rather arbitrary, should
4223  * probably be time based) or when the data about to be
4224  * copied would over-write the source of the data at
4225  * the front of the range.
4226  * i.e. one new_stripe along from reshape_progress new_maps
4227  * to after where reshape_safe old_maps to
4228  */
4229  writepos = conf->reshape_progress;
4230  sector_div(writepos, new_data_disks);
4231  readpos = conf->reshape_progress;
4232  sector_div(readpos, data_disks);
4233  safepos = conf->reshape_safe;
4234  sector_div(safepos, data_disks);
4235  if (mddev->delta_disks < 0) {
4236  writepos -= min_t(sector_t, reshape_sectors, writepos);
4237  readpos += reshape_sectors;
4238  safepos += reshape_sectors;
4239  } else {
4240  writepos += reshape_sectors;
4241  readpos -= min_t(sector_t, reshape_sectors, readpos);
4242  safepos -= min_t(sector_t, reshape_sectors, safepos);
4243  }
4244 
4245  /* 'writepos' is the most advanced device address we might write.
4246  * 'readpos' is the least advanced device address we might read.
4247  * 'safepos' is the least address recorded in the metadata as having
4248  * been reshaped.
4249  * If 'readpos' is behind 'writepos', then there is no way that we can
4250  * ensure safety in the face of a crash - that must be done by userspace
4251  * making a backup of the data. So in that case there is no particular
4252  * rush to update metadata.
4253  * Otherwise if 'safepos' is behind 'writepos', then we really need to
4254  * update the metadata to advance 'safepos' to match 'readpos' so that
4255  * we can be safe in the event of a crash.
4256  * So we insist on updating metadata if safepos is behind writepos and
4257  * readpos is beyond writepos.
4258  * In any case, update the metadata every 10 seconds.
4259  * Maybe that number should be configurable, but I'm not sure it is
4260  * worth it.... maybe it could be a multiple of safemode_delay???
4261  */
4262  if ((mddev->delta_disks < 0
4263  ? (safepos > writepos && readpos < writepos)
4264  : (safepos < writepos && readpos > writepos)) ||
4265  time_after(jiffies, conf->reshape_checkpoint + 10*HZ)) {
4266  /* Cannot proceed until we've updated the superblock... */
4267  wait_event(conf->wait_for_overlap,
4268  atomic_read(&conf->reshape_stripes)==0);
4269  mddev->reshape_position = conf->reshape_progress;
4270  mddev->curr_resync_completed = sector_nr;
4271  conf->reshape_checkpoint = jiffies;
4272  set_bit(MD_CHANGE_DEVS, &mddev->flags);
4273  md_wakeup_thread(mddev->thread);
4274  wait_event(mddev->sb_wait, mddev->flags == 0 ||
4275  kthread_should_stop());
4276  spin_lock_irq(&conf->device_lock);
4277  conf->reshape_safe = mddev->reshape_position;
4278  spin_unlock_irq(&conf->device_lock);
4279  wake_up(&conf->wait_for_overlap);
4280  sysfs_notify(&mddev->kobj, NULL, "sync_completed");
4281  }
4282 
4283  if (mddev->delta_disks < 0) {
4284  BUG_ON(conf->reshape_progress == 0);
4285  stripe_addr = writepos;
4286  BUG_ON((mddev->dev_sectors &
4287  ~((sector_t)reshape_sectors - 1))
4288  - reshape_sectors - stripe_addr
4289  != sector_nr);
4290  } else {
4291  BUG_ON(writepos != sector_nr + reshape_sectors);
4292  stripe_addr = sector_nr;
4293  }
4294  INIT_LIST_HEAD(&stripes);
4295  for (i = 0; i < reshape_sectors; i += STRIPE_SECTORS) {
4296  int j;
4297  int skipped_disk = 0;
4298  sh = get_active_stripe(conf, stripe_addr+i, 0, 0, 1);
4299  set_bit(STRIPE_EXPANDING, &sh->state);
4300  atomic_inc(&conf->reshape_stripes);
4301  /* If any of this stripe is beyond the end of the old
4302  * array, then we need to zero those blocks
4303  */
4304  for (j=sh->disks; j--;) {
4305  sector_t s;
4306  if (j == sh->pd_idx)
4307  continue;
4308  if (conf->level == 6 &&
4309  j == sh->qd_idx)
4310  continue;
4311  s = compute_blocknr(sh, j, 0);
4312  if (s < raid5_size(mddev, 0, 0)) {
4313  skipped_disk = 1;
4314  continue;
4315  }
4316  memset(page_address(sh->dev[j].page), 0, STRIPE_SIZE);
4317  set_bit(R5_Expanded, &sh->dev[j].flags);
4318  set_bit(R5_UPTODATE, &sh->dev[j].flags);
4319  }
4320  if (!skipped_disk) {
4321  set_bit(STRIPE_EXPAND_READY, &sh->state);
4322  set_bit(STRIPE_HANDLE, &sh->state);
4323  }
4324  list_add(&sh->lru, &stripes);
4325  }
4326  spin_lock_irq(&conf->device_lock);
4327  if (mddev->delta_disks < 0)
4328  conf->reshape_progress -= reshape_sectors * new_data_disks;
4329  else
4330  conf->reshape_progress += reshape_sectors * new_data_disks;
4331  spin_unlock_irq(&conf->device_lock);
4332  /* Ok, those stripe are ready. We can start scheduling
4333  * reads on the source stripes.
4334  * The source stripes are determined by mapping the first and last
4335  * block on the destination stripes.
4336  */
4337  first_sector =
4338  raid5_compute_sector(conf, stripe_addr*(new_data_disks),
4339  1, &dd_idx, NULL);
4340  last_sector =
4341  raid5_compute_sector(conf, ((stripe_addr+reshape_sectors)
4342  * new_data_disks - 1),
4343  1, &dd_idx, NULL);
4344  if (last_sector >= mddev->dev_sectors)
4345  last_sector = mddev->dev_sectors - 1;
4346  while (first_sector <= last_sector) {
4347  sh = get_active_stripe(conf, first_sector, 1, 0, 1);
4348  set_bit(STRIPE_EXPAND_SOURCE, &sh->state);
4349  set_bit(STRIPE_HANDLE, &sh->state);
4350  release_stripe(sh);
4351  first_sector += STRIPE_SECTORS;
4352  }
4353  /* Now that the sources are clearly marked, we can release
4354  * the destination stripes
4355  */
4356  while (!list_empty(&stripes)) {
4357  sh = list_entry(stripes.next, struct stripe_head, lru);
4358  list_del_init(&sh->lru);
4359  release_stripe(sh);
4360  }
4361  /* If this takes us to the resync_max point where we have to pause,
4362  * then we need to write out the superblock.
4363  */
4364  sector_nr += reshape_sectors;
4365  if ((sector_nr - mddev->curr_resync_completed) * 2
4366  >= mddev->resync_max - mddev->curr_resync_completed) {
4367  /* Cannot proceed until we've updated the superblock... */
4368  wait_event(conf->wait_for_overlap,
4369  atomic_read(&conf->reshape_stripes) == 0);
4370  mddev->reshape_position = conf->reshape_progress;
4371  mddev->curr_resync_completed = sector_nr;
4372  conf->reshape_checkpoint = jiffies;
4373  set_bit(MD_CHANGE_DEVS, &mddev->flags);
4374  md_wakeup_thread(mddev->thread);
4375  wait_event(mddev->sb_wait,
4376  !test_bit(MD_CHANGE_DEVS, &mddev->flags)
4377  || kthread_should_stop());
4378  spin_lock_irq(&conf->device_lock);
4379  conf->reshape_safe = mddev->reshape_position;
4380  spin_unlock_irq(&conf->device_lock);
4381  wake_up(&conf->wait_for_overlap);
4382  sysfs_notify(&mddev->kobj, NULL, "sync_completed");
4383  }
4384  return reshape_sectors;
4385 }
4386 
4387 /* FIXME go_faster isn't used */
4388 static inline sector_t sync_request(mddev_t *mddev, sector_t sector_nr, int *skipped, int go_faster)
4389 {
4390  raid5_conf_t *conf = mddev->private;
4391  struct stripe_head *sh;
4392  sector_t max_sector = mddev->dev_sectors;
4393  sector_t sync_blocks;
4394  int still_degraded = 0;
4395  int i;
4396 
4397  if (sector_nr >= max_sector) {
4398  /* just being told to finish up .. nothing much to do */
4399  unplug_slaves(mddev);
4400 
4401  if (test_bit(MD_RECOVERY_RESHAPE, &mddev->recovery)) {
4402  end_reshape(conf);
4403  return 0;
4404  }
4405 
4406  if (mddev->curr_resync < max_sector) /* aborted */
4407  bitmap_end_sync(mddev->bitmap, mddev->curr_resync,
4408  &sync_blocks, 1);
4409  else /* completed sync */
4410  conf->fullsync = 0;
4411  bitmap_close_sync(mddev->bitmap);
4412 
4413  return 0;
4414  }
4415 
4416  /* Allow raid5_quiesce to complete */
4417  wait_event(conf->wait_for_overlap, conf->quiesce != 2);
4418 
4419  if (test_bit(MD_RECOVERY_RESHAPE, &mddev->recovery))
4420  return reshape_request(mddev, sector_nr, skipped);
4421 
4422  /* No need to check resync_max as we never do more than one
4423  * stripe, and as resync_max will always be on a chunk boundary,
4424  * if the check in md_do_sync didn't fire, there is no chance
4425  * of overstepping resync_max here
4426  */
4427 
4428  /* if there is too many failed drives and we are trying
4429  * to resync, then assert that we are finished, because there is
4430  * nothing we can do.
4431  */
4432  if (mddev->degraded >= conf->max_degraded &&
4433  test_bit(MD_RECOVERY_SYNC, &mddev->recovery)) {
4434  sector_t rv = mddev->dev_sectors - sector_nr;
4435  *skipped = 1;
4436  return rv;
4437  }
4438  if (!bitmap_start_sync(mddev->bitmap, sector_nr, &sync_blocks, 1) &&
4439  !test_bit(MD_RECOVERY_REQUESTED, &mddev->recovery) &&
4440  !conf->fullsync && sync_blocks >= STRIPE_SECTORS) {
4441  /* we can skip this block, and probably more */
4442  sync_blocks /= STRIPE_SECTORS;
4443  *skipped = 1;
4444  return sync_blocks * STRIPE_SECTORS; /* keep things rounded to whole stripes */
4445  }
4446 
4447 
4448  bitmap_cond_end_sync(mddev->bitmap, sector_nr);
4449 
4450  sh = get_active_stripe(conf, sector_nr, 0, 1, 0);
4451  if (sh == NULL) {
4452  sh = get_active_stripe(conf, sector_nr, 0, 0, 0);
4453  /* make sure we don't swamp the stripe cache if someone else
4454  * is trying to get access
4455  */
4456  schedule_timeout_uninterruptible(1);
4457  }
4458  /* Need to check if array will still be degraded after recovery/resync
4459  * We don't need to check the 'failed' flag as when that gets set,
4460  * recovery aborts.
4461  */
4462  for (i = 0; i < conf->raid_disks; i++)
4463  if (conf->disks[i].rdev == NULL)
4464  still_degraded = 1;
4465 
4466  bitmap_start_sync(mddev->bitmap, sector_nr, &sync_blocks, still_degraded);
4467 
4468  spin_lock(&sh->lock);
4469  set_bit(STRIPE_SYNCING, &sh->state);
4470  clear_bit(STRIPE_INSYNC, &sh->state);
4471  spin_unlock(&sh->lock);
4472 
4473  handle_stripe(sh);
4474  release_stripe(sh);
4475 
4476  return STRIPE_SECTORS;
4477 }
4478 
4479 static int retry_aligned_read(raid5_conf_t *conf, struct bio *raid_bio)
4480 {
4481  /* We may not be able to submit a whole bio at once as there
4482  * may not be enough stripe_heads available.
4483  * We cannot pre-allocate enough stripe_heads as we may need
4484  * more than exist in the cache (if we allow ever large chunks).
4485  * So we do one stripe head at a time and record in
4486  * ->bi_hw_segments how many have been done.
4487  *
4488  * We *know* that this entire raid_bio is in one chunk, so
4489  * it will be only one 'dd_idx' and only need one call to raid5_compute_sector.
4490  */
4491  struct stripe_head *sh;
4492  int dd_idx;
4493  sector_t sector, logical_sector, last_sector;
4494  int scnt = 0;
4495  int remaining;
4496  int handled = 0;
4497 
4498  logical_sector = raid_bio->bi_sector & ~((sector_t)STRIPE_SECTORS-1);
4499  sector = raid5_compute_sector(conf, logical_sector,
4500  0, &dd_idx, NULL);
4501  last_sector = raid_bio->bi_sector + (raid_bio->bi_size>>9);
4502 
4503  for (; logical_sector < last_sector;
4504  logical_sector += STRIPE_SECTORS,
4505  sector += STRIPE_SECTORS,
4506  scnt++) {
4507 
4508  if (scnt < raid5_bi_hw_segments(raid_bio))
4509  /* already done this stripe */
4510  continue;
4511 
4512  sh = get_active_stripe(conf, sector, 0, 1, 0);
4513 
4514  if (!sh) {
4515  /* failed to get a stripe - must wait */
4516  raid5_set_bi_hw_segments(raid_bio, scnt);
4517  conf->retry_read_aligned = raid_bio;
4518  return handled;
4519  }
4520 
4521  set_bit(R5_ReadError, &sh->dev[dd_idx].flags);
4522  if (!add_stripe_bio(sh, raid_bio, dd_idx, 0)) {
4523  release_stripe(sh);
4524  raid5_set_bi_hw_segments(raid_bio, scnt);
4525  conf->retry_read_aligned = raid_bio;
4526  return handled;
4527  }
4528 
4529  handle_stripe(sh);
4530  release_stripe(sh);
4531  handled++;
4532  }
4533  spin_lock_irq(&conf->device_lock);
4534  remaining = raid5_dec_bi_phys_segments(raid_bio);
4535  spin_unlock_irq(&conf->device_lock);
4536  if (remaining == 0)
4537  bio_endio(raid_bio, 0);
4538  if (atomic_dec_and_test(&conf->active_aligned_reads))
4539  wake_up(&conf->wait_for_stripe);
4540  return handled;
4541 }
4542 
4543 
4544 /*
4545  * This is our raid5 kernel thread.
4546  *
4547  * We scan the hash table for stripes which can be handled now.
4548  * During the scan, completed stripes are saved for us by the interrupt
4549  * handler, so that they will not have to wait for our next wakeup.
4550  */
4551 static void raid5d(mddev_t *mddev)
4552 {
4553  struct stripe_head *sh;
4554  raid5_conf_t *conf = mddev->private;
4555  int handled;
4556 
4557  pr_debug("+++ raid5d active\n");
4558 
4559  md_check_recovery(mddev);
4560 
4561  handled = 0;
4562  spin_lock_irq(&conf->device_lock);
4563  while (1) {
4564  struct bio *bio;
4565 
4566  if (conf->seq_flush != conf->seq_write) {
4567  int seq = conf->seq_flush;
4568  spin_unlock_irq(&conf->device_lock);
4569  bitmap_unplug(mddev->bitmap);
4570  spin_lock_irq(&conf->device_lock);
4571  conf->seq_write = seq;
4572  activate_bit_delay(conf);
4573  }
4574 
4575  while ((bio = remove_bio_from_retry(conf))) {
4576  int ok;
4577  spin_unlock_irq(&conf->device_lock);
4578  ok = retry_aligned_read(conf, bio);
4579  spin_lock_irq(&conf->device_lock);
4580  if (!ok)
4581  break;
4582  handled++;
4583  }
4584 
4585  sh = __get_priority_stripe(conf);
4586 
4587  if (!sh)
4588  break;
4589  spin_unlock_irq(&conf->device_lock);
4590 
4591  handled++;
4592  handle_stripe(sh);
4593  release_stripe(sh);
4594  cond_resched();
4595 
4596  spin_lock_irq(&conf->device_lock);
4597  }
4598  pr_debug("%d stripes handled\n", handled);
4599 
4600  spin_unlock_irq(&conf->device_lock);
4601 
4602  async_tx_issue_pending_all();
4603  unplug_slaves(mddev);
4604 
4605  pr_debug("--- raid5d inactive\n");
4606 }
4607 
4608 static ssize_t
4609 raid5_show_stripe_cache_size(mddev_t *mddev, char *page)
4610 {
4611  raid5_conf_t *conf = mddev->private;
4612  if (conf)
4613  return sprintf(page, "%d\n", conf->max_nr_stripes);
4614  else
4615  return 0;
4616 }
4617 
4618 int
4619 raid5_set_cache_size(mddev_t *mddev, int size)
4620 {
4621  raid5_conf_t *conf = mddev->private;
4622  int err;
4623 
4624  if (size <= 16 || size > 32768)
4625  return -EINVAL;
4626  while (size < conf->max_nr_stripes) {
4627  if (drop_one_stripe(conf))
4628  conf->max_nr_stripes--;
4629  else
4630  break;
4631  }
4632  err = md_allow_write(mddev);
4633  if (err)
4634  return err;
4635  while (size > conf->max_nr_stripes) {
4636  if (grow_one_stripe(conf))
4637  conf->max_nr_stripes++;
4638  else break;
4639  }
4640  return 0;
4641 }
4642 EXPORT_SYMBOL(raid5_set_cache_size);
4643 
4644 static ssize_t
4645 raid5_store_stripe_cache_size(mddev_t *mddev, const char *page, size_t len)
4646 {
4647  raid5_conf_t *conf = mddev->private;
4648  unsigned long new;
4649  int err;
4650 
4651  if (len >= PAGE_SIZE)
4652  return -EINVAL;
4653  if (!conf)
4654  return -ENODEV;
4655 
4656  if (strict_strtoul(page, 10, &new))
4657  return -EINVAL;
4658  err = raid5_set_cache_size(mddev, new);
4659  if (err)
4660  return err;
4661  return len;
4662 }

4666  raid5_show_stripe_cache_size,
4667  raid5_store_stripe_cache_size);

4670 raid5_show_preread_threshold(mddev_t *mddev, char *page)
4671 {

4674  return sprintf(page, "%d\n", conf->bypass_threshold);
4675  else

4679 static ssize_t
4680 raid5_store_preread_threshold(mddev_t *mddev, const char *page, size_t len)
4681 {
4682  raid5_conf_t *conf = mddev->private;
4683  unsigned long new;
4684  if (len >= PAGE_SIZE)
4685  return -EINVAL;
4686  if (!conf)
4687  return -ENODEV;
4688 
4689  if (strict_strtoul(page, 10, &new))
4690  return -EINVAL;
4691  if (new > conf->max_nr_stripes)
4692  return -EINVAL;
4693  conf->bypass_threshold = new;
4694  return len;
4695 }

4727 static sector_t
4728 raid5_size(mddev_t *mddev, sector_t sectors, int raid_disks)
4729 {
4730  raid5_conf_t *conf = mddev->private;
4731 
4732  if (!sectors)
4733  sectors = mddev->dev_sectors;
4734  if (!raid_disks)
4735  /* size is defined by the smallest of previous and new size */
4736  raid_disks = min(conf->raid_disks, conf->previous_raid_disks);
4737 
4738  sectors &= ~((sector_t)mddev->chunk_sectors - 1);
4739  sectors &= ~((sector_t)mddev->new_chunk_sectors - 1);
4740  return sectors * (raid_disks - conf->max_degraded);
4741 }
4742 
4743 static void raid5_free_percpu(raid5_conf_t *conf)
4744 {
4745  struct raid5_percpu *percpu;
4746  unsigned long cpu;
4747 
4748  if (!conf->percpu)
4749  return;
4750 
4751  get_online_cpus();
4752  for_each_possible_cpu(cpu) {
4753  percpu = per_cpu_ptr(conf->percpu, cpu);
4754  safe_put_page(percpu->spare_page);
4755  kfree(percpu->scribble);
4756  }
4757 #ifdef CONFIG_HOTPLUG_CPU
4758  unregister_cpu_notifier(&conf->cpu_notify);
4759 #endif
4760  put_online_cpus();
4761 
4762  free_percpu(conf->percpu);
4763 }
4764 
4765 static void free_conf(raid5_conf_t *conf)
4766 {
4767  shrink_stripes(conf);
4768  raid5_free_percpu(conf);
4769  kfree(conf->disks);
4770  kfree(conf->stripe_hashtbl);
4771  kfree(conf);
4772 }
4773 
4774 #ifdef CONFIG_HOTPLUG_CPU
4775 static int raid456_cpu_notify(struct notifier_block *nfb, unsigned long action,
4776  void *hcpu)
4777 {
4778  raid5_conf_t *conf = container_of(nfb, raid5_conf_t, cpu_notify);
4779  long cpu = (long)hcpu;
4780  struct raid5_percpu *percpu = per_cpu_ptr(conf->percpu, cpu);
4781 
4782  switch (action) {
4783  case CPU_UP_PREPARE:
4784  case CPU_UP_PREPARE_FROZEN:
4785  if (conf->level == 6 && !percpu->spare_page)
4786  percpu->spare_page = alloc_page(GFP_KERNEL);
4787  if (!percpu->scribble)
4788  percpu->scribble = kmalloc(conf->scribble_len, GFP_KERNEL);
4789 
4790  if (!percpu->scribble ||
4791  (conf->level == 6 && !percpu->spare_page)) {
4792  safe_put_page(percpu->spare_page);
4793  kfree(percpu->scribble);
4794  pr_err("%s: failed memory allocation for cpu%ld\n",
4795  __func__, cpu);
4796  return notifier_from_errno(-ENOMEM);
4797  }
4798  break;
4799  case CPU_DEAD:
4800  case CPU_DEAD_FROZEN:
4801  safe_put_page(percpu->spare_page);
4802  kfree(percpu->scribble);
4803  percpu->spare_page = NULL;
4804  percpu->scribble = NULL;
4805  break;
4806  default:
4807  break;
4808  }
4809  return NOTIFY_OK;
4810 }
4811 #endif
4812 
4813 static int raid5_alloc_percpu(raid5_conf_t *conf)
4814 {
4815  unsigned long cpu;
4816  struct page *spare_page;
4817  struct raid5_percpu __percpu *allcpus;
4818  void *scribble;
4819  int err;
4820 
4821  allcpus = alloc_percpu(struct raid5_percpu);
4822  if (!allcpus)
4823  return -ENOMEM;
4824  conf->percpu = allcpus;
4825 
4826  get_online_cpus();
4827  err = 0;
4828  for_each_present_cpu(cpu) {
4829  if (conf->level == 6) {
4830  spare_page = alloc_page(GFP_KERNEL);
4831  if (!spare_page) {
4832  err = -ENOMEM;
4833  break;
4834  }
4835  per_cpu_ptr(conf->percpu, cpu)->spare_page = spare_page;
4836  }
4837  scribble = kmalloc(conf->scribble_len, GFP_KERNEL);
4838  if (!scribble) {
4839  err = -ENOMEM;
4840  break;
4841  }
4842  per_cpu_ptr(conf->percpu, cpu)->scribble = scribble;
4843  }
4844 #ifdef CONFIG_HOTPLUG_CPU
4845  conf->cpu_notify.notifier_call = raid456_cpu_notify;
4846  conf->cpu_notify.priority = 0;
4847  if (err == 0)
4848  err = register_cpu_notifier(&conf->cpu_notify);
4849 #endif
4850  put_online_cpus();
4851 
4852  return err;
4853 }
4854 
4855 static raid5_conf_t *setup_conf(mddev_t *mddev)
4856 {
4857  raid5_conf_t *conf;
4858  int raid_disk, memory, max_disks;
4859  mdk_rdev_t *rdev;
4860  struct disk_info *disk;
4861 
4862  if (mddev->new_level != 5
4863  && mddev->new_level != 4
4864  && mddev->new_level != 6) {
4865  printk(KERN_ERR "md/raid:%s: raid level not set to 4/5/6 (%d)\n",
4866  mdname(mddev), mddev->new_level);
4867  return ERR_PTR(-EIO);
4868  }
4869  if ((mddev->new_level == 5
4870  && !algorithm_valid_raid5(mddev->new_layout)) ||
4871  (mddev->new_level == 6
4872  && !algorithm_valid_raid6(mddev->new_layout))) {
4873  printk(KERN_ERR "md/raid:%s: layout %d not supported\n",
4874  mdname(mddev), mddev->new_layout);
4875  return ERR_PTR(-EIO);
4876  }
4877  if (mddev->new_level == 6 && mddev->raid_disks < 4) {
4878  printk(KERN_ERR "md/raid:%s: not enough configured devices (%d, minimum 4)\n",
4879  mdname(mddev), mddev->raid_disks);
4880  return ERR_PTR(-EINVAL);
4881  }
4882 
4883  if (!mddev->new_chunk_sectors ||
4884  (mddev->new_chunk_sectors << 9) % PAGE_SIZE ||
4885  !is_power_of_2(mddev->new_chunk_sectors)) {
4886  printk(KERN_ERR "md/raid:%s: invalid chunk size %d\n",
4887  mdname(mddev), mddev->new_chunk_sectors << 9);
4888  return ERR_PTR(-EINVAL);
4889  }
4890 
4891  conf = kzalloc(sizeof(raid5_conf_t), GFP_KERNEL);
4892  if (conf == NULL)
4893  goto abort;
4894  spin_lock_init(&conf->device_lock);
4895  init_waitqueue_head(&conf->wait_for_stripe);
4896  init_waitqueue_head(&conf->wait_for_overlap);
4897  INIT_LIST_HEAD(&conf->handle_list);
4898  INIT_LIST_HEAD(&conf->hold_list);
4899  INIT_LIST_HEAD(&conf->delayed_list);
4900  INIT_LIST_HEAD(&conf->bitmap_list);
4901  INIT_LIST_HEAD(&conf->inactive_list);
4902  atomic_set(&conf->active_stripes, 0);
4903  atomic_set(&conf->preread_active_stripes, 0);
4904  atomic_set(&conf->active_aligned_reads, 0);
4905  conf->bypass_threshold = BYPASS_THRESHOLD;
4906 
4907  conf->raid_disks = mddev->raid_disks;
4908  if (mddev->reshape_position == MaxSector)
4909  conf->previous_raid_disks = mddev->raid_disks;
4910  else
4911  conf->previous_raid_disks = mddev->raid_disks - mddev->delta_disks;
4912  max_disks = max(conf->raid_disks, conf->previous_raid_disks);
4913  conf->scribble_len = scribble_len(max_disks);
4914 
4915  conf->disks = kzalloc(max_disks * sizeof(struct disk_info),
4916  GFP_KERNEL);
4917  if (!conf->disks)
4918  goto abort;
4919 
4920  conf->mddev = mddev;
4921 
4922  if ((conf->stripe_hashtbl = kzalloc(PAGE_SIZE, GFP_KERNEL)) == NULL)
4923  goto abort;
4924 
4925  conf->level = mddev->new_level;
4926  if (raid5_alloc_percpu(conf) != 0)
4927  goto abort;
4928 
4929  pr_debug("raid456: run(%s) called.\n", mdname(mddev));
4930 
4931  list_for_each_entry(rdev, &mddev->disks, same_set) {
4932  raid_disk = rdev->raid_disk;
4933  if (raid_disk >= max_disks
4934  || raid_disk < 0)
4935  continue;
4936  disk = conf->disks + raid_disk;
4937 
4938  disk->rdev = rdev;
4939 
4940  if (test_bit(In_sync, &rdev->flags)) {
4941  char b[BDEVNAME_SIZE];
4942  printk(KERN_INFO "md/raid:%s: device %s operational as raid"
4943  " disk %d\n",
4944  mdname(mddev), bdevname(rdev->bdev, b), raid_disk);
4945  } else
4946  /* Cannot rely on bitmap to complete recovery */
4947  conf->fullsync = 1;
4948  }
4949 
4950  conf->chunk_sectors = mddev->new_chunk_sectors;
4951  conf->level = mddev->new_level;
4952  if (conf->level == 6)
4953  conf->max_degraded = 2;
4954  else
4955  conf->max_degraded = 1;
4956  conf->algorithm = mddev->new_layout;
4957  conf->max_nr_stripes = NR_STRIPES;
4958  conf->reshape_progress = mddev->reshape_position;
4959  if (conf->reshape_progress != MaxSector) {
4960  conf->prev_chunk_sectors = mddev->chunk_sectors;
4961  conf->prev_algo = mddev->layout;
4962  }
4963 
4964  memory = conf->max_nr_stripes * (sizeof(struct stripe_head) +
4965  max_disks * ((sizeof(struct bio) + PAGE_SIZE))) / 1024;
4966  if (grow_stripes(conf, conf->max_nr_stripes)) {
4967  printk(KERN_ERR
4968  "md/raid:%s: couldn't allocate %dkB for buffers\n",
4969  mdname(mddev), memory);
4970  goto abort;
4971  } else
4972  printk(KERN_INFO "md/raid:%s: allocated %dkB\n",
4973  mdname(mddev), memory);
4974 
4975  conf->thread = md_register_thread(raid5d, mddev, NULL);
4976  if (!conf->thread) {
4977  printk(KERN_ERR
4978  "md/raid:%s: couldn't allocate thread.\n",
4979  mdname(mddev));
4980  goto abort;
4981  }
4982 
4983  return conf;
4984 
4985  abort:
4986  if (conf) {
4987  free_conf(conf);
4988  return ERR_PTR(-EIO);
4989  } else
4990  return ERR_PTR(-ENOMEM);
4991 }
4992 
4993 
4994 static int only_parity(int raid_disk, int algo, int raid_disks, int max_degraded)
4995 {
4996  switch (algo) {
4997  case ALGORITHM_PARITY_0:
4998  if (raid_disk < max_degraded)
4999  return 1;
5000  break;
5001  case ALGORITHM_PARITY_N:
5002  if (raid_disk >= raid_disks - max_degraded)
5003  return 1;
5004  break;
5005  case ALGORITHM_PARITY_0_6:
5006  if (raid_disk == 0 ||
5007  raid_disk == raid_disks - 1)
5008  return 1;
5009  break;
5010  case ALGORITHM_LEFT_ASYMMETRIC_6:
5011  case ALGORITHM_RIGHT_ASYMMETRIC_6:
5012  case ALGORITHM_LEFT_SYMMETRIC_6:
5013  case ALGORITHM_RIGHT_SYMMETRIC_6:
5014  if (raid_disk == raid_disks - 1)
5015  return 1;
5016  }
5017  return 0;
5018 }
5019 
5020 static int run(mddev_t *mddev)
5021 {
5022  raid5_conf_t *conf;
5023  int working_disks = 0;
5024  int dirty_parity_disks = 0;
5025  mdk_rdev_t *rdev;
5026  sector_t reshape_offset = 0;
5027 
5028  if (mddev->recovery_cp != MaxSector)
5029  printk(KERN_NOTICE "md/raid:%s: not clean"
5030  " -- starting background reconstruction\n",
5031  mdname(mddev));
5032  if (mddev->reshape_position != MaxSector) {
5033  /* Check that we can continue the reshape.
5034  * Currently only disks can change, it must
5035  * increase, and we must be past the point where
5036  * a stripe over-writes itself
5037  */
5038  sector_t here_new, here_old;
5039  int old_disks;
5040  int max_degraded = (mddev->level == 6 ? 2 : 1);
5041 
5042  if (mddev->new_level != mddev->level) {
5043  printk(KERN_ERR "md/raid:%s: unsupported reshape "
5044  "required - aborting.\n",
5045  mdname(mddev));
5046  return -EINVAL;
5047  }
5048  old_disks = mddev->raid_disks - mddev->delta_disks;
5049  /* reshape_position must be on a new-stripe boundary, and one
5050  * further up in new geometry must map after here in old
5051  * geometry.
5052  */
5053  here_new = mddev->reshape_position;
5054  if (sector_div(here_new, mddev->new_chunk_sectors *
5055  (mddev->raid_disks - max_degraded))) {
5056  printk(KERN_ERR "md/raid:%s: reshape_position not "
5057  "on a stripe boundary\n", mdname(mddev));
5058  return -EINVAL;
5059  }
5060  reshape_offset = here_new * mddev->new_chunk_sectors;
5061  /* here_new is the stripe we will write to */
5062  here_old = mddev->reshape_position;
5063  sector_div(here_old, mddev->chunk_sectors *
5064  (old_disks-max_degraded));
5065  /* here_old is the first stripe that we might need to read
5066  * from */
5067  if (mddev->delta_disks == 0) {
5068  /* We cannot be sure it is safe to start an in-place
5069  * reshape. It is only safe if user-space if monitoring
5070  * and taking constant backups.
5071  * mdadm always starts a situation like this in
5072  * readonly mode so it can take control before
5073  * allowing any writes. So just check for that.
5074  */
5075  if ((here_new * mddev->new_chunk_sectors !=
5076  here_old * mddev->chunk_sectors) ||
5077  mddev->ro == 0) {
5078  printk(KERN_ERR "md/raid:%s: in-place reshape must be started"
5079  " in read-only mode - aborting\n",
5080  mdname(mddev));
5081  return -EINVAL;
5082  }
5083  } else if (mddev->delta_disks < 0
5084  ? (here_new * mddev->new_chunk_sectors <=
5085  here_old * mddev->chunk_sectors)
5086  : (here_new * mddev->new_chunk_sectors >=
5087  here_old * mddev->chunk_sectors)) {
5088  /* Reading from the same stripe as writing to - bad */
5089  printk(KERN_ERR "md/raid:%s: reshape_position too early for "
5090  "auto-recovery - aborting.\n",
5091  mdname(mddev));
5092  return -EINVAL;
5093  }
5094  printk(KERN_INFO "md/raid:%s: reshape will continue\n",
5095  mdname(mddev));
5096  /* OK, we should be able to continue; */
5097  } else {
5098  BUG_ON(mddev->level != mddev->new_level);
5099  BUG_ON(mddev->layout != mddev->new_layout);
5100  BUG_ON(mddev->chunk_sectors != mddev->new_chunk_sectors);
5101  BUG_ON(mddev->delta_disks != 0);
5102  }
5103 
5104  if (mddev->private == NULL)
5105  conf = setup_conf(mddev);
5106  else
5107  conf = mddev->private;
5108 
5109  if (IS_ERR(conf))
5110  return PTR_ERR(conf);
5111 
5112  mddev->thread = conf->thread;
5113  conf->thread = NULL;
5114  mddev->private = conf;
5115 
5116  /*
5117  * 0 for a fully functional array, 1 or 2 for a degraded array.
5118  */
5119  list_for_each_entry(rdev, &mddev->disks, same_set) {
5120  if (rdev->raid_disk < 0)
5121  continue;
5122  if (test_bit(In_sync, &rdev->flags)) {
5123  working_disks++;
5124  continue;
5125  }
5126  /* This disc is not fully in-sync. However if it
5127  * just stored parity (beyond the recovery_offset),
5128  * when we don't need to be concerned about the
5129  * array being dirty.
5130  * When reshape goes 'backwards', we never have
5131  * partially completed devices, so we only need
5132  * to worry about reshape going forwards.
5133  */
5134  /* Hack because v0.91 doesn't store recovery_offset properly. */
5135  if (mddev->major_version == 0 &&
5136  mddev->minor_version > 90)
5137  rdev->recovery_offset = reshape_offset;
5138 
5139  if (rdev->recovery_offset < reshape_offset) {
5140  /* We need to check old and new layout */
5141  if (!only_parity(rdev->raid_disk,
5142  conf->algorithm,
5143  conf->raid_disks,
5144  conf->max_degraded))
5145  continue;
5146  }
5147  if (!only_parity(rdev->raid_disk,
5148  conf->prev_algo,
5149  conf->previous_raid_disks,
5150  conf->max_degraded))
5151  continue;
5152  dirty_parity_disks++;
5153  }
5154 
5155  mddev->degraded = (max(conf->raid_disks, conf->previous_raid_disks)
5156  - working_disks);
5157 
5158  if (has_failed(conf)) {
5159  printk(KERN_ERR "md/raid:%s: not enough operational devices"
5160  " (%d/%d failed)\n",
5161  mdname(mddev), mddev->degraded, conf->raid_disks);
5162  goto abort;
5163  }
5164 
5165  /* device size must be a multiple of chunk size */
5166  mddev->dev_sectors &= ~(mddev->chunk_sectors - 1);
5167  mddev->resync_max_sectors = mddev->dev_sectors;
5168 
5169  if (mddev->degraded > dirty_parity_disks &&
5170  mddev->recovery_cp != MaxSector) {
5171  if (mddev->ok_start_degraded)
5172  printk(KERN_WARNING
5173  "md/raid:%s: starting dirty degraded array"
5174  " - data corruption possible.\n",
5175  mdname(mddev));
5176  else {
5177  printk(KERN_ERR
5178  "md/raid:%s: cannot start dirty degraded array.\n",
5179  mdname(mddev));
5180  goto abort;
5181  }
5182  }
5183 
5184  if (mddev->degraded == 0)
5185  printk(KERN_INFO "md/raid:%s: raid level %d active with %d out of %d"
5186  " devices, algorithm %d\n", mdname(mddev), conf->level,
5187  mddev->raid_disks-mddev->degraded, mddev->raid_disks,
5188  mddev->new_layout);
5189  else
5190  printk(KERN_ALERT "md/raid:%s: raid level %d active with %d"
5191  " out of %d devices, algorithm %d\n",
5192  mdname(mddev), conf->level,
5193  mddev->raid_disks - mddev->degraded,
5194  mddev->raid_disks, mddev->new_layout);
5195 
5196  print_raid5_conf(conf);
5197 
5198  if (conf->reshape_progress != MaxSector) {
5199  conf->reshape_safe = conf->reshape_progress;
5200  atomic_set(&conf->reshape_stripes, 0);
5201  clear_bit(MD_RECOVERY_SYNC, &mddev->recovery);
5202  clear_bit(MD_RECOVERY_CHECK, &mddev->recovery);
5203  set_bit(MD_RECOVERY_RESHAPE, &mddev->recovery);
5204  set_bit(MD_RECOVERY_RUNNING, &mddev->recovery);
5205  mddev->sync_thread = md_register_thread(md_do_sync, mddev,
5206  "reshape");
5207  }
5208 
5209 
5210  /* Ok, everything is just fine now */
5211  if (mddev->to_remove == &raid5_attrs_group)
5212  mddev->to_remove = NULL;
5213  else if (mddev->kobj.sd &&
5214  sysfs_create_group(&mddev->kobj, &raid5_attrs_group))
5215  printk(KERN_WARNING
5216  "raid5: failed to create sysfs attributes for %s\n",
5217  mdname(mddev));
5218  md_set_array_sectors(mddev, raid5_size(mddev, 0, 0));
5219 
5220  plugger_init(&conf->plug, raid5_unplug);
5221  mddev->plug = &conf->plug;
5222  if (mddev->queue) {
5223  int chunk_size;
5224  /* read-ahead size must cover two whole stripes, which
5225  * is 2 * (datadisks) * chunksize where 'n' is the
5226  * number of raid devices
5227  */
5228  int data_disks = conf->previous_raid_disks - conf->max_degraded;
5229  int stripe = data_disks *
5230  ((mddev->chunk_sectors << 9) / PAGE_SIZE);
5231  if (mddev->queue->backing_dev_info.ra_pages < 2 * stripe)
5232  mddev->queue->backing_dev_info.ra_pages = 2 * stripe;
5233 
5234  blk_queue_merge_bvec(mddev->queue, raid5_mergeable_bvec);
5235 
5236  mddev->queue->backing_dev_info.congested_data = mddev;
5237  mddev->queue->backing_dev_info.congested_fn = raid5_congested;
5238  mddev->queue->unplug_fn = raid5_unplug_queue;
5239 
5240  chunk_size = mddev->chunk_sectors << 9;
5241  blk_queue_io_min(mddev->queue, chunk_size);
5242  blk_queue_io_opt(mddev->queue, chunk_size *
5243  (conf->raid_disks - conf->max_degraded));
5244 
5245  list_for_each_entry(rdev, &mddev->disks, same_set)
5246  disk_stack_limits(mddev->gendisk, rdev->bdev,
5247  rdev->data_offset << 9);
5248  }
5249 
5250  return 0;
5251 abort:
5252  md_unregister_thread(mddev->thread);
5253  mddev->thread = NULL;
5254  if (conf) {
5255  print_raid5_conf(conf);
5256  free_conf(conf);
5257  }
5258  mddev->private = NULL;
5259  printk(KERN_ALERT "md/raid:%s: failed to run raid set.\n", mdname(mddev));
5260  return -EIO;
5261 }
5262 
5263 static int stop(mddev_t *mddev)
5264 {
5265  raid5_conf_t *conf = mddev->private;
5266 
5267  md_unregister_thread(mddev->thread);
5268  mddev->thread = NULL;
5269  if (mddev->queue)
5270  mddev->queue->backing_dev_info.congested_fn = NULL;
5271  plugger_flush(&conf->plug); /* the unplug fn references 'conf'*/
5272  free_conf(conf);
5273  mddev->private = NULL;
5274  mddev->to_remove = &raid5_attrs_group;
5275  return 0;
5276 }
5277 
5278 #ifdef DEBUG
5279 static void print_sh(struct seq_file *seq, struct stripe_head *sh)
5280 {
5281  int i;
5282 
5283  seq_printf(seq, "sh %llu, pd_idx %d, state %ld.\n",
5284  (unsigned long long)sh->sector, sh->pd_idx, sh->state);
5285  seq_printf(seq, "sh %llu, count %d.\n",
5286  (unsigned long long)sh->sector, atomic_read(&sh->count));
5287  seq_printf(seq, "sh %llu, ", (unsigned long long)sh->sector);
5288  for (i = 0; i < sh->disks; i++) {
5289  seq_printf(seq, "(cache%d: %p %ld) ",
5290  i, sh->dev[i].page, sh->dev[i].flags);
5291  }
5292  seq_printf(seq, "\n");
5293 }

5295 static void printall(struct seq_file *seq, raid5_conf_t *conf)
5296 {
5297  struct stripe_head *sh;
5298  struct hlist_node *hn;
5299  int i;
5300 
5301  spin_lock_irq(&conf->device_lock);
5302  for (i = 0; i < NR_HASH; i++) {
5303  hlist_for_each_entry(sh, hn, &conf->stripe_hashtbl[i], hash) {
5304  if (sh->raid_conf != conf)
5305  continue;
5306  print_sh(seq, sh);
5307  }
5308  }
5309  spin_unlock_irq(&conf->device_lock);
5310 }
5311 #endif

5313 static void status(struct seq_file *seq, mddev_t *mddev)
5314 {
5315  raid5_conf_t *conf = mddev->private;
5316  int i;
5317 
5318  seq_printf(seq, " level %d, %dk chunk, algorithm %d", mddev->level,
5319  mddev->chunk_sectors / 2, mddev->layout);
5320  seq_printf (seq, " [%d/%d] [", conf->raid_disks, conf->raid_disks - mddev->degraded);
5321  for (i = 0; i < conf->raid_disks; i++)
5322  seq_printf (seq, "%s",
5323  conf->disks[i].rdev &&
5324  test_bit(In_sync, &conf->disks[i].rdev->flags) ? "U" : "_");
5325  seq_printf (seq, "]");
5326 #ifdef DEBUG
5327  seq_printf (seq, "\n");
5328  printall(seq, conf);
5329 #endif
5330 }

5332 static void print_raid5_conf (raid5_conf_t *conf)
5333 {
5334  int i;
5335  struct disk_info *tmp;
5336 
5337  printk(KERN_DEBUG "RAID conf printout:\n");
5338  if (!conf) {
5339  printk("(conf==NULL)\n");
5340  return;
5341  }
5342  printk(KERN_DEBUG " --- level:%d rd:%d wd:%d\n", conf->level,
5343  conf->raid_disks,
5344  conf->raid_disks - conf->mddev->degraded);
5345 
5346  for (i = 0; i < conf->raid_disks; i++) {
5347  char b[BDEVNAME_SIZE];
5348  tmp = conf->disks + i;
5349  if (tmp->rdev)
5350  printk(KERN_DEBUG " disk %d, o:%d, dev:%s\n",
5351  i, !test_bit(Faulty, &tmp->rdev->flags),
5352  bdevname(tmp->rdev->bdev, b));
5353  }
5354 }
5355 
5356 static int raid5_spare_active(mddev_t *mddev)
5357 {
5358  int i;
5359  raid5_conf_t *conf = mddev->private;
5360  struct disk_info *tmp;
5361  int count = 0;
5362  unsigned long flags;
5363 
5364  for (i = 0; i < conf->raid_disks; i++) {
5365  tmp = conf->disks + i;
5366  if (tmp->rdev
5367  && tmp->rdev->recovery_offset == MaxSector
5368  && !test_bit(Faulty, &tmp->rdev->flags)
5369  && !test_and_set_bit(In_sync, &tmp->rdev->flags)) {
5370  count++;
5371  sysfs_notify_dirent_safe(tmp->rdev->sysfs_state);
5372  }
5373  }
5374  spin_lock_irqsave(&conf->device_lock, flags);
5375  mddev->degraded -= count;
5376  spin_unlock_irqrestore(&conf->device_lock, flags);
5377  print_raid5_conf(conf);
5378  return count;
5379 }
5380 
5381 static int raid5_remove_disk(mddev_t *mddev, int number)
5382 {
5383  raid5_conf_t *conf = mddev->private;
5384  int err = 0;
5385  mdk_rdev_t *rdev;
5386  struct disk_info *p = conf->disks + number;
5387 
5388  print_raid5_conf(conf);
5389  rdev = p->rdev;
5390  if (rdev) {
5391  if (number >= conf->raid_disks &&
5392  conf->reshape_progress == MaxSector)
5393  clear_bit(In_sync, &rdev->flags);
5394 
5395  if (test_bit(In_sync, &rdev->flags) ||
5396  atomic_read(&rdev->nr_pending)) {
5397  err = -EBUSY;
5398  goto abort;
5399  }
5400  /* Only remove non-faulty devices if recovery
5401  * isn't possible.
5402  */
5403  if (!test_bit(Faulty, &rdev->flags) &&
5404  !has_failed(conf) &&
5405  number < conf->raid_disks) {
5406  err = -EBUSY;
5407  goto abort;
5408  }
5409  p->rdev = NULL;
5410  synchronize_rcu();
5411  if (atomic_read(&rdev->nr_pending)) {
5412  /* lost the race, try later */
5413  err = -EBUSY;
5414  p->rdev = rdev;
5415  }
5416  }
5417 abort:
5418 
5419  print_raid5_conf(conf);
5420  return err;
5421 }
5422 
5423 static int raid5_add_disk(mddev_t *mddev, mdk_rdev_t *rdev)
5424 {
5425  raid5_conf_t *conf = mddev->private;
5426  int err = -EEXIST;
5427  int disk;
5428  struct disk_info *p;
5429  int first = 0;
5430  int last = conf->raid_disks - 1;
5431 
5432  if (has_failed(conf))
5433  /* no point adding a device */
5434  return -EINVAL;
5435 
5436  if (rdev->raid_disk >= 0)
5437  first = last = rdev->raid_disk;
5438 
5439  /*
5440  * find the disk ... but prefer rdev->saved_raid_disk
5441  * if possible.
5442  */
5443  if (rdev->saved_raid_disk >= 0 &&
5444  rdev->saved_raid_disk >= first &&
5445  conf->disks[rdev->saved_raid_disk].rdev == NULL)
5446  disk = rdev->saved_raid_disk;
5447  else
5448  disk = first;
5449  for ( ; disk <= last ; disk++)
5450  if ((p=conf->disks + disk)->rdev == NULL) {
5451  clear_bit(In_sync, &rdev->flags);
5452  rdev->raid_disk = disk;
5453  err = 0;
5454  if (rdev->saved_raid_disk != disk)
5455  conf->fullsync = 1;
5456  rcu_assign_pointer(p->rdev, rdev);
5457  break;
5458  }
5459  print_raid5_conf(conf);
5460  return err;
5461 }
5462 
5463 static int raid5_resize(mddev_t *mddev, sector_t sectors)
5464 {
5465  /* no resync is happening, and there is enough space
5466  * on all devices, so we can resize.
5467  * We need to make sure resync covers any new space.
5468  * If the array is shrinking we should possibly wait until
5469  * any io in the removed space completes, but it hardly seems
5470  * worth it.
5471  */
5472  sectors &= ~((sector_t)mddev->chunk_sectors - 1);
5473  md_set_array_sectors(mddev, raid5_size(mddev, sectors,
5474  mddev->raid_disks));
5475  if (mddev->array_sectors >
5476  raid5_size(mddev, sectors, mddev->raid_disks))
5477  return -EINVAL;
5478  set_capacity(mddev->gendisk, mddev->array_sectors);
5479  revalidate_disk(mddev->gendisk);
5480  if (sectors > mddev->dev_sectors && mddev->recovery_cp == MaxSector) {
5481  mddev->recovery_cp = mddev->dev_sectors;
5482  set_bit(MD_RECOVERY_NEEDED, &mddev->recovery);
5483  }
5484  mddev->dev_sectors = sectors;
5485  mddev->resync_max_sectors = sectors;
5486  return 0;
5487 }
5488 
5489 static int check_stripe_cache(mddev_t *mddev)
5490 {
5491  /* Can only proceed if there are plenty of stripe_heads.
5492  * We need a minimum of one full stripe,, and for sensible progress
5493  * it is best to have about 4 times that.
5494  * If we require 4 times, then the default 256 4K stripe_heads will
5495  * allow for chunk sizes up to 256K, which is probably OK.
5496  * If the chunk size is greater, user-space should request more
5497  * stripe_heads first.
5498  */
5499  raid5_conf_t *conf = mddev->private;
5500  if (((mddev->chunk_sectors << 9) / STRIPE_SIZE) * 4
5501  > conf->max_nr_stripes ||
5502  ((mddev->new_chunk_sectors << 9) / STRIPE_SIZE) * 4
5503  > conf->max_nr_stripes) {
5504  printk(KERN_WARNING "md/raid:%s: reshape: not enough stripes. Needed %lu\n",
5505  mdname(mddev),
5506  ((max(mddev->chunk_sectors, mddev->new_chunk_sectors) << 9)
5507  / STRIPE_SIZE)*4);
5508  return 0;
5509  }
5510  return 1;
5511 }
5512 
5513 static int check_reshape(mddev_t *mddev)
5514 {
5515  raid5_conf_t *conf = mddev->private;
5516 
5517  if (mddev->delta_disks == 0 &&
5518  mddev->new_layout == mddev->layout &&
5519  mddev->new_chunk_sectors == mddev->chunk_sectors)
5520  return 0; /* nothing to do */
5521  if (mddev->bitmap)
5522  /* Cannot grow a bitmap yet */
5523  return -EBUSY;
5524  if (has_failed(conf))
5525  return -EINVAL;
5526  if (mddev->delta_disks < 0) {
5527  /* We might be able to shrink, but the devices must
5528  * be made bigger first.
5529  * For raid6, 4 is the minimum size.
5530  * Otherwise 2 is the minimum
5531  */
5532  int min = 2;
5533  if (mddev->level == 6)
5534  min = 4;
5535  if (mddev->raid_disks + mddev->delta_disks < min)
5536  return -EINVAL;
5537  }
5538 
5539  if (!check_stripe_cache(mddev))
5540  return -ENOSPC;
5541 
5542  return resize_stripes(conf, conf->raid_disks + mddev->delta_disks);
5543 }
5544 
5545 static int raid5_start_reshape(mddev_t *mddev)
5546 {
5547  raid5_conf_t *conf = mddev->private;
5548  mdk_rdev_t *rdev;
5549  int spares = 0;
5550  unsigned long flags;
5551 
5552  if (test_bit(MD_RECOVERY_RUNNING, &mddev->recovery))
5553  return -EBUSY;
5554 
5555  if (!check_stripe_cache(mddev))
5556  return -ENOSPC;
5557 
5558  list_for_each_entry(rdev, &mddev->disks, same_set)
5559  if (!test_bit(In_sync, &rdev->flags)
5560  && !test_bit(Faulty, &rdev->flags))
5561  spares++;
5562 
5563  if (spares - mddev->degraded < mddev->delta_disks - conf->max_degraded)
5564  /* Not enough devices even to make a degraded array
5565  * of that size
5566  */
5567  return -EINVAL;
5568 
5569  /* Refuse to reduce size of the array. Any reductions in
5570  * array size must be through explicit setting of array_size
5571  * attribute.
5572  */
5573  if (raid5_size(mddev, 0, conf->raid_disks + mddev->delta_disks)
5574  < mddev->array_sectors) {
5575  printk(KERN_ERR "md/raid:%s: array size must be reduced "
5576  "before number of disks\n", mdname(mddev));
5577  return -EINVAL;
5578  }
5579 
5580  atomic_set(&conf->reshape_stripes, 0);
5581  spin_lock_irq(&conf->device_lock);
5582  conf->previous_raid_disks = conf->raid_disks;
5583  conf->raid_disks += mddev->delta_disks;
5584  conf->prev_chunk_sectors = conf->chunk_sectors;
5585  conf->chunk_sectors = mddev->new_chunk_sectors;
5586  conf->prev_algo = conf->algorithm;
5587  conf->algorithm = mddev->new_layout;
5588  if (mddev->delta_disks < 0)
5589  conf->reshape_progress = raid5_size(mddev, 0, 0);
5590  else
5591  conf->reshape_progress = 0;
5592  conf->reshape_safe = conf->reshape_progress;
5593  conf->generation++;
5594  spin_unlock_irq(&conf->device_lock);
5595 
5596  /* Add some new drives, as many as will fit.
5597  * We know there are enough to make the newly sized array work.
5598  * Don't add devices if we are reducing the number of
5599  * devices in the array. This is because it is not possible
5600  * to correctly record the "partially reconstructed" state of
5601  * such devices during the reshape and confusion could result.
5602  */
5603  if (mddev->delta_disks >= 0) {
5604  int added_devices = 0;
5605  list_for_each_entry(rdev, &mddev->disks, same_set)
5606  if (rdev->raid_disk < 0 &&
5607  !test_bit(Faulty, &rdev->flags)) {
5608  if (raid5_add_disk(mddev, rdev) == 0) {
5609  char nm[20];
5610  if (rdev->raid_disk
5611  >= conf->previous_raid_disks) {
5612  set_bit(In_sync, &rdev->flags);
5613  added_devices++;
5614  } else
5615  rdev->recovery_offset = 0;
5616  sprintf(nm, "rd%d", rdev->raid_disk);
5617  if (sysfs_create_link(&mddev->kobj,
5618  &rdev->kobj, nm))
5619  /* Failure here is OK */;
5620  }
5621  } else if (rdev->raid_disk >= conf->previous_raid_disks
5622  && !test_bit(Faulty, &rdev->flags)) {
5623  /* This is a spare that was manually added */
5624  set_bit(In_sync, &rdev->flags);
5625  added_devices++;
5626  }
5627 
5628  /* When a reshape changes the number of devices,
5629  * ->degraded is measured against the larger of the
5630  * pre and post number of devices.
5631  */
5632  spin_lock_irqsave(&conf->device_lock, flags);
5633  mddev->degraded += (conf->raid_disks - conf->previous_raid_disks)
5634  - added_devices;
5635  spin_unlock_irqrestore(&conf->device_lock, flags);
5636  }
5637  mddev->raid_disks = conf->raid_disks;
5638  mddev->reshape_position = conf->reshape_progress;
5639  set_bit(MD_CHANGE_DEVS, &mddev->flags);
5640 
5641  clear_bit(MD_RECOVERY_SYNC, &mddev->recovery);
5642  clear_bit(MD_RECOVERY_CHECK, &mddev->recovery);
5643  set_bit(MD_RECOVERY_RESHAPE, &mddev->recovery);
5644  set_bit(MD_RECOVERY_RUNNING, &mddev->recovery);
5645  mddev->sync_thread = md_register_thread(md_do_sync, mddev,
5646  "reshape");
5647  if (!mddev->sync_thread) {
5648  mddev->recovery = 0;
5649  spin_lock_irq(&conf->device_lock);
5650  mddev->raid_disks = conf->raid_disks = conf->previous_raid_disks;
5651  conf->reshape_progress = MaxSector;
5652  spin_unlock_irq(&conf->device_lock);
5653  return -EAGAIN;
5654  }
5655  conf->reshape_checkpoint = jiffies;
5656  md_wakeup_thread(mddev->sync_thread);
5657  md_new_event(mddev);
5658  return 0;
5659 }
5660 
5661 /* This is called from the reshape thread and should make any
5662  * changes needed in 'conf'
5663  */
5664 static void end_reshape(raid5_conf_t *conf)
5665 {
5666 
5667  if (!test_bit(MD_RECOVERY_INTR, &conf->mddev->recovery)) {
5668 
5669  spin_lock_irq(&conf->device_lock);
5670  conf->previous_raid_disks = conf->raid_disks;
5671  conf->reshape_progress = MaxSector;
5672  spin_unlock_irq(&conf->device_lock);
5673  wake_up(&conf->wait_for_overlap);
5674 
5675  /* read-ahead size must cover two whole stripes, which is
5676  * 2 * (datadisks) * chunksize where 'n' is the number of raid devices
5677  */
5678  if (conf->mddev->queue) {
5679  int data_disks = conf->raid_disks - conf->max_degraded;
5680  int stripe = data_disks * ((conf->chunk_sectors << 9)
5681  / PAGE_SIZE);
5682  if (conf->mddev->queue->backing_dev_info.ra_pages < 2 * stripe)
5683  conf->mddev->queue->backing_dev_info.ra_pages = 2 * stripe;
5684  }
5685  }
5686 }
5687 
5688 /* This is called from the raid5d thread with mddev_lock held.
5689  * It makes config changes to the device.
5690  */
5691 static void raid5_finish_reshape(mddev_t *mddev)
5692 {
5693  raid5_conf_t *conf = mddev->private;
5694 
5695  if (!test_bit(MD_RECOVERY_INTR, &mddev->recovery)) {
5696 
5697  if (mddev->delta_disks > 0) {
5698  md_set_array_sectors(mddev, raid5_size(mddev, 0, 0));
5699  set_capacity(mddev->gendisk, mddev->array_sectors);
5700  revalidate_disk(mddev->gendisk);
5701  } else {
5702  int d;
5703  mddev->degraded = conf->raid_disks;
5704  for (d = 0; d < conf->raid_disks ; d++)
5705  if (conf->disks[d].rdev &&
5706  test_bit(In_sync,
5707  &conf->disks[d].rdev->flags))
5708  mddev->degraded--;
5709  for (d = conf->raid_disks ;
5710  d < conf->raid_disks - mddev->delta_disks;
5711  d++) {
5712  mdk_rdev_t *rdev = conf->disks[d].rdev;
5713  if (rdev && raid5_remove_disk(mddev, d) == 0) {
5714  char nm[20];
5715  sprintf(nm, "rd%d", rdev->raid_disk);
5716  sysfs_remove_link(&mddev->kobj, nm);
5717  rdev->raid_disk = -1;
5718  }
5719  }
5720  }
5721  mddev->layout = conf->algorithm;
5722  mddev->chunk_sectors = conf->chunk_sectors;
5723  mddev->reshape_position = MaxSector;
5724  mddev->delta_disks = 0;
5725  }
5726 }
5727 
5728 static void raid5_quiesce(mddev_t *mddev, int state)
5729 {
5730  raid5_conf_t *conf = mddev->private;
5731 
5732  switch(state) {
5733  case 2: /* resume for a suspend */
5734  wake_up(&conf->wait_for_overlap);
5735  break;
5736 
5737  case 1: /* stop all writes */
5738  spin_lock_irq(&conf->device_lock);
5739  /* '2' tells resync/reshape to pause so that all
5740  * active stripes can drain
5741  */
5742  conf->quiesce = 2;
5743  wait_event_lock_irq(conf->wait_for_stripe,
5744  atomic_read(&conf->active_stripes) == 0 &&
5745  atomic_read(&conf->active_aligned_reads) == 0,
5746  conf->device_lock, /* nothing */);
5747  conf->quiesce = 1;
5748  spin_unlock_irq(&conf->device_lock);
5749  /* allow reshape to continue */
5750  wake_up(&conf->wait_for_overlap);
5751  break;
5752 
5753  case 0: /* re-enable writes */
5754  spin_lock_irq(&conf->device_lock);
5755  conf->quiesce = 0;
5756  wake_up(&conf->wait_for_stripe);
5757  wake_up(&conf->wait_for_overlap);
5758  spin_unlock_irq(&conf->device_lock);
5759  break;
5760  }
5761 }
5762 
5763 
5764 static void *raid45_takeover_raid0(mddev_t *mddev, int level)
5765 {
5766  struct raid0_private_data *raid0_priv = mddev->private;
5767 
5768  /* for raid0 takeover only one zone is supported */
5769  if (raid0_priv->nr_strip_zones > 1) {
5770  printk(KERN_ERR "md/raid:%s: cannot takeover raid0 with more than one zone.\n",
5771  mdname(mddev));
5772  return ERR_PTR(-EINVAL);
5773  }
5774 
5775  mddev->new_level = level;
5776  mddev->new_layout = ALGORITHM_PARITY_N;
5777  mddev->new_chunk_sectors = mddev->chunk_sectors;
5778  mddev->raid_disks += 1;
5779  mddev->delta_disks = 1;
5780  /* make sure it will be not marked as dirty */
5781  mddev->recovery_cp = MaxSector;
5782 
5783  return setup_conf(mddev);
5784 }
5785 
5786 
5787 static void *raid5_takeover_raid1(mddev_t *mddev)
5788 {
5789  int chunksect;
5790 
5791  if (mddev->raid_disks != 2 ||
5792  mddev->degraded > 1)
5793  return ERR_PTR(-EINVAL);
5794 
5795  /* Should check if there are write-behind devices? */
5796 
5797  chunksect = 64*2; /* 64K by default */
5798 
5799  /* The array must be an exact multiple of chunksize */
5800  while (chunksect && (mddev->array_sectors & (chunksect-1)))
5801  chunksect >>= 1;
5802 
5803  if ((chunksect<<9) < STRIPE_SIZE)
5804  /* array size does not allow a suitable chunk size */
5805  return ERR_PTR(-EINVAL);
5806 
5807  mddev->new_level = 5;
5808  mddev->new_layout = ALGORITHM_LEFT_SYMMETRIC;
5809  mddev->new_chunk_sectors = chunksect;
5810 
5811  return setup_conf(mddev);
5812 }
5813 
5814 static void *raid5_takeover_raid6(mddev_t *mddev)
5815 {
5816  int new_layout;
5817 
5818  switch (mddev->layout) {
5819  case ALGORITHM_LEFT_ASYMMETRIC_6:
5820  new_layout = ALGORITHM_LEFT_ASYMMETRIC;
5821  break;
5822  case ALGORITHM_RIGHT_ASYMMETRIC_6:
5823  new_layout = ALGORITHM_RIGHT_ASYMMETRIC;
5824  break;
5825  case ALGORITHM_LEFT_SYMMETRIC_6:
5826  new_layout = ALGORITHM_LEFT_SYMMETRIC;
5827  break;
5828  case ALGORITHM_RIGHT_SYMMETRIC_6:
5829  new_layout = ALGORITHM_RIGHT_SYMMETRIC;
5830  break;
5831  case ALGORITHM_PARITY_0_6:
5832  new_layout = ALGORITHM_PARITY_0;
5833  break;
5834  case ALGORITHM_PARITY_N:
5835  new_layout = ALGORITHM_PARITY_N;
5836  break;
5837  default:
5838  return ERR_PTR(-EINVAL);
5839  }
5840  mddev->new_level = 5;
5841  mddev->new_layout = new_layout;
5842  mddev->delta_disks = -1;
5843  mddev->raid_disks -= 1;
5844  return setup_conf(mddev);
5845 }
5846 
5847 
5848 static int raid5_check_reshape(mddev_t *mddev)
5849 {
5850  /* For a 2-drive array, the layout and chunk size can be changed
5851  * immediately as not restriping is needed.
5852  * For larger arrays we record the new value - after validation
5853  * to be used by a reshape pass.
5854  */
5855  raid5_conf_t *conf = mddev->private;
5856  int new_chunk = mddev->new_chunk_sectors;
5857 
5858  if (mddev->new_layout >= 0 && !algorithm_valid_raid5(mddev->new_layout))
5859  return -EINVAL;
5860  if (new_chunk > 0) {
5861  if (!is_power_of_2(new_chunk))
5862  return -EINVAL;
5863  if (new_chunk < (PAGE_SIZE>>9))
5864  return -EINVAL;
5865  if (mddev->array_sectors & (new_chunk-1))
5866  /* not factor of array size */
5867  return -EINVAL;
5868  }
5869 
5870  /* They look valid */
5871 
5872  if (mddev->raid_disks == 2) {
5873  /* can make the change immediately */
5874  if (mddev->new_layout >= 0) {
5875  conf->algorithm = mddev->new_layout;
5876  mddev->layout = mddev->new_layout;
5877  }
5878  if (new_chunk > 0) {
5879  conf->chunk_sectors = new_chunk ;
5880  mddev->chunk_sectors = new_chunk;
5881  }
5882  set_bit(MD_CHANGE_DEVS, &mddev->flags);
5883  md_wakeup_thread(mddev->thread);
5884  }
5885  return check_reshape(mddev);
5886 }
5887 
5888 static int raid6_check_reshape(mddev_t *mddev)
5889 {
5890  int new_chunk = mddev->new_chunk_sectors;
5891 
5892  if (mddev->new_layout >= 0 && !algorithm_valid_raid6(mddev->new_layout))
5893  return -EINVAL;
5894  if (new_chunk > 0) {
5895  if (!is_power_of_2(new_chunk))
5896  return -EINVAL;
5897  if (new_chunk < (PAGE_SIZE >> 9))
5898  return -EINVAL;
5899  if (mddev->array_sectors & (new_chunk-1))
5900  /* not factor of array size */
5901  return -EINVAL;
5902  }
5903 
5904  /* They look valid */
5905  return check_reshape(mddev);
5906 }
5907 
5908 static void *raid5_takeover(mddev_t *mddev)
5909 {
5910  /* raid5 can take over:
5911  * raid0 - if there is only one strip zone - make it a raid4 layout
5912  * raid1 - if there are two drives. We need to know the chunk size
5913  * raid4 - trivial - just use a raid4 layout.
5914  * raid6 - Providing it is a *_6 layout
5915  */
5916  if (mddev->level == 0)
5917  return raid45_takeover_raid0(mddev, 5);
5918  if (mddev->level == 1)
5919  return raid5_takeover_raid1(mddev);
5920  if (mddev->level == 4) {
5921  mddev->new_layout = ALGORITHM_PARITY_N;
5922  mddev->new_level = 5;
5923  return setup_conf(mddev);
5924  }
5925  if (mddev->level == 6)
5926  return raid5_takeover_raid6(mddev);
5927 
5928  return ERR_PTR(-EINVAL);
5929 }
5930 
5931 static void *raid4_takeover(mddev_t *mddev)
5932 {
5933  /* raid4 can take over:
5934  * raid0 - if there is only one strip zone
5935  * raid5 - if layout is right
5936  */
5937  if (mddev->level == 0)
5938  return raid45_takeover_raid0(mddev, 4);
5939  if (mddev->level == 5 &&
5940  mddev->layout == ALGORITHM_PARITY_N) {
5941  mddev->new_layout = 0;
5942  mddev->new_level = 4;
5943  return setup_conf(mddev);
5944  }
5945  return ERR_PTR(-EINVAL);
5946 }
5947 
5948 static struct mdk_personality raid5_personality;
5949 
5950 static void *raid6_takeover(mddev_t *mddev)
5951 {
5952  /* Currently can only take over a raid5. We map the
5953  * personality to an equivalent raid6 personality
5954  * with the Q block at the end.
5955  */
5956  int new_layout;
5957 
5958  if (mddev->pers != &raid5_personality)
5959  return ERR_PTR(-EINVAL);
5960  if (mddev->degraded > 1)
5961  return ERR_PTR(-EINVAL);
5962  if (mddev->raid_disks > 253)
5963  return ERR_PTR(-EINVAL);
5964  if (mddev->raid_disks < 3)
5965  return ERR_PTR(-EINVAL);
5966 
5967  switch (mddev->layout) {
5968  case ALGORITHM_LEFT_ASYMMETRIC:
5969  new_layout = ALGORITHM_LEFT_ASYMMETRIC_6;
5970  break;
5971  case ALGORITHM_RIGHT_ASYMMETRIC:
5972  new_layout = ALGORITHM_RIGHT_ASYMMETRIC_6;
5973  break;
5974  case ALGORITHM_LEFT_SYMMETRIC:
5975  new_layout = ALGORITHM_LEFT_SYMMETRIC_6;
5976  break;
5977  case ALGORITHM_RIGHT_SYMMETRIC:
5978  new_layout = ALGORITHM_RIGHT_SYMMETRIC_6;
5979  break;
5980  case ALGORITHM_PARITY_0:
5981  new_layout = ALGORITHM_PARITY_0_6;
5982  break;
5983  case ALGORITHM_PARITY_N:
5984  new_layout = ALGORITHM_PARITY_N;
5985  break;
5986  default:
5987  return ERR_PTR(-EINVAL);
5988  }
5989  mddev->new_level = 6;
5990  mddev->new_layout = new_layout;
5991  mddev->delta_disks = 1;
5992  mddev->raid_disks += 1;
5993  return setup_conf(mddev);
5994 }
